description:
Tasty food nice and very friendly staff ... Krisha-Anne you were great! 

Food is like in all Hard Rock Cafes 

Drinks are great try the Hurricane!!!!

Good place to be at Pier 39
author: Michael H.

description:
I came here with my mom for lunch on a Saturday at about 11:30am. I've been Hard Rock Cafe in other locations, but unfortunately it was the most disappointed I've ever been. We were seated right away, but in the back in a dark area that reeked of weed. When my mom asked to move tables to front, the hostess first told us if she didn't know if there was enough space (the restaurant was nearly empty), but then hastily agreed to move us. I will say the waitress who took our order was a lot nicer though.

We waited nearly 30 minutes for a food, and the waitress kept assuring us it would be out shortly (like I said earlier, nearly EMPTY restaurant). 

We ordered the Classic Waldorf Salad which came with kale/spinach, green apples, pomegranate seeds, grapes, celery, walnuts, and a herb ranch dressing on the side. It was okay, the pomegranate seeds were probably the best part of the dish. The chicken was cooked find but didn't have much flavor at all. 

We also ordered the Black Bean and Quinoa Burger, which sounded yummy but was completely bland...zero flavor. The patty was also soggy and kept falling apart. The waitress offered to take it back, but we didn't have time to wait for a new dish to come out. The fries were good though. 

Overall, while our waitress was VERY nice and tried to offer us a free sundae as an apology, I was not impressed and probably would not come back to this particular location.
author: April L.

description:
Terrible Service 4/10
Food was decent but it took an hour and a half.
Took them an hour to give us a drink. 
The desert was amazing though so 7/10 for that.
author: Lexi P.

description:
Compared to Vegas. This place is terrible. Service , food, everything. 
Came with a party of 17. It was the first time my bfs entire family came out to the city and have lunch together. Took 1 hour 20 mins to get seated.
The food came out an hour later which was really irritating. The servers never came to check up on the table. The food was average nothing special.
author: Emily L.

description:
I had time to kill and took my kids down the piers in San Francisco. I've never come to this Hard Rock and figured I'd give it a try. I was seated pretty fast and staff was very friendly. I was brought water quickly and we were given menus and and some info on the menu by an awesome waiter.

We went to wash our hands in the bathroom and it was clean and fresh. This is important to me where I eat.

We ordered, I ordered the classic Waldorf salad and my kids ordered hot dogs. Yeah that's right, my kids ordered hot dogs. I'm in San Francisco on the pier and my kids can't see past hot dogs and fries...  OK, that's fine, I'm over it... They were happy with their meal choice and the waiter kept bringing them refills for their drinks. My kids were happier than a hog in mud.

I don't know much about Waldorf salads, but mine was delicious.  My salad seemed to have a perfect portion of everything, making it a pleasure down to the last leaf.

So to wrap up Hard Rock....

Service - A
Food - B+
Cleanliness - B+
Ambiance - A

I think you know what you're getting when you walk into a Hard Rock, it's trendy, great service and food that is pretty yummy.
author: Desmond S.

description:
One of the has been. Used to be great in the 90s. So hard to catch up these days. Ordered a latte. Not sure they only served the way my pic is posted. 
But location wise,
author: Ozal U.

description: Hostess were not the friendliest ...she entered the wrong phone too and I had to go back and let her know I didn't get my text message...we had a 45 minute wait which was to be expected due to Fleet week but when I got my message saying the table was ready the lady/ hostess ?? Yelled at me to go to the other lady if we want a table and I said excuse me you messaged me and said my table is ready?! She then demanded an employee to seat us  at table 43 and the employee said ...o man!! What I need to put toilet paper in the bathroom! I was think wow! But she reluctantly seated us anyhow....nothing like feeling welcomed ....food was ok ...dessert was bomb ...service was alright. Good atmosphere
author: Harriett U.

description: We came here because the wait everywhere else was too long. We sat at the bar and had no problem getting served right away. The bartenders were all very friendly and pleasant. We ordered the wings, ribs, and classic burger. Everything was great!
author: Samuel F.

description:
I came here with a friend after exploring the wharf.

I honestly wasn't too impressed with the quality of the food considering how pricey it is. I ordered a burger which came out to about $18. In my opinion, if I'm paying that much for a burger, it better be awesome AF.

The burger, however, was incredibly tasteless and hard. Even with condiments, it didn't really have much flavor and it made me a little sad. I tried to finish it but I really couldn't do it. I would have been better off ordering from Wendy's or McDonald's.

The service was also very sporadic. It was hard getting our server's attention, and he only came by a couple of times to check in on us. One of those times he forgot to bring my friend's refill. I don't blame the server for this - he was doing the best he could with all the tables he was responsible for. They are just short staffed here. 

The one redeeming part of my experience here was the sundae that my friend and I split. That WAS delicious.
author: Merisenda A.

description: Typical trendy bar with nothing special to write home about. The bartender was friendly, food and drinks were average.
author: L B.

description: Front staff service sucks ass. Slow turn around. Freezer to fryer food. No thought  process when sitting people with kids and strollers at close tables in bar area right in walking paths. Fiancé had to help him self to get a high chair since the host just brought us to the table. Basically walked up the stairs told us to walk around the to the ramp and then meet her at the table. Noah is the only reason they got 3 stars. His energy and willingness to take care of us  made it decent enough to stay. Probably would never visit again just based on the food and front staff.
author: Chaulzy S.

description:
I don't know what it is about the Hard Rock Cafe that makes me like it so much.  I've been to their locations in half a dozen countries & have probably been to over a dozen, total.  Yes, I'm a music fan.  And I'm also a fan of kitschy pop culture & buying souvenirs, which the Rock Shops have in spades.  But I also like consistency in quality & service, which has also been my experience at Hard Rock Cafes across the board.

Their San Francisco location is no exception.  Though I couldn't convince coworkers to join me while visiting for a conference, I'm just fine going it alone & enjoyed my usual selection of Twisted Mac, Chicken & Cheese.  

There are arguably better & more affordable options within walking distance, but if you're familiar with the brand & have enjoyed it elsewhere, you won't go wrong with a nice, casual meal here.
author: Shawn F.

description:
Hickory burger (4/5)
The meat was cooked perfectly and the flavor was rock solid. Bonus happiness for the giant piece of bacon. 

Classic nachos with grilled chicken (3.5/5)
This extra large appetizer is made to be shared with at least 4 people. The cheese was cold and didn't melt when you pulled the chips apart but the other toppings made up for the clumpy cheese.

Service (5/5)
Our server, Noah, went above and beyond. He was friendly, funny, and a ball of energy.

The place was a little pricey but it's as expected because of its tourist location. Overall, we would come here again.
author: Eliza N.

description: I loved my first experience in a Hard Rock Cafe! The novelty of it all is part of the great experience. I've always wanted to eat at one and I was not disappointed. They have music videos playing in the background as you eat and they have rock memorabilia along the walls. Lastly, the food was delicious and so flavorful. The prices are really high for what you get but it's also the atmosphere of the restaurant and it's truly an experience that is worth the money. Highly recommend and I really enjoyed it.
author: Marley M.

description:
Stopped in for lunch and ordered the chicken fajitas. I was pleased with the large portion and ample accompaniments. The chicken was undercooked. This is a problem. You should never serve undercooked chicken and every cook knows that. This should have never left the kitchen. I sent it back and asked for it to cook a little longer. 
It came back not cooked, but flamed with the harsh taste of meat that has been cooked by fire instead of heat. From one extreme to the other. 
The servers were excellent and the atmosphere very nice. 
Hopefully the kitchen will match the rest of the staff in quality soon.
author: Stephen D.

description: Fast and friendly service. Seated straight away when stopped in for lunch. Ordered the chicken flat bread to share, food was delicious and cooked well. Waitress was efficient and friendly.
author: Rebecca W.

description:
This American restaurant isn't what I thought it would be. Ok, I admit I went in 830 at night, but service was unbearably slow. Went in and the hostess told the gentleman in front of me, wait time would be half hour unless you sit at the bar. My friend and I decided the bar was the best option. We got no service, with one bartender on duty. She did take a sec to tell us she would be right with us. My party ended up moving to a  high table in the bar area and got far better service. 
Food was good not great, but edible. I will say I don't know if it was San Francisco or just the Hard Rock, but it was pricey.
author: Scott H.

description:
Buy a shirt and leave.  Restaurant is terrible!  Slow service.  No one could find a manager.  

Ordered the vegan burger with guacamole.  No guacamole came on it but they sure did slap a big piece of cheese on it.   

I ordered a lemon drop martini that tasted horrible.  No sugar rim.  I don't think the girl tending the bars knew how to make a drink and watching them try was painful.
author: Linda S.

description:
Excellent food and great service. Definitely worth the brand.

The checked fajitas are yum and their grilled wings are something out of this world.
author: Bobby S.

description: Great location, friendly service and accommodating for our larger group. I do not recommend their cauliflower wings though. They tasted like soggy Tabasco sauce-breaded vegetable.
author: Becky K.

description:
I literally could have ordered in grub hub or dominos pizza delivery and still gotten food before we got our food arrived at our table from the kitchen. We sat down at 7:30, food arrived at 8:30. Management came by offering chips and salsa, or dessert, but frankly we were so fed up we said no. 

Now upgrading to 2 stars - they gave us 50% off our bill. Still won't come back, but less pissed.
author: S C.

description: Best cafe with great service, food and music. Lots of menu options for veggie too. Loved their beer.
author: Vineet S.

description:
This restaurant is getting four stars because the food is great, as they offer a wide variety on the menu. The only downside is that this restaurant is located in the heart of the tourist district in San Francisco. It is super crowded, and the wait is long! That did not stop the servers and bartenders from being polite, however. If the wait is long (probably close to 45 minutes to an hour), get a pager and walk around the wharf. 

Need to get in and out quickly? Have a seat at the bar. You can order all of the food from the bar, as well as dessert and drinks.

The portions here are huge! Plan to split meals if you were wanting to save room for dessert. In fact, make sure you save room for dessert! The Apple cobbler is delicious.

Don't forget to get a sweet picture in front of the guitar out front of the restaurant. Feel free to pick up some paraphernalia from the gift shop while you wait for your meal. Eating at this restaurant is definitely a touristy thing to do... Plus the food is great! Tons of variety, so you can easily please all members of your group.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Hard Rock Cafe is more of an gimmick tourist destination than an actual foodie central. While I enjoy the ambiance and atmosphere of HRC, the food is hardly on par with everything else in the restaurant. 

Service: I forget the name of our waiter, but he was fantastic. He checked up on us regularly without becoming too intrusive and refilled drinks consistently. 

Food: We ordered The Big Cheeseburger and The Original Legendary Cheeseburger with french fries. While I was actually impressed that the burgers actually looked like the ones portrayed on the menu, the food was not that good. Both of the burgers were overcooked and lacked any flavor or taste. A burger from In-n-Out tasted better than the $20 burgers here. 

It was a bit disturbing to see our waiter get into it with the hostess/host because of lack of communication. There was a table of 3 tourists who sat themselves at an empty table (there were at least 4 open tables during the afternoon) and our waiter proceeded to retrieve their drink and food orders. While the waiter left to put in the order, the host staff came over and kicked the three tourists out while sweeping up all the utensils and napkins from table. Imagine our waiter's surprise when he came back to an empty table without diners! They later sorted out the situation and sat the 3 tourists back at their same table. It was a scene seeing the host staff and our waiter bickering over it for a few minutes.  

Sadly, I enjoyed the gift shop more than my dining experience here.
author: Philip M.

description: We were in the area so we decided to swing in for a quick family dinner , given that it's hard rock and the music history etc. why not ! Look the atmosphere is great for a date night/night out, but to me not very kid-Friendly... now the server was a tall light skinned woman with short hair. She had another table who I felt was was a little more tentative to.... hmmm ok. So that was that. Then the menu I just wasn't a fan of. Nothing really healthy or many options . For the kids nothing really either. It would be ok if I we were out on a lunch date but for dinner I wouldn't recommend because the menu options suck unless your a big cheeseburger eater . So we ended up leaving. Didn't order anything, figured it would be a complete was for $120.00 family meal. Instead we left to eat pupusas and saved $80.00
author: Adriana C.

description:
Great service and the fajitas was really good 
Will go back on our next city stop the server was very accommodating due to the fact that I had a cold offer to bring me hot tea with lemon
author: Vivian R.

description:
Team members inside the store and restaurant were awesome, great personalities. Food was great.  
We stop by here each visit to SF.
author: Susan M.

description: Worst service ever. Won't be coming back. Save urself irritation and eat somewhere else.
author: Samantha O.

description: This is a fine restaurant. Clean, organized with trained staff that are knowledgable about their food menu. The cafe runs efficiently and smoothly. Clean restrooms that are serviced often. This restaurant finds itself in very busy Fisherman's Wharf and while we had reservations and got right in others were not as lucky. The food is decent -nothing spectacular. If you are looking for a safe solid choice then this is one of them. If your looking for something that offers a more San Francisco experience then do not eat here. So many other options available.
author: Alexandra L.

description:
I'm an unabashed HRC fan. I've been pin-collecting and dining since 1990-ish. Whenever I go to a new city that has a HRC, it's an absolute given that we'll be visiting it. Luckily hubby and I both like the food, too.
I tried the new cauliflower patty meatless burger and I loved it! I upgraded my fries to the Parmesan Oregano and they were delicious. 
Another very satisfying visit to a HRC!
Fun fact: SF HRC is the first time ever that I bought 2 pins -- I just couldn't decide between the Fishermans Wharf with spinning ship's wheel and the Lombard Street one with a little car cruising down it.
author: Karey R.

description:
Sub standard service. Aloof and cold waitstaff, bartenders and hostesses. With a multitude of
Options at Pier 39, I'm convinced they survive on name only. Major re-training is needed for all employees. Very disappointed
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Ambiance was great, and the food and drinks were amazing as usual. Server was nice, attentive and was always making sure we were doing alright. I had the Sam Adams beer, as did my friends, and it was great. My friend had a burger and it was delicious!

My only advice to management (hence 4 stars instead of 5) is that they seemed very slow/understaffed on the host side of things. They were clearing tables faster than they could seat people and the waiting area is tiny. We had to sit on a bench in the street for about 45-60 minutes waiting for our buzzer to go. It was just 2 girls going back and forth like crazy, so It's not on them, they were trying so hard. They need to have another hostess and have a little more efficiency in sitting people, especially on a Saturday night in such a location.

Overall great experience though. Thanks HRC!
author: Jairo M.

description: Meh... this place is just ok.  Food was average. The atmosphere was loud. And the service was pretty bad.  Half of the restaurant was empty even though we waited 30 minutes to be seated. Our sever didn't come to the table for almost 10 minutes.  After we got our food, we didn't see the waiter again for basically the rest of the meal when he showed up with the check. Our food came out luke warm and one could tell it had been sitting for a bit.  Food wasn't terrible but I also wouldn't categorize it as good either.  It was just ok.  I don't think I need to eat there again.
author: Lauren W.

description:
It was my first time at any Hard Rock Cafe. I came with my fiancé for our anniversary. While it took a little longer than normal(it was a holiday so I'll give them the benefit of the doubt but 45 to 50 minutes is pushing it a little), Shane the manager that evening and Noah our server went above and beyond to show that service was a very high priority to them and our experience and business was crucial to their evening. 

I've been to multiple restaurants where when a problem arises there is immediate blame placed on one or multiple other people. At some point the excuses just don't cut it. Shane and Noah both took immediate personal responsibility for the issues that came up and took actions to fix them right away. 

Even if everything doesn't always work out the way YOU expect, both of these guys (Noah/Shane) will work their hardest to ensure your experience meets their standards. 

Highly recommend this location and was overall happy with my experience.
author: Milan M.

description:
This was an awful experience. We had a reservation for 45 people and we asked them if they had any Vegan options. They said yes and so without asking for specifics we booked our reservation. Their idea of a vegan option was just a bowl of lettuce - no tomatoes, no onions or anything else.  Then they had to ask everyone what kind of dressing they wanted more than once, really no attention to detail by the waitstaff.

This is just plain laziness and very disrespectful. No effort on their part to even try to accommodate to their vegan customers. On top of that it took 3 times for them to get my soda order correct and the other serving sizes were very small. One student counted 8 total french fries on her plate. We had to order appetizers after the meal just to barely feed everyone sufficiently. The waitstaff was also very short and curt when we asked about any other vegan options. So - very poor service, very poor food and I highly doubt if they care one bit since they serve mostly tourist.  Our two vegan guest had to leave the restaurant and look for a decent meal elsewhere. Despicable.
author: Tim S.

description: This place was was the right choice for great food and drinks, everything was done correctly and look for Noah when u get there he is probably the most knowledgeable one in there when it comes to the food and the drinks. We had a great time and would definitely recommend this spot to anyone visiting the wharf, we will be back
author: Ron V.

description:
What a terrible experience. We are visiting for a friends bday and I decided to take them to hard rock bc I have always had great experiences there. Definitely this location!

We all got salads which came out wrong with the wrong dressings, so had to wait for that. A manager was stopping by all the tables and we asked for refills bc we couldn't get our waiters attention.

3 of 4 of our entrees came out with mine being the missing. It literally did not come out till the rest of my party had waited 10 minutes to be considerate, and then ate and almost finished their food bc it was getting cold. 

We struggled to get our waiters attention for refills and still had members of our party that never got one. And when I finally got one, my waiter decided to reach in front of me and rub his arms across my already late French fries which I obviously did not want to eat then. 

I appreciate the fact that a manager, 2nd and different one, came over and said she would comp my meal, and even verbatim said "it's obvious we aren't very busy now and I've seen t a lot worse". but when the bill came, We were still partially charged for it which is utter crap. More should've been done and followed through with! Not cool sliding that in. 

Our waiter came back with the check and said "just sign the top one, thanks guys" with the attitude that was so obviously fake it was irritating and unprofessional. A 3rd manager came by and asked how everything was, we told him the truth and how we were disappointed, to which he said "I'm sorry and hope you come back" 

3 different managers still terrible service. We will definitely be reaching out to corporate.
author: Kevin M.

description:
I'm giving 4 stars not because things where perfect because they where not. However the management went above and beyond to accommodate us. The food was pretty good over all. We ordered a jumbo sampler and some nachos. The jumbo sampler had some chicken strips that where a little over cooked. The nachos where tasty. Thank you Johnny for taking care of us.

You Rock!
author: Chris D.

description: What is there to say. Its a Hard Rock. Only reason we came here is because we were starving and not patient enough to eat some real good food that day. Its noisy (its hard rock) , cleanliness, I give it a 6 out of 10. Food was ok (cant mess up basic menu food), service was ok, food came out in a reasonable time. Overall opinion, if your a tourist from Europe and its a dream of yours to eat at a hard rock, go for it, if your visiting from somewhere in the US, do yourself a favor and take the time to treat yourself and eat some good SF food
author: Maurice R.

description:
Probably the ultimate tourist trap in every city it exists, but still a fun little item to check off your "been there done that" list. So, stop in and get your obligatory collectible souvenir. Food is mostly just okay. But then again, you're not really here for the food. You're here for the souvenirs and the rock memorabilia.

They moved it to Pier 39 back in 2002. I hadn't been here since the late 1990s and back then the Hard Rock Cafe was off of Van Ness and Sacramento Street. I was surprised to be strolling along Pier 39 and see it's now there. It certainly makes more business sense for it to be on Pier 39.
author: Chad K.

description: Service is slow, the tourist don't mind though. But if your a local you are going to be waiting a while for your order and getting your order mixed up. Also was not escorted to the bar seating area. You have to grab your own menus and silver ware. On top of that I ordered a Shock Top, and a Budlight was brought and still charged for a Shock Top. As a local I won't visit this place, read reviews first!!!!!
author: Erik P.

description: Place was not even busy and it took a while to serve us. It felt like we didn't even existed.
author: Chan Z.

description: Worst experience I've ever had at one of the fine hard rock cafe locations, my family and I came to celebrate my sister's 21th birthday and the bartender? Kirsha made us feel less than unwelcome, we waited 10 min at the bar being glared while being the only patrons at the bar, received a flat coke for my baby sister twice, when asked to replace she said "there's nothing I can do". All while being really attentative to all the other customers around us.... maybe because we were the only colored folks at the bar?? Definitely won't be back and won't recommend to any friends... very disappointed in my sister's 21st bday experience...
author: Javier D.

description: Let me start by saying I am a Hard Rock fanatic and this was the part of my San Fran trip that I was most looking forward to!  That being said, I was a bit disappointed.  I was there on a Saturday around noon.  I got a seat at the bar by myself and the crowd grew quickly after that.  The decor was very cool and I loved the ceiling above the bar. My bartender/waitress was [name redacted because I realized how crappy it was to call a specific person out], who was extremely overwhelmed.  When the lady next to me asked for a menu, she snapped "yeah, you need to give me a minute!".  I ordered a drink in a hurricane glass which was good and the clam chowder bread bowl, which was great!  I needed to run to the bathroom and asked the bartender if she could please just keep my drink behind the bar for a minute since I was a female sitting there alone, and she said to just keep it at my place and she would watch it.  When I came back she was nowhere to be found, so I wish she would've just put it behind the bar like I asked.  Also, the bathroom had 2 stalls that were out of order (out of only 4 total) so I waited a very long time in line.  Lastly, I had placed my credit card with my bill to pay, but she didn't pick it up for another 15 minutes, so I was kind of stranded there.  I'm guessing they were just really understaffed this day, but I just didn't get the friendly, happy vibe that I have become accustomed to with Hard Rocks.
author: Colleen C.

description:
I last visited this restaurant about five years ago. My girlfriend and I dropped in about 11.30 am today (a Friday); there were only a couple of customers tucked away in dark corners, so we initially thought the place wasn't open for some reason. However, we were allowed to choose our own table and the servers were friendly.

I recalled ordering a pretty good vegeburger the last time I was here; however the waiter informed me that they no longer served that item...it had been replaced by a "Cauliflower Burger". The only other 'vegetarian' option was (wait for it) Cauliflower Wings...like buffalo wings but with cauliflower.

My girlfriend order the cauliflower wings (which she pronounced 'good' - but left mostly uneaten). She didn't enjoy the atmosphere; I got more of the vibe, but felt that it was not as 'hip and happening' as it was half a decade ago. Maybe I am growing old? I asked for French fries & onion rings (washed down with beer) and made the best of it; they were not bad.

The waiter (Ernesto) was a decent pleasant person. He disappeared for a while and returned with a delicious Sundae for my sweetheart (having heard that her birthday is a couple of days hence). 

4 stars because Ernesto is a star.
author: Jack W.

description:
I'm perfectly fine that HRC is a total tourist trap... when by the wharf, why not right? I guess my main issue is how inconsistent and flighty the service is. 

Nothing much wrong with the food but nothing remarkable either. Think comfort food that is what tourists expect typical American food is. Including the big portions. Think burgers, wings, steak, bbq and more. I had the hickory smoked pulled pork sandwich and it was decent. The meat was fall apart tender and while the you don't really get the hickory flavor, the bbq sauce keeps it moist albeit a little generic. It's a big serving for lunch though when you add in the heaping amount of fries. 
 
Our server was friendly when around but disappeared for over 15 mins after dropping off our check. We wanted to pay but nobody else would take our cards even though it was obvious we weren't being served and they weren't busy. Must be a managerial policy but absolutely flawed. They work on tourist time so don't expect speedy service if you need to have lunch on the clock.
author: Jon L.

description:
Didn't even eat here. The staff at the front were very rude and unhelpful. After telling us the wait was 30 minutes, we were told we could sit at the bar, counter top available but the main restaurant was closed due to a large party of Girl Scouts.  After that we were told that if we were to wait for a table, the wait was an hour or more. We called them on the time difference only to be told "the girl that told you, just came on, she doesn't know!"  Well, you were standing there the entire time, sport...  think you might have mentioned to her she was incorrect?

Too bad too...  we were looking forward to dining at the Hard Rock, but we went someplace better...  Luigi's.  Better atmosphere, pleasant staff...  much better than Hard Rock
author: Chris R.

description: Really bad experience. We sat on the patio, we were told it was seat yourself. We ended up busing our own table, wiping down the table, going around to empty tables around us and taking the menus off the tables. Once the server finally made it to us we gave her our food and drink order since we had been sitting there for sometime. It took forever to get our drinks. We asked for waters and never got them. Once our food was finally delivered it was room temp. Had to go find someone to give us napkins and silverware. The server never checked on us. Then ran out of drinks and never got our water so we went to the bar to order more drinks and get water.  We were there for close to two hours. Poor service, poor management and poor organization when it's busy. Last time I'll ever visit a Hard Rock Cafe.
author: Jen D.

description: Today was the worst experience.  It took 20 minutes just to get my Jumbo Combo and the only the water did was look at me and say, ( really oh I'm sorry).  Top it all of half my stuff is overcooked.  I won't be coming back.
author: Shawn W.

description: Wait ok. Fajitas and kids meals good.  Appetizers and side salad came with meal. Ambiance great
author: Bill H.

description:
Shane Tucker and Tenzin provided excellent customer service . There was a minor mistake regarding our order which they fixed right away and readjusted the bill . We were on a business trip
And raising funds for a national charity/ association. They were unable to donate funds but gave us Gift cards which will be very helpful to raffle off in the future . Thank you to the Hard rock Cafe and Shane Tucker !
author: Jeff B.

description: Worst food I've ever tasted ... the mashed potato tasted like it had been mashed in a dirty old granny's armpit
author: Sarah B.

description: We had a very good experiance here. We did not have to wait to be seated, and it was a very busy Saturday.  My ten year old daughter has celiac and they had several great gluten free options for her.  We ordered a really cool delicious alcohal drink and we received a new souvenir mug with it.  The bathroom were really clean. We received very good service, I wish I could remember their name, but it has been a few months.  I would definitely go back.
author: Denise B.

description:
Omg worst decision ever to have eaten here. We honestly waited about one hour to get our food. Then when I got it all it was inside my pulled pork sandwich was fat. To get someone to take our order I had to get up to ask someone as well as to get the receipt to pay. 

When my cousin asked for refills ... well we never got them. The one star is for the fact that the waiter apologized for forgetting to do so. 

I would somewhat understand if the place would have been packed but it wasn't. 

Never going back again that's for sure.
author: Fatima M.

description: This was my first time here and I had amazing service from Robert. He was amazing. You can tell he truly loves his job I had plenty of questions and he was able to answer them and accommodate me. I also enjoyed how we was so sweet to my little brother he made him a delicious Oreo smoothie. I'm not from San Fran but if I ever come back I will come because or Robert. He's amazing. Keep it up Robert your personality is great and so is your customer service.
author: Jassy G.

description: Probably one of the worst experiences at hard rock ever. It took over a hour to get our food and it was cold when we got it. Our servers switched with someone so we didn't have anyone coming to our table to ask how our food was. Both of our servers wouldn't make eye contact or speak to us. We also had to get up and stop someone for our check. To top it all off we said thank you and the waitress shook her head and walked away. Solid 2/10
author: Casie G.

description: Owner or GM was very rude! I just cruised in for 1  cider and was laughed at - it was 10:45. The  GM was leading a high school styled bully campaign like I was nuts for asking for a beer 15 mins to closing. He's giving the hard rock brand a horrible name.
author: Julie T.

description:
Food 4/5 burgers were good, fries were not great

Ambiance 5/5 fun place, nothing new but still fun.

Server 5/5 nice guy, friendly enough.

Service 2/5 again the server was great, but 90 minutes for some burgers is just too long.

I'm not vowing to never come back, but these folks need to tighten it up quite a bit!
author: zack V.

description: I have been to several hard rock cafes. Los Angeles, Las Vegas and now San Fransisco. Everyone besides this one the staff was friendly and knowledgeable. They messed up our food, never refilled our drinks and it took forever to get our check. The bathroom was dirty and the silverware they gave us was too. It was super pricey for what we were served. Save yourself the time and money and go some where else.
author: Dahnielle H.

description:
Even though I came here a bit growing up, I hadn't been here in years. I don't think I had "high" expectations. 

We got there at 7:20. Ordered food/drinks by 7:30 and then got out drinks within 5 minutes. We then waited for our food until 8:10, we asked to see the manager and he said he would check on our food. By 8:25 our table got most of our food, but everything was COLD. Not like slightly cold, but like it had been sitting there for 20-30 minutes cold. And we were still missing food!! 

We asked for the manager to come back out and he apologized for it all and went and got the missing food. That was cold too!! 

Someone in our party ordered a chicken burger....she started eating it and it wasn't cooked all the way through!! Like what the heck?! We got the manager again and he had the cooks make all her food fresh. By the time we ALL had our cold, but edible food it was past 9:00. 

Mind you, we hadn't even SEEN our waiter since he dropped off the drinks. 

The manager DID end up paying for our meal, so a giant thank you to him. But overall, not a great experience, and sadly I don't think I will be going back.
author: Sara A.

description: Living in the east bay, loved to come here have some drinks, enjoy the weather. This time, awful. No tap beers, machine down? No running water in men's room, if I can't wash my hands, how can the staff. One bar tender, not very good
author: Russell C.

description: I wouldn't give a single star if that was possible. I've been to numerous other hard rock locations thinking they would be top notch at this location... sadly disappointed. Had to waive down a server to even take our order. I'm not typically one to complain about food but when your "fresh" made food comes out looking like it had been sitting under their warmer and still came out cold it's sad. Onion rings hard and tempered warm fries that tasted like they had been rewarmed in a microwave. What a waste of time especially when paying for parking to eat here. The hour long validation doesn't even work
author: Chelsea M.

description: Good food but the wait for the food was too long. Our waitress seemed to be the only one having to serve 3 large parties which made the service below average. Picture is for the honey mustard chicken sandwich.
author: Harleen M.

description:
Long wait, limited menu, and they have run out of half the items they claim to serve. I was actually kind of impressed that we managed to order an appetizer that they had run out of followed by a beer they had run out of, followed by another beer they had run out of. 

On the other hand, the waiter was friendly. 

I was expecting a menu more like BJs or Applebee's when I saw they were in those fancy binders. It appears, however, those are just classy decoys. They bamboozled us with a listing of only a handful of appetizers. When we made our selections we were informed they had run out of the ones we wanted. 

They did take our drink orders right away so that's good. Although I think they may have forgotten they took them as I slowly died of dehydration. It worked out though, after an hour and asking a different waiter I realized I never wanted water in the first place. I don't know how they knew I never wanted water, when I specifically asked for it over and over and over, but they did, so kudos to them for being so in tune with me. 

On to the food, it arrived after about 45 minutes. I ordered the big cheeseburger so when I got the hickory barbecue burger it was a little bit surprising. But hey, a burger is a burger. It was a bit soggy but with a little practice it will be as good as Carl's junior in no time. The fires were actually very good. In fact, if you come here consider ordering only the fries. And by consider I mean do that. Only get the fries! Or maybe just go to McDonald's those fries are better and significantly cheaper.  


Overall, I would take a pass next time. That's not to say it didn't grow as a person being here. I learned I don't need water, and to appreciate every fast food place I have ever been to.

Maybe I just came at a bad time.
author: Andy K.

description:
Ok so the food is well prepared, and very good presentation. The atmosphere is nice, the server we had was very prompt and nice. The prices seemed pretty high but I'm from out of town so I could be wrong on that.

The drinks were defiantly well made. My wifi had the southern rock. I taste it It was so smooth I could have easily gotten drunk and not known it till after the fact. I'm not sure if that was deliberate or not. They seem to have the right people in the right positions. Everything seemed experienced to me from the food, the service and the drinks.
author: Scott L.

description: Horrible service starting with the hostess who didn't know what she was doing.  Took 10 minutes before a waiter came by even tho it wasn't that busy.  The food was subpar and way over priced - $19 for a burger that was over cooked.  The only thing good about it was that the beer was cold.  If we hadn't just gotten into town and were starved we would have waited for a table at one of the other restaurants on the pier.  As it was we should have done just that.
author: Eric C.

description:
I know I know how could I been trapped to go to HRC in SF on Pier 39. Here's the deal, I wasn't trapped, tricked or fooled. Keep in mind that I had a motley group of diners who's only lunch consisted of clam chowder bread bowl then they toured all over Alcatraz in the wee moments of a sunset on the most perfect day to visit SF in over two months. Why tempt fate or the powers of the Underworld? I emailed HRC about two weeks before when I scouting possible locations for our dinner. Not only did Sean, the HRC manager email me but he followed up with a personal call. He was super informative, courteous, and very apologetic for all the remodeling that was going on. More on that later. At this point, I was super excited about visiting HRC and couldn't wait to spring it my guests. On to my motley group, my wife is a no carb carrying member, we also had three others in the group that were well done meat eaters and two more that prefer tortillas over bread or crust.  
The distance from the Alcatraz tour disembark to Pier 39 was a short 8 min walk and we entered HRC through the patio due to the remodel of the entrance of the HTC.  The interior looks great and all the memorabilia is all new. The bar is still under construction but they can make some drinks just ask your server. I was promptly greeted with, " Hi Charles, is this everyone in your group?"  I replied with a yes and we were seated. It was such a relief to be pampered after touring all day. This is exactly what this group needed. One in our group ordered a Mojito and there were a couple of other drinks which did not present an issue for the staff. Colby? was our server and he had a trainee in tow, Sal. They both were professional and accommodating since we did have some special ordering. The menu is paired down which is something that I applaud all restaurants to do. Don't worry there's plenty of choices from Grilled Wings, Burgers, Ribs to Fajitas and more. Several in our group ordered the fajitas and I ordered the wings. Upon ordering wings, you'll be asked with you want traditional or grilled and the sauce. I believe the sauces are Classic Rock, blah blah blah, and Heavy Metal. I was persuaded to go big or go home so I went with the Heavy Metal. The wings arrived with the rest of the order and they were grilled and personally attended to. It didn't look like they were spun in a bowl and slide on a plate. The presentation was excellent. We also ordered the Garlic Parmesan fries with a garlic aioli sauce. The sauce is most excellent my only complaint is that the two or three fries in the top of the pile were limp and not hot but those underneath were hot and fresh. After finishing the wings, we took a group photo and did some shopping. I want to thank Sean and staff for their personal attention and I would recommend HRC for lunch, snack, or dinner. As with any concert, grab a seat and enjoy the show the same is true for HRC SF. I'm ready for a encore.
author: Charles F.

description: This place is way overpriced...food quality same as DENNys..ordered nachos ...they had no nacho cheese..so i had a heaping pile of chips with melted cheddar.. Hamburgers dry..save ur money..u dont even get to eat with a view.
author: Amanda F.

description: This is a brilliant dinner from the out side it looks like a little coffee shop but from the inside it's an amazing 5 star restaurant they call there burgers legendary and I can confirm that the burgers here look smell and taste amazing I recommend this over bubba gump 11/10
author: That One C.

description: Actually we have waited forever to get into it, the service wasn't that good and we got the food for at least 50mins waiting, the food was good!
author: Theresa R.

description: I ordered onion rings, they gave me chicken wings. But the wings were very good.
author: Alejandro O.

description: Food was good but the service was sub par. They are not attentive at all. The server was nice my only wish was that they paid closer attention over all to their customers.
author: Crystal L.

description: My daughter and I come here mainly for the atmosphere. Hard rock I'm sure has good  food but when there's only a few choices that are under 1,000 calories it makes it difficult for someone who's wants to eat healthy. There's really only salmon, salad, and fries? However, there is a cool vibe when you came here and that's what brings us back.
author: Randy A.

description: Worst service and food I have had in my entire life. We are given water with chunks of lettuce in it and then we wait over an HOUR until they are almost closed and our food comes out cold, hard, and stale like it'd sat under the warmer the entire time we were waiting. The waiter came by our table only to give us our food and drinks. We saw him a total of 2 times, and they were not busy. When we told our waiter we weren't pleased he immediately took our food away from us without even asking if we wanted to finish. The bill was comped but we never actually got to eat anything! When we asked for the manager we didn't get one until the doors were about to close and we stopped several waiters. Will NEVER go back!
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Oh dear lord! Where to start? Yes 1pm I a busy time on a Sunday. Yes being told "about 20 minutes", is annoying when it turns into an hour. Yes having your food take over an hour to get to you, is annoying. Yes said food being cold on arrival is annoying. Yes, I will probably chose one of the other eateries on the wharf, next time. 

To our server Scott...you were the shining light in all of this! This guy was happy (most other employees seemed disinterested and bored) and chatty when he needed to be, was apologetic and understood exactly what was going on and did what he could to help us. Thank you Scott, YOU WERE AWESOME! 

Ps when it arrived (hot), the food was actually not bad at all

**edit** just a quick edit to add that I messaged the manager like he asked below, but 4 months later, still haven't heard anything back
author: Dane C.

description:
If you haven't been to Hard Rock before, I think you have to go!! It's a music and Rock & Roll staple - a huge chain that's all over the world (I know because I help my dad gather pins from all over!). That is precisely why my friend and I ate at the Hard Rock at Pier 39 (she's never been). 

You can't be surprised to find HR in busy Pier 39 - a huge tourist spot and perfect for chain restaurants. We stopped by for lunch. The restaurant is very large inside with a gift shop closer to the front entrance. It's cool to look at all the memorabilia they have on the walls, hall ways, tables, EVERYWHERE. We were seated very quickly. 

It is typical American food from any bar & grill. I wouldn't say it's anything special and prices are what you would expect. Service was good and everyone was really friendly. I think my friend enjoyed her first time here! 

I don't go to Hard Rock to eat often but I always stop inside their gift shops!
author: Sam C.

description: I've been sitting here for over an hour and still no food. Looking around I see a full dining room without a single plate of food. I can't believe Hard Rock lets their name be associated with this kind of an experience.
author: Brian C.

description: Went Sunday with reservations at 7:30....service was horrible we were there two hours!!! Food was not good!   Our waitress had a very bad attitude ...she rolled her eyes at us...she gave us an attitude cause we asked for a separate check ..which honestly it was just 2 checks for our table of 8 guests....the manager came over and apologized and mentioned it was a slow pace I. The kitchen etc....would of liked to know that before we were seated ....cause that would've saved us two hours of waiting and we could of went else where. When u r in SF and having a great time and u want to end your day with a nice dinner ..do go there UGH!!!
author: Anita C.

description: 35+ minutes and still no drinks. Bathrooms were completely atrocious. Apologetic staff and all, seems under staffed or something. Order two dishes and one was wrong. Still no drinks.... first time Hard Rock Cafe anywhere... never again. Where's Gordon Ramsey....
author: Nikki H.

description: Really enjoyed my time at Hard Rock Cafe. Kirsha was great and engaging. She recommended some great dishes! Everyone should eat here, food is great!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Mediocre food.
At best.
Especially the kids food.
I soaked up a napkin with the oil from the chicken tenders.
Food was overall just bad. I'm sad I didn't go somewhere else.
Save your time and your money for quality food and drinks.
author: Cynthia O.

description:
I went to their bar to try and get a few drinks in me before boarding a boat because I tend to get a little nauseous when on boats. I went to the bar and was sitting there for about 20 minutes and didn't even receive a "hi" or "I will be with you in a moment" 
I understand they were a little busy but they had 3 bartenders on staff so I find this to be extremely unacceptable. I kept watching as they all hung out on one side of the bar. Eventually I asked if I could get a drink, and they said they needed a minute. Fine. 
The final straw was when I had been siting there for 30+ minutes and a couple sat down at the bar next to me and they were immediately greeted with napkins in front of them and a bartender ready to make their drinks for them. 
I left with no drink and no time to try another bar before the trip.
author: Cam J.

description: You know exactly what you're going to get here. The universal menu varies only slightly from city to city. The same loud soft rock music with videos spanning the ages. I had the shrimp fajitas- very good. You "build" them yourself from the served ingredients.
author: Chris N.

description:
All I can say is that the manager of this place should probably be fired. Everything was completely disorganized and the wait staff seemed lost. They couldn't even remember who had what order in their areas. Not the employees fault, just a great example of really poor training and management.

So to update my review, I was contacted by the manager and he has done a great job in responding to my concerns. I believe that he will improve the experience for everyone and I look forward to my next visit.
author: Matt S.

description: Just your typical Hard Rock, it was actually under renovation when we were here in SF so it was a very tiny space for the restaurant. No wait on a Monday night but service is kinda slow. The server was friendly and food was good. It is pricy food though. I definitely recommend the veggie burger, its a house made patty with veggies so really good and I love that they top it with grilled veggies. It was freezing in the restaurant, especially our table you could feel the air come in from the door.
author: Morgan M.

description: I was really disappointed in our dinner  we go there at 5 are sat done right away.  After they had to send us back because the table wasn't clean.  We ordered water and a soda and it took five minutes it more.  Then we ordered. A quinoa burger a salad and chicken tenders.   We sat there for over 45 minutes.  Mind you the restaurant was not full.  I did look around to see if they forgot us. But it seemed that the kitchen is just that slow.  No one ever came and said sorry for the wait...   food came and was no better than Carl's Jr.  Quinoa burger fell apart on first bite.
author: Steve B.

description: What a wonderful trip my daughter and I had... The waiter named Maverick... A.k.a. Howard professional and quick... We love hard rock café
author: Tassa D.

description: I honestly give them -10! My honey and I walked in seat at bar area. No customer service after about 10mins I stop a woman who was busing a table. She had a server come over with menus buttttttt he never came back. Then a new guy after we stopped was name MAVERICK! Maverick is the best thing about our Experience! Maverick gets 100% in customer service although he severed me cold claim chowder. Will never go back!
author: Tippy T.

description:
Cons: Very limited menu, food doesn't taste all that great

Pros: nice staff, pretty good milkshakes
author: Katie H.

description: The service was a bit slow on a day that's not usually packed, but the drinks came quickly. When the food did come, it's not the quality I'd be willing to pay the price they charge for. It comes off as a gimmick for tourists that doesn't at least deliver exceptional food. The service isn't great either.
author: Vincent V.

description: We ate at the Hard Rock on Pier 39 in SAN Francisco. First of all- even if the food sucks- you're in SAN Francisco and at Fishermans Wharf and what more can you possibly want!?!! Well- the food Didn't suck and the service was Excellent! We started out with a couple if their fun, foo-foo alcoholic drinks in tall hurricane glasses- fun, fruity and refreshing. Hubby and I shared a Huge platter of loaded nachos.WOW!! They were heaped high on a platter and loaded with black beans, ground beef, onions, 2 cheeses, salsa, pico de gallo, jalapeños and sour cream- the chips were hit and crisp- everything you'd ever want in a nacho! Our waitress was just Fantastic. So friendly and funny and answered our touristy questions with a smile- even gave us a hug when we left! The atmosphere is fun and rock-n-rolly and there's great music. Fantastic experience!!
author: Diane B.

description:
The service of this restaurant is terrible, two ladies at front desk are speaks really rude to me when I'm asking for table to eat in, they had no smile showing on their face, the waitress is also bad, ordered wrong food for us and refuse to change, the total amount for the table was $78 and paid $100 cash, the waitress says to me: you do want change ain't you? I can't believe he asked me such stupid question, off course I want change. The only thing I felt good is the foods.

I have been to the other hard rock restaurant in LA and Las Vegas and they both good.
author: Fan Y.

description: Service was so bad! It took an hour to get our food on a Tuesday night. Waiter never refilled our drinks.  Food looked like it had been sitting for a while before it was served.  Took another 20 min to get bill, once we received bill it was incorrect., took another 20 min for waiter to run my card.  $75.00 bill for 3 dishes and 1 drink was definitely not worth it.
author: Veronica B.

description: The bathroom was super dirty and out of tp, the wait for our food was over an hour, it showed up wrong. I won't be back. I only gave  two stars because the staff was friendly.
author: Jeff H.

description: Haven't been to a Hard Rock Cafe in probably 15 years, and probably won't be another 15 years till I'm back. Service was terrible, I felt bad for the poor server. Just seemed like a lost puppy. Ask what we wanted to drink yet we didn't have menus yet. We then ordered drinks immediately. Took 40 minutes to get waters. And 45 minutes to get cocktails, in which half came out flat. On to the next.
author: Ryan G.

description: First hard rock cafe I've tried. It's american food like burgers and stuff. They sell souvenirs here and the inside setting looks cool and punk rock. It was average~
author: Yennie L.

description: Just finish eating here, ordered the ribs, worst I've ever had, completely dried out and seem like they were trying to cover it up with a lot of barbecue sauce. Coleslaw was hanging out of a little container as if somebody really didn't care about putting it in there in the first place and dry. The beans were halfway full in the container. No offer of napkins, wipey or small plate for the bones, something you would expect when ordering ribs. I do not recommend eating here, this is my third time eating here and it seems like each time it's gotten worse.
author: E G.

description: It's allergy season. Colds are going around. People are going to sneeze. The bartender however, thinks it's okay to sneeze all over the bar, numerous times, and shoot snot rockets into the garbage can. He did sing along with Snoop Dogg pretty well, maybe it's because they look alike‍. I did like my ahi poke, and when I couldn't manage to make myself drink this awful wine I chose, my waitress let me switch it out for a draft. Props to her! I'm just glad I wasn't eating oysters.
author: Kristal T.

description: *side note we had a terrible server* While there must have been some miscommunication with our server and placing the order, the manager came over directly to us noticing that there had been an issue. We had mentioned that we had been waiting for our food for over 45 mins and hadn't seen our waiter in a long time. He had asked what we ordered and put it in right away. Then out of nowhere our waiter suddenly appears apologizing profusely saying he put the order in "blah blah blah". Once our food was finally out after waiting over an hour the manager was kind enough to comp. our meal. The food was AMAZING I mean it's The Hard Rock Cafe!!! But the fact that the manager stepped in and really provided the costumer service we were looking for spoke volumes!!! So thank you Shane for going out of your way to take care of a couple that was just passing through on an anniversary. We truly appreciate it!!!
author: Chelsea B.

description:
We were at Fishermens Wharf, and went specifically to Hard Rock to have a late lunch. It was very busy and we asked to sit in the bar. They said sure, just seat yourself. We went in, took one of the vacant  tables,(there were 3) and sat down. We were there about 10 minutes when the greeter, came and told us we had to sit directly at the bar not the tables. No, there are no seats, so we went back out to the desk to wait. We stood there for about 15 minutes and realized we were being completely ignored, and asked what was happening. "Oh, I'm sorry, did you want a table ?" We love hard rock in Las Vegas and have never had a problem. They treat us very well.
We were amazed at the difference between LV and San Fran. Yuch. Never again.
We went to Bubba Gump with our membership card, and were treated like royalty.
author: Anne W.

description:
Wont be going back! 

Didn't like the way our server was up close and personal with us. He literally pulled-up a chair and sat extremely close to me while taking my order. Elbows on the table and all. Made us feel really uncomfortable.

The food was mediocre. My wife ordered a hot tea with her food. She asked for sugar and waited about 15 minutes before our server brought the sugar. At that point the tea was cold and distasteful. She didn't bother drinking it.

There are many other restaurants on the pier. Don't settle like we did because we were hungry!
author: Mr. C.

description: Hard Rock Café has become a favourite of mine. They always have things in order and their service is impeccable. The server always checks in to make sure that you're doing ok. I always get the pulled pork sandwich and their cheeseburger. Both are really well made and burst with flavour on every bite. You can't go wrong with that. The burger looks great and wow is it good! If you're ever looking for a place with a fun, vibrant atmosphere then you wouldn't regret trying out the Hard Rock Café.
author: Estela C.

description: Shortly after we were seated, the waitress spilled a glass of water all over the table.  We changed tables to allow her to clean up. The food took forever to arrive.  Not recommended, Katie needs more training.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Love the service here.  Matt and Audi (not sure of spelling, sorry) were entertaining, informative, and attentive. I appreciate the small things like not having to ask for napkins and a refill on water. Before I even thought to ask it was done. 
This was our frist time eating here and Matt was excited to tell us about his favorite dishes. We chose his recommendations and loved the Mac and Cheese and Bay Burger. 
Thank you for the excellent service and food. We will return.
author: Iesha M.

description: Love checking out Hard Rock Cafe whenever there is one. Great energy and excitement! Great music and ambiance.
author: David B.

description: Firstly, the hosts in the front said it would be a twenty minute wait, it was ten, which was great. Our server took our order, only took our starters and drinks and walked away. We called her back about our main course and she explains " I thought that's all you were eating". Midway through our starters (wings and goujons..they were fab), a server puts our main down and attempts to take away my plate, regardless of the fact I was not finished. Then after about two bites of an extremely bland burger, the server hands us a cheque. I was hoping to get a dessert, but obviously this would have been too much effort.
author: Larissa O.

description:
Good food. Thank god lol...... After my past experience with them (I was forced by out of towners to go here) I was happy to go at night where the ambiance was actually pretty cool with the guitar entrance and revamped floor. I have to say I do miss the multitude of televisions displaying the many different music videos (not to say there isn't a multitude of sets... There were just more before the remodel.) but one of the reasons why you go to Hard Rock Cafe is that you go here to listen to music and watch videos and look at memorabilia. It looks more modern sure but I do miss looking at all the stuff they used to have on the walls. 

Oh well. Food came out hot and guests were happy.........
author: Barry K.

description: Extremely slow service. We waited over an hour for our food. People that were seated after us got their food. When we tried to pay for our drinks, we got the runaround
author: Zuza C.

description: At least we were not completely forgotten about like the table behind us. They have now sat for over 30 minutes without a server even acknowledging them. We waiting over 50 minutes for our entrees that had sat awhile under the warmer before being brought to us. Probably would have tasted better if it was fresh. Oh well. The place gets business because it's on the Pier and the other non seafood touristy places near by, Rainforest Cafe and even Joe's Crab Shack closed. If you are coming to the pier and you don't like seafood, have lunch or dinner first and come to the small shops for dessert because Hard Rock has a good gift shop and people seem to be enjoying the bar, but the food can be skipped all together!
author: Amanda N.

description:
We had a small trip to the pier since we went to the Oakland a's game 

Originally told 35 to 45 mins wait ended up being well over a hour and 10. My snapping point was when a gentleman that came in well over 20 mins after us got seated and then we were told we still had another twenty mins to wait...uh no sorry. 

I am in retail food serves this is not protocol to blame the table seating chart on the new girl when a hostess who seems to know the routine starts making excuses. ( ugly ugly attitude and looked like she hated her job. Needs a swift kick of customer services given to her) 

Food was decent this is a tourist spot I didn't expect fine dining. 
Our server Johnny was fantastic literally made the ending to our day worth while. This man is running circles around the younger servers. Kept us laughing and had a good time while waiting for food 

We frequent the city once a month or so. I dk how this will continue to fit into our little get a ways
author: Linda W.

description: Typical tourist trap. This is not the cool Hard Rock that used to be on Van Ness. Typical understaffed bar. Waited 15 minutes at the bar. No service. Got up and left.
author: Gil M.

description: Having someone wait 60 minutes for the table after saying it'll be 15 minutes was just the beginning. Then our waiter didn't bring plates for appetizers to share.  After about 15 minutes of being done with the main meal, I asked when the initially ordered dessert was going to arrive which he OBVIOUSLY forgot about. After another 5 minutes, he said that I'm in line after like 3 other people to get their dessert first. So I canceled, and right now - while typing this - overthinking my life choices bringing me to this shit show.
author: David S.

description: Decent place, store is San Francisco oriented which is good for people like my girl and me who want SF specific souvenirs. The shop's staff could improve their servicing skills.
author: Juan M.

description:
Horrible service. Sat at the table 10 minutes before anyone came to ask if we'd been helped.  Then they tried to serve us someone else's order three times,  even setting one of the plates on our table!  
Waiting forever for our food.  It better be good for the price and time.
author: Maxine K.

description: Currently sitting in Hard Rock Cafe and I gotta say I'm just amazed on the Bradleys(bartender) customer service! As soon as I sat at the bar, Bradley noticed me and greeted me with a smile. After asking him for recommendations Bradley was full of information. I've never in my life have came across a bartender with so much knowledge with spirits so getting a tasty beverage was not a problem. I ordered the nachos with no meat and added guac and that was also very delicious but I'm honestly giving the 5 stars for the customer service. Bradley was exceptional and the other bartenders working with him always asked if I was doing alright. If you come to hard rock go straight to the bar and make sure Bradley is working,..... he'll take car of you.
author: Luis M.

description:
We didn't eat here.  This review is for the store only cuz who doesn't need a $30 Hard Rock Cafe t-shirt from SF?!?  Apparently we did!

At least we got treated well while we made the purchase and the store is fun to check out too.
author: Lucky S.

description:
My family and I came here after walking around the wharf - We were all in San Fran for a wedding and it was our last day in town. This was honestly the last choice of restaurants for us, but everything else was packed and had lines, so we decided to go here because it didn't look busy. We put our names in for a party of 9 and were told it would be a 30-45 minute wait. There were a lot of open tables, but I figured it had to do with the amount of staff they had at the time. Fine. 

We went to the bar to get some drinks while we waited. There were probably five other people there, three bar tenders in total going in and out from behind the bar. No one came up to us immediately - We probably sat there for a good five minutes at first. Finally a bartender asked us what we wanted, and I asked him for a drink menu. He didn't say a word, just slammed (literally, slammed) five dirty/sticky drink menus down in front of me and walked away. My mom even commented on how rude it was. Off to a great start! We ordered our drinks and they were fine. I finished my glass of wine in about twenty minutes and sat at the bar with my empty glass on the table for the remainder of our time sitting there - Another 45 minutes. No one ever came to ask me if I wanted another drink. There were a few more rude encounters with the bar tenders - My sister was trying to pay the bill and was telling the bar tender what drinks to charge her for, to which the bar tender replied in a harsh tone that she already knew what she ordered. My mom tried to get the bar tenders attention several times for another drink and they were extremely rude and passive to her. Overall, worst bar service I have ever experienced. 

After 45 minutes at the bar, we started to see other parties being seated before us and inquired with the hostesses (plural). They told us it would be another 30 minutes. So that's 1 hour 15 minutes of a wait instead of the original 30-45 minutes. GREAT. At this point we are starving and thirsty. We had to inquire again after those 30 minutes went by to be seated - my sister wouldn't leave the host stand until they sat us. 

We were finally seated and our waiter was actually fine. He was pleasant and not terribly slow. I did note that I was the only one who asked for a water and I was the only one who didn't get one... Anyways, the majority of my party enjoyed their meals (Mine was really gross - margarita flatbread. Couldn't even finish it). 

Overall, I have to say, this place is horrible. I didn't have that high of expectations going in because I never do with chains, so with that being said, this is the worst of the worst. Those bartenders should be fired. They were miserable. If they hate their jobs so much they should go do something that doesn't require people interaction and customer service, especially in a tourist area.
author: Erin C.

description: This is probably the worst dining experience I have ever had. Right when we walked in, we were seated at a table too small for our party. The host just slammed the menus down on the table and left without saying anything. When our waitress (Dianne) came to give us the checks she verbally harassed us when one party member did not have enough money to tip her properly. She proceeded to wave the check in our faces claiming that tipping was required. Not only was she extremely unprofessional and rude but she created an uncomfortable experience. I will not be returning to this establishment and I hope management seeks to solve this problem and address Dianne's actions.
author: Taylor B.

description: Thoroughly disappointed with the service here today. (7/23/17) We stopped in with a good two hours for lunch and literally waited 50 minutes after being seated ( which took 30 minutes) for two burgers and chicken strips. Waiters kept trying to bring us the wrong orders and after 45 minutes we explained we had a cruise to get to and wanted our food boxed ( we still waited over another 15 minutes for that to happen). They tried appeasing us with fries and chips which was honestly too little too late. The main reason I scored a 1 is because the server stated as we mentioned our hurry that had we told her when seated they would have rushed our order... so it's normal practice to make someone wait over an HOUR FOR THEIR FOOD?!?! That's despicable service!!! Shame on you!
author: Angelina G.

description: We came here looking for some light dessert, and stumbled upon the awesome molten chocolate lava cake with ice cream. Heavenly!
author: Rupin K.

description: This is my first and probably my last time here. It was pretty late and close to closing, the restaurant wasn't crowded at all and somehow my food took an excessive amount of time to come out. I asked for my salad to be given to me BEFORE my entree and guess what, it came out WITH my food. My cousin's food was cold and her order was wrong. Worst experience ever. Definitely wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. But the manager with the purple hair was accommodating and nice.
author: Lonnice B.

description:
I live in Beautiful San Francisco and I'm always at Pier 39. I love the restaurants and the ambiance because it reminds me of Disneyland. I make a point of going to all the Hard Rock Cafes and buying t-shirts. I always have a good time and the food is fun and the drinks are great! The hostess today was friendly and upbeat 3/18/16 and our server Ernest was awesome and excellent , juggling a huge biker group in his section . I had a great
Time and I'll keep coming back! 
Oh, if you're broke, don't go out to eat and complain about prices. Eat at subway haters.
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Went here to get my swag like I do with all of my visits. The service was not the greatest, kind of slow to be honest. Never asked if we had been there etc. The food was mediocre. I had a burger, tasty but the juices soaked right thru the bun so i went bun less! Ha! Now as for the store part, they were fabulous and very helpful. I do not know the gentleman name who helped me with the pins but man was he great! Gave me some great advice on which was limited and info for the club pins etc. Great guy and he knew his stuff!!! I would go back to get merchandise but not for food. 

Oh and at this moment they are in the process of renovating!
author: Sarah F.

description:
You get what you pay for
Most ,not all employees just go through the motions 
There is really no professionalism at a Hard Rock Cafe
Like any fast food joint
My water came with a fly in it
Just shook my head
author: G B.

description: Horrible service. Went in to sign up for a table they told us 35 minutes and our buzzer never ran. We had to go inside to ask again if our table was ready and then we were eventually seated. Once we finally got seated we ordered our food and it took forever to get the food. Then we got our entree before we got our appetizer. That's absurd. We wanted dessert so we ordered and waited another 20+ minutes for ice creams and then when we asked our server about them he told us it was going to be another 15-20 mins because the kitchen crew wasn't doing their job. We asked for the check immediately and left. Extremely un happy with this experience definitely would not recommend this restaurant to any one looking to eat dinner at a decent restaurant
author: Furby G.

description: I will say the jumbo sampler was good  and the twisted Mac was amazing.  Our waiter was annoying. He talked too much and sat on the bench next to my husband when we were placing our order which made it weird. The cocktails are weak. I did like the music and the videos that played while we ate. Definitely not a quite dinner place. But overall not bad just your greasy food.
author: Jessica M.

description: Great atmosphere love it , came with my girlfriend family . They love it , we were to full for dessert everything came in. If the cauliflower wings had less salt on it it probably taste really good.
author: Gilbert M.

description: Poor customer service. Half the restaurant tables empty but still half hour wait. Got sat and waited another 20 minutes to place an order. 20 minutes later the restaurant computer system goes down and we had to place our order again. Avoid this tourist trap
author: Scott H.

description:
A fun place to go get some American food in a touristy spot and admire all of the music memorabilia.

We were seated right away in a gigantic booth by a friendly, witty guy who was surprised we braved the slight drizzle outside without coats or umbrellas.  Our waiter saw us right away and was fantastic on answering questions, checking on us throughout our time there, and making sure we were taken care of.  

I ordered a specialty burger that was on the menu that had part of the purchase go towards feeding hungry kids.  It was called the Babylon.  I've forgotten what was on it, but it was delicious and oversized.  The fries were great too.  My friend's chicken burger was perfect, he reported.

A Yelp check-in deal popped up for a free appetizer or dessert on my cell, and when I mentioned this to the waiter, and said no problem and didn't require that I show him my phone.  We got dessert and ordered the brownie which was freaking huge!  It was in an oversized martini glass standing at a foot tall with Ben & Jerry's vanilla, fudge, whipped cream and a cherry over a hot brownie.  We were nowhere near finishing it.

After we were done eating and paid for the meal, we walked around to view all of the autographed guitars, platinum and gold records, the clothes, etc. It was a lot of fun and very interesting to us.  

You have to walk through the store to get to the restaurant, which has all of the traditional Hard Rock tees, along with other souvenirs.  

The bar area looked pretty inviting.  We don't drink so we didn't hang out over there, but it looked pretty hipster.

Our waiter offered to validate our garage parking for us.  The parking garage is expensive and it's either that or a paid lot.  Getting the validation took a chunk of change off the cost which was pretty sweet.

Food: 5
Service: 5
Ambiance: 5
Parking: 3
author: Sheri C.

description: It's hard to beat a Hard Rock Cafe. They are pretty consistent anywhere you go and visit. We were in San Francisco walking along the Embarcadero and spotted one in the pier 39 area. So we walked over to check out the menu for lunch. It looked good. Yes, it's a tourist trap but, what the heck we chose to eat there anyway. The atmosphere is really cool and the food and drinks are good. We enjoyed it very much. Don't come here expecting to get the great SF seafood. You'll have to wait in lines to get that. Just come here expecting to be treated like a tourist and you'll enjoy it a whole lot more.
author: Richard F.

description: The service sucks here, only saw our waitress once to take our order. Don't recommend this place for a good time.
author: Daniel P.

description: Waited 25 mins for Thomas our waiter to take our order, 10 mins for drinks, 1 hour still no burgers. Talked to manager, he was shocked at the amount of time it had taken for two burgers which was burnt to a crisp (waiter never asked how I wanted my burger) very very bad service from thomas the waiter.
author: Jamie R.

description:
After wandering around Pier 39 and trying to make a decision of what to eat. We stopped at the Hard Rock Cafe since all of the other places that sell seafood had long lines. Hard Rock did not have a long line. We were able to be seated immediately. YAY!

When we left the restaurant, this was not the case for other people who were waiting in line to be seated. On the bright side, while your waiting in line you are in their retail gift shop and can do a little Hard Rock shoppping.

The service was good. Our server was super attentive even though the restaurant was busy. We had a birds eye view of the many TV's and were delighted to see actual music videos playing on the TV's. The noise level was a little high but it was a fun atmosphere.

The food was about what to be expected. Their mixed drinks- yeah, they were tasty! I had the Mac n Cheese. This was tasty. And the serving size was generous enough to have me lugging home a bunch of leftovers.

The restrooms were clean. Bonus points for that especially on a super busy Saturday afternoon.
author: Linda D.

description: Server said 40 mins wait turns out to be 1 hour 20 mins wait with lots of open sit! Food took another good 30 mins wait and when it finally came it was freaking cold! This place is not worth your money! Go somewhere else. The singer was the only one that loves doing his job anyone else looks unhappy with their job!
author: Maria Rubymel M.

description:
Lunch at the Hard rock cafe was an amazing experience. Food was awesome & so were the fruity cocktails. Our waiter Mathew was very helpful & pointed out to us his favorites! And blended one of my cocktails cus that's how he likes it best, and I loved it (:
The atmosphere was fun & upbeat. Great music playing. Thank you mathew! We will definitely be back.
author: Sydney J.

description: We ate here on Christmas day and it was actually pretty nice. We got there when it wasn't too packed which was a PLUS. Customer Service was great, however, we did have to wait a bit for our food. By the time we got our food it had gotten super crowded and so we kind of just waited around for our bill to be brought out to us to where we had to get up and ask again. It was a good experience..mainly spending time with my cousin from Australia - and it wasn't half bad. Major plus was that it was open on Christmas Day. I don't remember anything on the menu too much aside that they offer a local twist on burgers...The ambiance is cool :)
author: Victoria M.

description: What do you expect from the chain that doesn't care about anything but money. This place is so pricy that it's actually ripoff. Never going back again as the food was just ok.
author: Bimarsh S.

description:
