After taking a ferry tour of the Golden Gate we opted to warm up by hitting Hard Rock for some warm food and cocktails. We were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated quickly. This was a safe bet restaurant for the hubs who has a shellfish allergy and other pier food options are risky.

The inside is a standard for the chain with memorabilia on the walls and music videos playing on TVs throughout. Our server was extremely friendly and helpful. To help with the warming up process I got a white Sangria, which was very good. The husband opted for the red Sangria, which was also good!

For food I almost always go with the Twisted Mac and Cheese when I'm here. As per usual, this is what I ordered and it was just as good as it always is. I'd recommend this dish to people who are pasta fans and lovers of comfort foods.

We skipped dessert since we wanted to try some other options found nearby on the pier. We also forgot to get our parking validated, but when we went back in, our server remembered us and was quick to help us out!

Overall: A
Not a bad place to pick up some grub and drinks while visiting the pier!
author: Stacy F.

description: I have to say living in the bay area I'm not a fan of taking my guests from out of town to restaurants the pier. We were waiting for our ferry back and all the hosts were extremely helpful.  Shout out to johanes and Aliyah( I hope I got your names right) and our server Michael. You made our dinner very enjoyable and pleasant and went the extra mile to accommodate my guests and I.
author: Nahtahnee M.

description: This was the worst visit ever! Went in with friends and waited 30 minutes for a table with open tables on both sides of the restaurant and tables in the bar. Even though we were waiting there were other people who came in and were seated first. My friends are of color. We were finally seated after my friend said something. The bar was overly loud. I'm not talking bar loud. I'm talking inside an echoing box loud. We ordered and got our drinks then our waitress disappeared. My friends were served their meals and mine was not. I literally was not served. My friend finally got the waitresses attention and it took another 10 minutes to get my meal, they obviously didn't make it. Again, waitress disappeared. No refills, no checking to see if we needed anything. We had to ask the bartender for ketchup, mustard, drinks. I ordered the Original Burger and it was just bad. No seasoning at all. Just a slab of meat. They do give you a side of hot dressing for the burger, but that's so hot you can't taste it. We did finally see our waitress when it was time to pay. Bad visit. Bad food. Bad service.
author: Susan B.

description: If you want bad service this is the place to be. My friends and I decided we wanted to eat at this restaurant. Made reservations online since we thought there may be a long wait since it's a tourist spot. We finally got to the restaurant, of course you have high expectations since it's a "high end restaurant" the girls in the front didn't greet anyone with a smile or a hello. They just looked at customers coming in, never once did I hear them say hi or ask how many were in their party. There was one girl with colored hair and pig tails she had the worst attitude. Since our reservation was for 6:30 they asked us to come back around that time. So we decided to walk around a bit, we finally get a text saying our table is ready.  We head back over to the restaurant, asked the girls we received a text that our table is ready. They just looked at us and said oh let me check, what was the point of the text message?! She comes back and says they are still cleaning it and give it about 2mins. 15mins passed! We are waiting for someone for an update. Also the girls didn't apologize that our table wasn't ready yet. I don't know who hired these girls but they definitely need more training in this field. They obviously have no care for customers nor the restaurant. We will not be coming back to this location and we will also tell our friends not to come to this location from our horrible experience.
author: Krisha R.

description: EXCELLENT food however on the pricey side for bar food. Wait was exactly as told during a peak time! And you can walk around wharf while waiting. Staff in gift shop the BEST customer service!
author: Angela C.

description: Wait time was 30 min, not bad. We ordered 2 Caesar salads, a nacho, a turkey club, and an order of fish and chips, took almost an hour to get our food! The food was ok at best. The servers were nice, but slow! Don't come here if you're in a hurry to eat or starving!
author: Nicole D.

description:
Updated on 07/26/16: 

I was contacted by someone in customer relations who apologized for the experience I had and wanted to know more about it. I was also sent a $25 gift card good to use at any Hard Rock Cafe. If I go back, it won't be to this location as I live in Seattle. But I will be sure to review if I do. I appreciated being contacted and that my experience was acknowledged. I like that they are trying to better their company and want to try to remedy bad experiences. It doesn't change the one star review I previously gave them, but it does make me think more favorably about the company as a whole.
author: Nellys S.

description:
We always eat at Hard Rock Cafe's where ever we travel.  We have been to this one a few times now and every time the food isn't as good as it is at other Hard Rock's.  Our food is either cold or over cooked.  As much as I love loud music, the music is always so loud here you have to shout at the person next to you.
The only saving grace is the staff who are always helpful even though they are extremely busy.  I think after this last visit, we won't eat at this Hard Rock again.
author: Shawna D.

description:
Expensive for what you get. Dennys does a better and bigger milkshake, and the steak is 30% more expensive than the higher end establishments on the pier.

Edit/Response Comment:

For a milkshake that is over $7 I expect more than a sippy cup of watery froth.
That being said, the server was pleasent and efficient.
author: Michael V.

description: Came in and asked if the bar area was open seating. We were told by the host that all seating up the step was open and to go ahead and seat ourselves. After getting comfortable in one of 20 open tables, a server came up to us and stated that this was in fact NOT open seating and we had to go to the host stand. We explained that we were in fact told by the host that it was open seating and the server said he would go tell him it was not and that we had to go check in at the front. We went back to the host stand and were told it was at least a 30 minute wait which I cannot understand due to the amount of empty tables throughout the restaurant. At that point we had such a bad taste in our mouths that we left and found another restaurant to dine at. I will not be giving them my business being treated that way. They could have rectified the situation and in fact did the opposite and made it worse.
author: Julie G.

description: Ate here on 4/5/17 and regret it. Service was ok, the food was not good and way too overpriced. I understand this is a very high tourist area but I would've rather ate at a burger at in n out down the street and paid $10 then eat this low quality food and pay an arm and a leg. Never again will I make that mistake
author: Stacey B.

description:
#HardRockCafe well the service really sucks in San Francisco - 30 minutes just to get a starter ?! - hire more staff

#HardRockCafe ok not often I take back my comments - but we complained to the manager and he tried to fix it with courtesy and a discount - nice recovery #oracle
author: Robin S.

description:
There are those occasions where it's hot in San Fran and the wife says I need a drink. Hard Rock at pier 39 is NOT the place for it.  Smells like the last time they cleaned this bar was well before I turned drinking age.....and I'm freaking old. 

I fear a server is going to get injured - one of them is going to break their neck on the tattered flipped up dirty-ass floor mats. 

Won't be back, too damn stinky!
author: Dg G.

description:
My family had lunch on Saturday.  Our food was ok, 2 of the 4 lunches were pretty good but the turkey club was dry and bland, kids meal was horrendous (super greasy chicken tenders and dull bland mashed potatoes) Zero connection with waitress, I had to get up to find napkins, had to flag another waiter down for condiments, and was never even asked if I wanted another drink etc.  Yes it was busy, why would I even entertain the idea that we would have decent service? Probably will not return to Hard Rock for a long time.  We have had good experiences at the Universal and Vegas locations, but pier 39 location was disappointing 
Sent from miPhone
author: Steve K.

description: Not very good service. Took 10 minutes just to sit us down. Order took over an hour to come out, and food felt rushed. One positive is that the staff is very nice.
author: Gillian H.

description: This place has the rudest bartenders...so I ordered a drink called the watermelon-Rita And it was way to sweet and tasted gross. I politely told the bartender that it was way to sweet and she just stared at me like she didn't care. She walked away and and basically was making fun of me too her co-worker because they laughed and then looked my way. She didn't say sorry or offer to make me anything else..she must hate her job...you have been warned.
author: Arelle O.

description: Came here Saturday around 6 pm after the cherry blossom festival in Japantown. We where seated 40 minute later and that good for a Saturday any where on pier 39. Me and my gf both ordered the chicken and ribs which comes with fries, the chicken was lukewarm and the ribs where dry. I should know better then to eat on the pier cause I know they rush the food to get the next customer in.Going to be awhile before I eat on the pier again. Service was great but there was to many good places to eat in SF away from pier 39.
author: Dennis T.

description: Decided to give Hard Rock Cafe a go. Very pleased! had the Hickory smoke burger with onions and bacon-delicious! The fries were also a perfect match. Its on Pier 39 so it fills up quickly,still the atmosphere is inviting, dim lit and relaxing. And the service was top notch. Prices are reasonable for a high tourist area. looking forward to trying the smoked ribs and other entrees.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I have been to several Hard Rock Cafes around the US, but this one stood out.  Why?  The amazing and wonderful service!  We were tourists being totally touristy, walked in with a handful of flyers to plan our day.  Our waitress was friendly and helpful when we had questions about local attractions, even suggested some we hadn't noticed!

Our food was quick to arrive and delicious (we shared the appetizer sampler) and our strawberry basil lemonade was ridiculously fantastic.  We had a blast, mostly because of the great service.  Kudos to your waitstaff!

Check out pics and my husband's review on our blog http://lonesomecow.ca/2016/04/restaurants-hard-rock-cafe-san-francisco/
author: Katie K.

description: I'd give it 0 if I could. Three of us stopped in on a quiet Sunday morning. We were promptly seated next to the kitchen and no one ever came to take our order, so we left. When I told the hostess what happened she obviously didn't give 2 sh--s.
author: Chryssa R.

description:
Food = 3 stars.  Had the burger, dry, middle of the road burger, the cheese helped a lot.  

Wife had the little burger for the same price as mine ??? 

The kid had the kids cheese pizza = awful with four w's, Awwwwful.  

Bright side of the food, chicken strips appetizer, fantastic, best part, free, thanks Yelp.  

Service : 5 stars

Service was great, hands down, it was busy too, server was prompted.  Drinks appeared right before our eyes, food was there in a snap.  Server and manager came by just to check in, twice!!!!!
author: Bobby W.

description:
Wow, what a great meal, it's a touch loud, but I love rock and roll so I was totally into it. I had the lagendary burger, pink in the middle came out cooked perfectly, great food great music, great service.
If you love rock and tool and good food you have to check it out.
Place was clean and fantastic things on the wall, do your self a favor and check it out.
author: Roy C.

description:
We had one of the worst dining experiences EVER! 
We wanted lunch at around 11am on a Saturday, Oct. 28, 2007. We had 3 people; me, my sister, and my daughter, and the dining room was mostly empty, so no excuse for being over crowded.
The waiter took our order, then literally disappeared. When the food was delivered, by another person, the $18 burger my daughter ordered was not cooked properly. Also, the chicken my sister ordered was so overcooked that it was not edible. I soon ran out of anything to drink, and no waiter in sight for a very long time. I finally went to the ladies gathered at the entry, and asked for the manager. She arrived quickly, and I told her that for $18 we better have a waiter nearby, the food was not cooked properly, and I had nothing to drink. The manager quickly fixed the problem, had another burger delivered at no charge for any burger, but no replacement for the chicken, and filled my drink. Soon after that another server came by and told us that they could not find our waiter. I hope he found employment elsewhere.
I expect better at a name brand café in San Francisco, but one can get burned anywhere.
author: Walt H.

description: Sat for 25 minutes at our table waiting to be greeted and for them to take our drink order...Wasn't until we were getting up to leave did someone come over to help us. Then she said she would notify the manager and "see what she could do". Not only did we still have to wait 20 more minutes for food, but they didn't even compensate us for the first 25 minutes of our wasted time with a discount on our meal. Customer service totally non existent here. Really wish I'd have read these reviews before walking inside.
author: Katrina P.

description:
Don't waste your money here! They offer over priced food, Poor quality, and service that is reminiscent of them flipping you off. $13.95 for a nacho appetizer that clearly looks like the cheese was microwaved, an extra $5 for shredded chicken that maybe was put on 1/4 of the plate, and $20 burgers that would make you rather buy a $6 burger at Carl's JR. 
You are paying for the name here. They don't pay attention to your order, we had to send back 2 orders, including my kids order, because they got them wrong. We actually had to tell the servers if it was our food or not because they couldn't figure out which table to serve. 
I asked for a refill of my coke twice... I never got my refill. I asked for my kids refill of milk twice, ended up asking another server since my server never brought it. 
I asked for ketchup... I ended up having to pull off another table because they kept forgetting it. It was a horrible experience all together. And yes, we spoke with them, got no apologies. They said they were busy, but there were 2 tables full around us and the rest of the 10+ were empty. Hmm...

Take your business to the back of pier 39, way better food, way better prices and way better service. Hard Rock lost a customer.
author: Blake C.

description:
First we waitied an hour to get in. I get it, it seemed busy. After we sat down and ordered we waited OVER an hour to get our food. Seriously over an hour for 2 salads. We were getting ready to leave  but then they brought out our orders, one by one. The rest of our orders were wrong 3 times. Then they brought them out again. I guess they were entered incorrectly. We asked for some steak sauce for one of them. He came back with a bottle and said, "this one only has a little bit left but it was the only one i can find". Theres no more in a back room or anywhere else in here? There really was about 2 tsps worth in there. It was kind of funny. But still not cool. 
He never showed back up until he gave us the bill. 
Horrible horrible
author: Marcos P.

description:
Friends come from out of town, told us we could meet up at the hardrock...ok...uh oh, I thought. this is a great big City with great restaurants and you want this one? ok. 

Like I thought...the worst...beyond the worst. it wasn't even food...im not sure what that was, way overpriced crap...Never effin again..not in my lifetime...Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.
author: David W.

description:
As soon as I came in I felt welcome by whom I am assuming is the manager.  Wish I had go his name!  He was really cool and sat me and my friend down.  He was training a girl at the same time.  The waiter was cool, he explained to me some of the beers and thats why I got the flight.  The food was kinda pricey but they give a little military discount so it evened out a bit.  I got the Cowboy Rib Eye, with mashed potatoes, twisted Mac, and grilled asparagus.  Asparagus wasn't on the menu but I asked if they had it and he said yeah so they threw it on the grill for me :)  My friend Bri got a cocktail that was super sweet but she said it was good for her.  The place itself is pretty big and there is a retail shop right before you walk in the restaurant area.  The bar seemed like it was a good size and from what I could tell everyone was super cool and nice.  I had a pretty good experience here.  We got here around 11.

San Francisco is a mad city - inhabited for the most part by perfectly insane people whose women are of remarkable beauty. - Rudyard Kipling
author: Peter G.

description: I went here last night with some friends, and had the best experience. Our waiter, Robert, provided the most excellent customer service, and left us all with smiles on our faces. He began taking our orders by asking, "are we ordering just drinks or food? Don't worry, take your time, I've got all the patience in the world." He went through the menu helping my friend find a drink to order, and was very kind as we went back and forth on what food we all wanted. Then, after bringing us our food and drinks, he brought out a strawberry lemonade, on the house, just to be nice, and when some of our other friends showed up just to say hello, he brought them a bowl of ice cream, also on the house, to entice them to stay. Later we told Robert we liked a pin he was wearing, and he quickly told us the reasons behind all his pins and the shirt he was wearing under his half-buttoned button-up uniform. It was like talking to a friend. Really nice guy, really nice service, really nice food. HIGHLY RECOMMEND
author: Trinity H.

description: So their grand re opening is a BUST they are closed all day i just went and they are not taking customers may13,2017 Saturday DO NOT COME HERE
author: Tom I.

description:
I came here a week ago and had their salmon dish that came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies. The salmon was delicious, but I was very disappointed with the sides. The mashed potatoes tasted more like mashed cheese and the "mixed veggies" was just a pile of green beans! My husband ordered the mac n cheese dish and it was super bland. 

As for service, our waitress forgot about us for a long time. When she finally came by near the end of our meal, she asked us if we wanted our checks. We said, yes, but we really need more water. She nodded and left. She then returned with the check but no water. Then we asked for water again and she just smiled and walked away. When she came back to retrieve the check (still with no water), we had to demand it and she said, "Oh okay, sure no prob, I'll bring some water." She needs to work on her listening skills.

Literally, 1 star for good salmon.
author: Jane P.

description: This has to be the worst place in San Francisco to try to eat, was told a 45 min. Wait to start then had 3 large crowds seated ahead of us then told our wait was bumped after an hour and a half we walked hungry and shocked that an establishment such as that provides such poor customer service to small parties wishing to enjoy themselves. So Fuck you Hard Rock San Francisco.
author: Gary D.

description: Brutal experience. Bartender disappeared.  How can I be so non-existent at a half empty bar. Never checked on me.
author: Jeremy W.

description: I heard back from Mr. Ponchetti, the operations manager, last week (sorry late posting). He apologized for the delay in response and wanted to follow up on my visit. He listened as I explained to him what happened during our visit and followed up with questions. He was very receptive and seemed genuinely disappointed in the service provided. He didn't try to make excuses for the behavior of our server but simply said it was unacceptable and goes against everything they teach and expect of their staff. He was definitely willing to listen and even offered approaches he would be taking to remedy the issues. I'm hopeful that he will take my negative experience to teach the staff in the hopes of preventing the same experience for another guest.  Having the restaurant manager and operations manager reach out showed me the true values of the company, let's be honest, Hard Rock didn't need to respond to me, they'll have visitors due to their name, but by doing so it showed me they value their customer's experience and want to stand behind their brand.
author: S T.

description:
Overall, if you are in the area or visiting Pier 39, the Hard Rock Cafe is an affordable option. However, with many other restaurants at Pier 39 and on the wharf, I'd look elsewhere.

Since we haven't been in the Fisherman's Wharf area for a while, we decided to play tourist for the day and check out the area and finish off the day with dinner at Hard Rock.  At one time we used to make an effort to stop by a Hard Rock while traveling domestically and internationally to dine and/or buy a souvenir t-shirt.  But, I'm glad that phase of my life is history.  

Hard Rock's menu is standard American fare consisting of salads, fish/meat entrees, BBQ, sandwiches and burgers.  We opted for:

New York Strip Steak- a USDA choice 28-day aged 12-oz New York strip steak topped with maître d' butter and served with hash brown waffles and green beans.  Cooked medium rare as ordered, but felt the steak was not that tender. 

Hickory-Smoked Barbecue Trio Combo - with chicken, pulled pork and beef brisket. The pulled pork was moist, but the chicken and beef brisket was on the dry side. 

The restaurant had only about 12 patrons on a Friday evening, which was far from the crowded Hard Rocks as we remembered. Hence, service from our server was efficient and friendly.  Hard Rock will have its fans dining on standard American fare amidst music memorabilia and music videos. But for others, there are other options in the area.
author: Al L.

description:
Coming from FL I know Hard Rock is touristy.  We had just come off of a catamaran trip and were hungry.  I have to say this was the best Hard Rock experience I've had of any of the locations I have been to.  The drinks were great and my club sandwich was on spot.

The whole staff was really nice too.  So for being a chain I give them props.  They did well!!
author: Amy C.

description: Haven't been to a Hard Rock in years so we decided to try this one. Service was horrible!!!!!  Took forever to get served.  Or even a drink! The hostess was so rude to everyone that was in front of us! People that were seated got up and left.  Food was so expensive but only ok.  Not bad but nothing to write home about! Really wished we had just went to Bubba Gumps and paid that hefty price! At least we would have had our drinks full.  We won't be returning. I had to take my bill to the bartender to get it paid. Waitress disappeared.   Don't advise a visit unless you have time to kill and your own water bottle!
author: Jessica G.

description:
I had the opportunity to dine here recently and the experience wasn't so good. There was a mixup as to who was taking care of our table and we weren't even greater until 20 minutes after we were sat. I thought that was a fluke but the service continued to be super slow through the remainder of our visit. We were not offered refills or even condiments and had 4 different people handling our table. We had no idea who our server was. When we asked for condiments we were told to ask our server but again, had no idea who that was. When my chicken arrived it was raw. We called the manager over he inspected it and he imminently took it away while he apologized profusely. 

They compensated our bill and offered us gift cards to come back and try Hard Rock another times. We graciously accepted the offer. I think that was really considerate of them so I decided to hold off on my review until we gave them another chance. 

We decided to try Hard Rock again and had an exceptional experience. Everything from the food to the waitstaff and cocktails were on point! We were seated promptly, our server was extremely attentive and on top of everything. When the food come out it was so delicious! The burgers were cooked perfectly and we enjoyed our experience. 

We have been back 3 times since the negative experience and have had nothing but great experiences. I now see Hard Rock as a go to place. I would bring my friends and family here because they have showed me that mistakes happen and how you handle them is what matters. HR more than made up for the one disappointing experience we had. Can't wait to come back again!
author: Nicole B.

description: Spent the weekend in San Francisco and before we got on the boat to Alcatraz we stopped to have lunch, we got there before it was busy. Our waiter was awesome! Food was GREAT!! I got a "the house " side salad and it was by far best said salad I have ever have! Delicious! I ordered the BLT added avocado.. Yum. Had fries with Parmesan cheese and for the dipping sauce garlic Parmesan.. Omg best fries I had in a long time! All around had a great time!
author: Malayna K.

description: Food was ok, service was slow. Burgers could have had more flavor. Would go again for the fries.
author: Javier M.

description:
So I made reservations for a group party of 56 and first of all, I want to comment on the customer service. My friend ordered a bacon cheese burger plain and the waiter named Alexandra refused to put in a plain order. She told him to take it off himself. When my friend asked her why couldn't the kitchen make it plain she gave him attitude. When she asked us what we wanted to drink and my friend order a Sprite and a water she seemed to get stressed out over this simple request. 

Then as Alexandra was handing one of my friend a drink another drink on her tray fell and spilled. She panicked and shoved my friends water and aggressively said "Here! take it take it!" 

Fast forward to the actual food. Me and my friend ordered the red roasted pasta and it was cold. We asked a different waiter if we could get another plate with actual hot pasta and we got cold pasta again. I appreciate the effort but I was highly disappointed considering each one of our party paid $20 each for this. Overall, the customer service was really bad because we received attitude and eye rolling every time we asked for a straw or a refill. Won't be holding a group party here anymore.
author: Alisha M.

description:
This place is outstanding. Just on first it was hard to find a place to sit and relax and some some good food and beers.

It was excelent! Jumbo combo for 2 person and lunch is done! Very good meal. A little bit fat but the taste was really good.

Perfect place to wait before going to alcatraz island.
author: Stephan Z.

description:
After visiting the super bowl city, friends and me walked to pier 39 and landed up at Hard Rock Cafe for a few drinks.
As we entered, was welcomed by the host and she seated us next to the entrance so we kindly requested to seat us elsewhere so she was like take the menus and sit 2 tables away. So we started moving and some uninformed crew member comes running and starts to speak in a high pitch saying that you can't do that as it might be reserved for someone else. You need to inform the host.
Once seated we started browsing the menu and we see that there are no prices on the menu for the drinks. This is totally not acceptable and when I asked my server about it, he says that they all are different prices in a rude tone.
Why the hell does such a huge brand not show their drink prices on the menu?
What if after I order the drink, in the check i see they charged me 50$. That is a very smart way to fool customers.
The drinks and food were not outstanding as well.
I just had a few drinks and left asap, a very disappointing experience.
author: Shreyash S.

description: It's very nice when you can afford your dinner and enjoy the surroundings of respectful and friendly people. The cashier was really polite as well as all of the rest of the customers. I'm thankful
author: Aaron N.

description:
Very good fajitas.... Loved it!!!
Would definitely recommend if you are on pier 39. Suggest get reservation on weekends.
author: Udai R.

description: Jasmine was amazing!! She made the experience awesome definitely coming again when she works! Atmosphere was great and drinks awesome try the sangria
author: Tony O.

description:
My husband and I have visited Hard Rock Cafes in many locations, and we had high hopes of the one at Pier 39. On today's visit, we were seated right away, and were able to order right away as well. It took  almost 40 minutes to get our food, though we'd only ordered Nachos, and chicken tenders from the appetizer menu. The food was very good despite the tiny amount of chicken on the nachos. The service was lacking, and very slow. (The description for 2 stars reads, "Meh. I've experienced better."   That reflects my experience in a nutshell.)

P.S. WAY too much money for such a tiny bit of chicken on the Nachos. They were tiny bean sized bits of chicken. Maybe  1/8 of a cup. It was weird.
author: A.L. H.

description:
I've been to many other Hard Rocks before and this location was definitely the least impressive.
It looked like a regular restaurant, wasn't very clean, and the service sucked.

Once we got seated, it took our server about 15-20 min to come to our table. I noticed we weren't the only ones who had horrible service since there were a couple of tables around us where we saw people leaving.

Although our server was nice, I wish she wasn't as absent minded and attended to us quickly.

We just ordered the Jumbo Combo...it was big enough for it to be our appetizer/meal.

One good thing about Hard Rock is that if you're a AAA member, you get 10% of your full meal which was nice.

Overall, probably wouldn't come here again. It's a much cheaper looking version of Hard Rock but the prices are just as high as other Hard Rocks. Would rather spend my $ at one of the nicer locations.
author: Vaishnovi K.

description: After asking twice to be seated with empty tables, we sat out there for 10 minutes. Wing totally ignored - not even I will be with u in a minute. We walked out - don't need our business apparently
author: Dms D.

description:
I expected more from Hard rock.
the atmosphere like the other is nice. 
The service, a different story. Our server was extremely slow, and wasn't apologetic at all. The food was lukewarm when served.
The drinks were watered down and not tasty.
I wouldn't return here unless I am not the one paying.
author: Nicky V.

description: Default lunch location for us when visiting Pier 39. Good drinks and consistently good food!
author: Ankur G.

description:
Ok. First off.....props to Bree (sounds like the cheese only not spelled the same.  I realize the month+ old reservation was for a party of plus 35 and that explains why nothing was ready waiters working other tables at the same time etc. At $25 bucks a pop the tip is already there. She still her job.  In fact she did an excellent job!

As for the food?  Think Disneyland.  Only not quite as good. Sure it's Saturday. ...fishermans wharf...90 degree weather...loads if tourists and free fireworks tonight. But c'mon. I bet the only thing in the kitchen that wasn't microwaved is the 2000 lb vat of garlic powder that's liberally tossed on everthing. I had a burger with a piece of lettuce that wouldn't show on my note 3 ' s camera! ( Bree brought me some lettuce in less than 4 minutes while still delivering the 2nd round if drinks and taking two late dinner orders.

I could go on.  Bottom line. ....I know it's for tourists but, as the Grinch would say..." what is the deal?". If you're for Minot than stop on by. Other than that. ..? 5 stars for Bree...negative 3 for the rest....

Ok. Update. I just found out the Manager Jesus says they're comping everything. Don't know what to say. We were not being obnoxious so it appears that ge IS the man. Change to 4 stars
author: Larry D.

description:
Two stars for food, five stars on service.

Like almost all Hard Rock Cafes, this one is also located in a very touristy spot.  Surprisingly, the wait wasn't too long, about 40 minutes for a table for 4.  The food is standard American fare.  My dad got the Cobb salad, my sister got a veggie burger, my mom a veggie sandwich, and chicken fajitas for me.

My sister didn't like her veggie burger much.  She said there was a minty taste to it that she didn't like.  My mom loved her veggie sandwich, but the fries that came with it tasted like it had been under a heat lamp for too long.  The texture was as if it was microwaved.  The chicken fajitas and Cobb salad were satisfactory.

My dad also ordered an alcoholic drink.  I forget what it was, but it was like a pina colada with strawberry.  It was pretty good.

And like all Hard Rock Cafes, the atmosphere is loud and boisterous.  Service at this location was great.  Our waitress was attentive and made us feel welcome.

So if you're at Pier 39 and aren't feeling adventurous, Hard Rock Café has the menu that won't scare you.  Just remember that you're paying for the location.
author: Vira P.

description: Recently visited this location with my family while we were on vacation exploring the pier. We went around 2:30ish in the afternoon and while it was slightly busy we were seated quickly and brought out drinks shortly after. Our waiter took our orders but then seemed to disappear until our food was ready. We never got refills on our drinks until after our food came, and since there was a lunch rush it took about 25 mins. for us to get our food. The food was excellent when we got it and the atmosphere was fun to be in. I would definitely return to this location in the future.
author: Katelyn R.

description:
Great atmosphere, good food, and a ton of local attractions within spitting distance. Stop in for classic food and classic music. They don't open for early breakfast but early enough for something pre lunch.

These guys opened their doors at 0630 to host the California Coast Classic riders for their embarking breakfast and opening ceremonies. Very cool.
author: Jason B.

description: Paid $50 for two chicken Caesar salads and a side of fries, with some of the total being a tip. Decent food, but way too expensive for a broke college student. Maybe next time.
author: D C.

description: Classic hard rock cafe and in the middle of touristy fisherman's wharf. Loved my visit there.
author: Sujith R.

description:
Service is bad. Mistake after mistake. Food is good. I love Hard Rock, otherwise would have been no star. 
Sincerely, from NYC
author: Marina S.

description: Best Virgin Pina Coladas I've ever had. I don't know what they did, but it tasted like a pineapple coconut milkshake. Yum!
author: Desiree W.

description: Pathetic ambience and we paid to get frozen!  I'm a local SF'er and took friends there on 1/1/2017. Waiter was very kind, food was OK but very overpriced. (ROAM & UMAMI burgers on Union Street tip the charts at  only $9 for a better burger!)  $18 for a burger that was well done when I ordered it rare & soggy fries. They have no dijon mustard only the old fashioned French's Yellow stuff.  Warm chocolate desert was lovely but we froze while dining:  it was a cold January day here in City by the Bay but hey guys, CLOSE THE DOOR . Try devouring a burger with gloves on!  Don't tell me it's the construction door - seal it off! This is far from a cool Hard Rock Cafe and no way my local SF self will ever return or suggest it to others. Have fun elsewhere on Pier 39 .. like Fog Harbor which rocks and is warm inside!
author: Guido B.

description: No draft beer. No draft beer. No draft beer. Can you believe it? Unacceptable. I want a Stella and now I can't have one. You are horrible, hard rock. Horrible.
author: Jackson Z.

description: Waited 15 min just to order a drink then another 15 to get the drink and then another 30 min to pay to leave. Wasn't that busy at the time.
author: Jacob H.

description:
I went there last night for dinner, I am a local and come here on occasion. I was bringing a friend in for the first time because I like the atmosphere and the food has always been decent. There was a bit of a wait, no problem. When we began giving our order, the waitress became very confused. I am a heart patient and on an extremely restricted diet. All I wanted was a hamburger in a lettuce wrap with onion and tomatoes, that's it...no cheese, no sauce, no fries...just the burger. I was served a burger with cheese, sauce in a cup on my plate, and fries. After informing the waitress, she took it back and said they would take care of it. Twenty minutes later, she brought it back along with the other items I didn't order. It was the same burger, they scraped off most of the cheese, it was cold and dry. After two bites, I saw a glob of cheese on the edge of the burger. By this time, my dinner companions had finished their meal. I scraped off the cheese and ate it anyway. Another order at the table was also incorrect, they had forgotten a side dish that came with her meal. I told the waitress that she didn't get everything, so she brought her the side, with no fork since she had already cleared their dishes. She was rude upon delivery, heavy sighs and a dismissive attitude. On the way out, I mentioned to the host that my meal and the experience were not good. The waitress and the manager were summoned to speak to me, no problem. After telling them of the issues, the manager began to argue with me. He said that he personally supervised the cook when my burger was brought back to the kitchen, and insisted that it was a fresh burger. I told him that I didn't believe that, because it was cold and they hadn't scraped all of the cheese off. He did comp us the meal, and he was most unpleasant about it. I simply wanted to inform him that if I were a person with a dairy allergy, that meal would have put me into the closest emergency room. So WARNING to those with a DAIRY ALLERGY, do not eat here, they're okay with putting you in danger. 

Had the staff been nicer about the entire experience, it's likely I may have gone back to give them another chance. I will not return. Oh, and the friend that was with me, his firm will not be calling for reservations for their weekly company lunch. He was appalled at the way we were treated and spoken to.
author: Jen G.

description:
The Manager Ryan, has gone out of his way to take care of the below average food, that we received. I am upgrading the restaurant, planning on my next visit.

                                              Thanks Hard Rock,

                                              Jon H.
author: Jon H.

description: Last night I had the Bay Burger at HRC and it was fantastic.  Very unusual combination of ingredients but they all came together perfectly.  Angus beef, Gruyere cheese, pickles, and 1000 island dressing with a side  of homemade giardinara.  Served with a nice glass of Merlot, some good tunes and memorabilia made for a great meal.  Thanks to Matthew for excellent service
author: Robin R.

description: The food is overpriced garbage. Ordered a pulled chicken sandwich...tasted like boiled chicken. Draft beer selection was out of all beer. Staff was super nice but still didn't make up for the terrible food. Kids menu is terrible too.
author: Diego M.

description: 2/19/16, server was B.  Cool guy on point and courteous. Food was delish. U can walk around and check out the memorabilia and listen to sum beats. Don't be a scrooge all of sf is pricey!
author: YelpsteR 2.

description:
The service was great, this review is no reflection of the service... But the food was awful. The most bland and boring food I have literally ever had at a restaurant. 

The price is high for what you get, the value is just not there. 

I ordered the chicken club and that's what it was... A bland chicken breast with bacon, lettuce, tomato and mayo on mildly toasted bread. $16.

Husband ordered a cheeseburger, unseasoned beef, melted cheese, lettuce, tomato, and bun. $18

The fries were, basic fries but good. 

Now we know.
author: Josh T.

description:
Awesome place!!! A true Hard Rock Cafe atmosphere, love it :))
Good music, good people, the only thing I noticed at the moment I was there is that the service was a little bit slow, but not a big deal. 
Recommend it !
author: Andrew J.

description:
Aside from the loud music, the food is pretty good! For the price we paid it did fill us up, but most of the dishes aren't anything special. Mostly burgers and steak and such :)

I got the macaroni cheese with grilled chicken and it was pretty appetizing. Like I said, nothing special but I think this restaurant is known more for the atmosphere. The people who work here are really nice, though, so that's always a plus!
author: Cindy M.

description:
I'm not a fan of chain restaurants-- but, I reluctantly went here for lunch after taking visiting family to Alcatraz this afternoon.
Our server was excellent.
I had a beer and the "Twisted Mac, Chicken and Cheese"
Sorry to report that the beer was the highlight of the meal......
author: Thomas D.

description:
I grew up in the Bay Area and San Francisco has always been like a second home to me. Even so, sometimes it's fun to be a tourist in your own city. That being said, we spent a good amount of time walking around the cheesy souvenir shops and horrible fast food kiosks that are scattered throughout the Warf. To end the night right, we decided to have dinner at the Hard Rock!

Usually I do all I can to avoid chain restaurants; especially in a town like SF that is known for its amazing restaurants. Regardless, Hard Rock is my only exception. We showed up around 7pm on a Saturday night and were told there would be a 45 minute wait. Not surprisingly, there's a large gift shop to mosey around in while you kill time. Finally, the vibrating thingy they gave me started going crazy which meant our table was ready.

We were led to our table right next to one of many television screens playing live performances of the legendary rock stars mixed in with modern-day music videos. The music is also blaring through the speakers at all times. If you're sensitive, be sure to bring some ear plugs.

The menu at every Hard Rock is more or less exactly the same. It's filled with typical American food that any unadventurous tourist would be comfortable with. They also have many, many pictures of the food throughout the many, many pages of the menu. The portions are humungous so I landed on one of their entree sized appetizers. I got the Santa Fe spring rolls (with spinach, black beans, cilantro, corn, jalapeños, red peppers, jack cheese, salsa, guacamole-chipotle ranch dressing, and tortilla straws). This "appetizer" was absolutely huge and was more than enough for just me. These little rolls were nice and crispy on the outside and filled with cheesy goodness on the inside. My favorite part easily had to be the guac-chipotle ranch dipping sauce!

Hard Rock is your typical tourist trap selling artery clogging dishes in seemingly every city in the world. Nonetheless, it's a guilty pleasure and the collectable pins are always great gifts!
author: Kevin R.

description: Not even packed and it took a long time to get refills. Burger was bland, well done(asked for medium rare) and the tomato was half green still. The mac and cheese/fish and chips were delicious others at my table got but I would avoid burgers.
author: Jordan H.

description:
I came here with the intention of having a great meal to finish off my San Francisco trip. 

My server's name was Mark, and he was pretty nice, made small talk, took our orders, etc etc. Everything was good at first but then took a wild turn....While Mark was serving our orders, he spilled food all over me and the table. It was honestly fine because people make mistakes sometimes. He quickly said sorry and replaced the food. We mentioned multiple times that we were on a time constraint because we needed to catch a specific train back home. I think because my group of girl friends and I were teenagers, he took advantage of us (not in that way!!). Paying between a group is always complicated, and some of us didn't have change to pay. My dish was around $11 but I only had a $20 bill. Even with tax and tip, the dish did not cost me anywhere near $20. A similar situation happened between two of my other friends. 

We asked for boxes and he took forever to get them, so we went up trying to find them ourselves but didn't find them. Please make a note that the restaurant at the time was only about a quarter filled, there wasn't even a lot of people that needed attention at the time. 

Eventually, we didn't have time to wait, and he never showed up, so unfortunately we just ended up paying way more than the service we received.
author: Serina L.

description:
I dined here a couple of times before deciding to write a review. First off, the staff is well trained. They did everything they were supposed to and in my last visit, we had two managers at different times check in on us. I appreciate restaurant management that cares about their customers.

My favorite item is the pulled pork sandwich. It's perfectly paired with coleslaw, baked beans and fried. Even the coleslaw was excellent, I just wish the sides were a little bigger! Macaroni isn't the item to order though. 

Other than that, the cocktails are not overbearing and presented nicely. The whole ambiance of the restaurant is pretty sweet, awesome to just enjoy at the bar too. I haven't been on a busy night so I recommend day dining here.
author: Monica A.

description:
Hard Rock always accommodates. Nice people, great HR atmosphere! 
At this HR...Ariana rocks. She is sweet, helpful and thinks of everything. The experience was a positive! 
Thanks HR and Ariana
author: Craig P.

description: The cocktails are great and very reasonalbly priced. Only $6 for non alcohol ones. The food is average and quite overpriced. The good thing is they validate your parking ticket.
author: Au N.

description:
After fighting traffic and finally finding a parking spot, me and my family were ready to eat. We decide on the HardRock Cafe. Once we were seated we had the pleasure of having Audi as our server. He was amazing. And after everything it took us to get there, he was just what we needed to brighten up our day. He was very personal, made us laugh many times and was an awesome server. The food was great but the wonderful dining experience we shared with Audi was the highlight of our day.
If you ever visit the HardRock Cafe, i hope you are lucky enough to have Audi as your server. He is the best!!! Btw he deserves a raise $$$
author: Frank L.

description:
Currently writing this while waiting for my food to come. Terrible experience so far, hoping the food makes up for it but I don't have high hopes. We were a group of six and told the wait time would be 10-20 minutes, so we waited. After 20 minutes I went back to the hostess and she assured me that there was just one table they were waiting on to be bussed and it would take about 10 more minutes. After waiting ANOTHER 15 minutes I asked again and she just said she couldn't do anything and was going to get us in as soon as possible. About 10 minutes after that our pager finally went off and we were seated. Once inside, we noticed there were 10+ empty tables large enough to accommodate our party, and they seem to have more than enough staff just standing around, so not sure why we had to wait almost an hour to be seated. After no server addressed our table for 15 minutes, I physically had to go up to another worker and request that we get a server. Eventually someone came and now here I am 20 minutes later, writing this review while waiting for our food. Definitely never coming back here.


UPDATE:
Food came. It was not good. (Mac and cheese was pretty good, nothing special but no complaints about it). HOWEVER, my boyfriend ordered a burger, it came out practically raw (as was another burger that someone else in our party ordered) the cheese wasn't melted on, bacon looked unappetizing, and overall looked very very different from the menu. So neither person ate the burgers for fear of getting sick from consuming raw meat. It gets worse. My boyfriend was finishing off a fairly good salad that someone else has ordered, when he found something that looked strange. I guessed it was a stray piece of chicken, he thought it was weird lettuce. It turned out to be a very tightly crumpled up piece of a STRAW WRAPPER. That's right, a straw wrapper mixed into the salad. We had no straw wrappers at any point on our table, so this clearly came from the kitchen, based on how it was mixed so well into the salad. I'm just happy that he found it before eating it, I hope the person who was originally eating salad didn't accidentally ingest any non-food items that may have been present. After requesting the manager, he came to our table and apologized for our negative experience (and this is prior to the food even coming out). He ended up taking care of our entire meal, so at least we didn't have to pay for this absolutely appalling service, food, and overall awful experience.
author: Adriana E.

description:
Service and atmosphere are good as it has almost always been.  The food quality is slipping.  The artichoke spinach dip was served with stale bread.  The burgers had plain buns and not one of our party of four would order their lunch again.  (All burgers)

Hope they pick up the food quality again sometime but we have had our last $100+ Hard Rock experience.
author: Charles O.

description:
This place is all about the atmosphere.

It's touristy, just like the other hard rock places. But it doesn't try to hide it and there's ample bar space. 

If you're visiting/live in sf there are better places to eat and drink, but it's a nice spot to stop in and round out your night of the wharf.

EDIT: minus one star for a bartender with attitude. All he had to do was check us out of an empty bar. Maybe he was having a bad day, but in a touristy area consistency is important.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Touristy, noisy, bland food and mediocre service. We were here with a large party and booked a price fix menu. The service was slow and not particularly warm. Refills of drinks rare. The "legendary" burger was quite ordinary.

Then the deadly blow. We waited more than 1hr to received our promised chocolate cookie dessert. At the end we had to ask, because they had seemingly forgotten about us. And we were offered... Oreos. I kid you not.

Never again.
author: Stefano Z.

description: Typical Hard Rock Cafe. Always get the fajitas. Stick with chicken. I did the combo of chicken and beef and the beef was not enjoyable. It was rubbery and just blocks of cubes and not really meant for fajitas. The strawberry lemonade was refreshing and delicious. The spinach and artichoke dip was good
author: Heather S.

description: When I arrived here, it wasn't terribly busy. We got a seat right away and our server was timely and friendly. This review is based only the food. I believe i got what was called the original legendary burger. The server did not ask how I wanted it cooked, so one would assume then that it would be fully cooked. That assumption was terribly wrong. I got my burger and it was mostly raw. I do not send my food back because I have had many friends that used to be servers and I have been told some pretty awful stories. I was pretty hungry so I decided to try it out, until I had a bite that was literally cold and raw. I'm surprised they didn't have me sign a waiver for that one. Totally disappointed, and such a waste of my time and money.
author: Bethanny S.

description: My mother, brother, and roommate came here when we were touristing around SF and the drinks were 3 oz which made everything we drank gross. I'm kind of an alcohol connoisseur and can drink really hard stuff, but these drinks weren't even good.  The flavored margarita 3-pack was really gross, hard to drink. I would rather just drink something I poured together outside a club in my car 10 years ago. The food was just alright. The Hard Rock in Vegas was way better than this.
author: Cody C.

description: Service was terrible, what's up with pier 39 and the bad service... we waited for a table for a half an hour in an almost empty restaurant. The hostess acted bothered we would even want to eat here, give me a break it's the hard rock.
author: Joey D.

description: Awesome awesome service. We came in Fourth of July and our server Najah (forgive me if I misspelled) was absolutely the highlight of our experience. Her ability to make us feel like HER close friends after barely meeting us is unheard of. For someone who works in the resteraunt  industry, she impressed me. Her service alone would bring me back here. Five stars across the board.
author: Katie B.

description: So...we live right across the street. There is an INCREDIBLY loud rock concert going on outside of Hard Rock. We have children and I'm trying to call repeatedly to the restaurant to ask when it will be over, but when you call, an automated messages gives you the extension of each manager which then goes to a voicemail. Incredibly frustrating.
author: Katy M.

description:
I wish I could remember the name of our waiter; he was a cool dude. I think we ordered a bit too much food for just two people, and we racked up a $100 tab . The food and service was worth it.

Other than the reasonably pricey menu, definitely check it out even if you're a Bay Area native. Good place to come for drinks.
author: Marcos B.

description:
Wow what a stereotyical touristy place to eat. If you're in San Francisco there are hundreds of better places to eat than here ESPECIALLY for the amount of money you'd be spending. You don't have to go far to find good seafood either, you're right at the pier! That said, the food here isn't necessarily bad, I would just expect a lot more if I'm paying that much. 

All in all, if you're reading this, you're looking for a place to eat near the pier. Don't eat here.
author: Vishaal P.

description: Didn't even get a chance to be seated, while trying to find a restroom me and a toddler, BOB I'm assuming the supervisor stops us, ask us are we eating here. I tell him we are waiting for another party to come and he points us outside the restaurant to the public restrooms and say these restrooms are for dine in customers. Stay away if you have kids!
author: Lama M.

description: Food is alright. I had a turkey club sandwich and the turkey was on the dry side and my fries were barely warm. My friend got a chicken burger that looked juicy and delicious...he said it was really good. We got there around 9:30pm on a Sunday and there were a lot of folks there. We were greeted without a smile by the host and our waiter. Smiles go a LONG WAYS people! Our waiter was also very difficult to hear due to the loud music, which I'm not complaining about at all. I loved that! But our waiter seemed so disinterested in communicating with us that we had to strain to hear him. Overall, with the food and the ambiance combined, I'd give it 3.5 stars. I'd likely go back and hope for a better experience.
author: Melanie D.

description: Come for the atmosphere not the service. Took a long time to place our orders. Long time for food to arrive. Even longer for a bill. Discussed meal and mill out some nice dine and dash would be too aggressive. One glass of water, no refills. Our server did come and ask if everything was okay on her hurried way to hold up the banister.
author: Mary V.

description: Went in for drink. Waited for 10 minutes before Johnny the bartender stopped B essing with customers. Finally acknowledged us , I asked if he had a drink menu, he answered yes. I had to then ask to see it. That did it, we walked. Told a hostess who also cared less. Should be zero stars
author: Rob B.

description:
I wish I could give a 0 stars.
Ate here today, what a mistake.  Nachos were cold when they came, one meal came out at a time, after all the meals finally came I took 1 byte of my chicken Caesar salad.... Wilted slimy disgustingness.  Waiter did nothing but apologize the entire meal.  Sorry the nachos were cold, sorry we forgot to submit the kids meal order, sorry we put tomatoes on your hamburger, sorry we forgot to bring green beans with kids meal, it was a mess.  After we just wanted the check the manager came over and said something I had never heard of before. He offered to comp our meal if he could not give us a receipt.  Not sure why.  At that point I just wanted out. We left a $20on the table to top wait staff.  I will never ever go here again.  I hope tourists do not think this is American food. This is garbage.
author: Lisa Y.

description:
It's Hard Rock, so you're coming for the atmosphere.  Here, on Pier 39, it's pretty fun and worthwhile.  If you've never been to Hard Rock, the food is good, but I've stuck to burgers and nachos.  Everything else is too expensive for what I'm in the mood for when I go to HRC.  The kids also like their food.  But, it's fun and I love seeing the memorabilia. The kids also like it which helps!  The waiter was nice and we were able to sit right away at about 11:30am.  

I also won a free dessert by checking in.  The waiter suggested the brownie ice cream bowl b/c it was big.  All 4 of us enjoyed it.  It was a great, warm brownie with lots of ice cream.  They also have a good selection of beer, with local beers, as well.

There's a lot of 60s and San Fran stuff here. Grateful Dead, Hendrix, Journey, Beatles, Pete Townsend.
author: Mike H.

description:
Went here for a friends 50th birthday party. It was on a Saturday night very busy so you would assume they would have a full wait staff. Not here it was non-existent. They just weren't organized at all. 
I had the cowboy rib eye ..... if this is what cowboys eat they would all die of hunger....this was the thinnest rib eye I have ever seen, I asked for it medium and it came well done. There New York strip was like chewing gum. Not a very good experience at all.
Won't be coming back anytime soon.
author: Rodo A.

description:
I dragged my sister here because they had a vegan burger.  My veggie burger was tasty.  My sister thought they were cheap with the produce on her BLT.

We had to wait quite awhile for a table, so don't go when you're starving.  If you hate loud restaurants, this is not the place for you.  It was loud as hell in the restaurant - not just music; it seemed like the acoustics amplified all the patrons' voices.
author: Marie V.

description:
Bad reviews about this place I'm reading...hmhm.

I don't know much about Hard Rock Cafes in general. 
I just know dear Julia's collecting HRC t-shirts..
I've been the Universal studio one a long time ago, 
passed by the one in LV.

 Hard Rock Cafe San Francisco is located right at Pier 39.
It had great collections on the wall, including Nirvana guitar and all..

We sat on the patio, so it was less loud.
Service was ok. 
Had a deal with getting beer glass.
Hard Rock Cafe is having 40th birthday this year!
The names of the Hard Rock Cafe in the world was written on my beer glass which I brought home with me. 
I think that's cool. 
Very cool.

I had Stella. 
That's cool, too.

We also had chick fingers and fries.
They didn't have sweet potato fries. Soo behind or what!
Chicken fingers we didn't finish..
author: Jean Y.

description: I had the hot brownie desert and a margarita. Both were pretty good. I sat at the bar and receive great service. The prices are reasonable. I paid 23 with tip n all.
author: David G.

description: It's your basic Hard Rock cafe. It's currently under construction so there is no bar and everything is under a tarp so it's very limited seating. As for the food, I had the Legendary Burger and Fries. The same as I get at the other 5 million Hard Rocks I've eaten at (with the exception of the few Local Legendaries I've had). Good Food and Good Customer Service.
author: Robb F.

description: Going in we knew not to expect too much. We were just hungry and knew everything was going to be over priced and mediocre. It didn't take too long to be seated and the drinks were okay. The food was expensive and I've honestly gotten better burgers at IHOP. The clam chowder was gross and the bread was stale. Again, we weren't expecting much but when the waitress came back with our check she told us she accidentally charged us three times so we'd have to wait however long it takes our bank to process everything but not to worry because the payment went through....we're here on vacation and now a big chunk of our spending money isn't going to be available for us to spend but we're suppose to be fine with that? Well it's not fine. Horrible experience and we won't be back. The hot dog I had from a little cart was better then the food we had here.
author: Yessenia P.

description:
Food was a 3.5 stars. I got the salmon as I'm not really a big burger girl. It was actually really good, but the side of green beans was basically just thrown on there and had no flavor and were cold. 

My boyfriend got the fiesta burger and it was huge. But to him it wasn't lol he said he could go for another. Kind of pricey for what you get, but considering it's there for tourist. Not too bad. 

We ordered two shots and two mixed drinks. 10.75$ for a shot of hennessy. Pretty pricey but what'd we expect. 

Service overall was actually really good. 4 stars. He sat down explained the menu since some of us hadn't been there before. I did notice there aren't a lot of menu options. But he came back often refilled waters, etc. 

Now that I signed up for the rewards, well be back. Just maybe a different location!
author: Taylor J.

description: So I order a steak well done.. They bring me outa damn near medium well.. Why ask me if you are just going to bring me what the hell you want me to have? Super wack. Just pissed that I'm out with my family trying to have a good meal and then ppl who don't want to come to work show up and give mediocre service. My sis ordered chicken nachos and they didn't even give her chicken on the nachos. The manager Alex was super cool about the situation and did what he could to rectify the situation. So I appreciate that a lot. But man. Really disappointed I didn't get my steak.
author: Mia S.

description: We had to wait 45 minutes for a table even though for at least 20 minutes of our wait there was about 12 open tables. After we were seated a friend and I ordered a margarita trio they had on the menu with chips and salsa. The margaritas were disgusting and didn't taste any different, the chips were cold and the salsa plain. We then ordered our food and when it came the fajitas were like 4 pieces of shrimp and a couple pieces of chicken. I had ordered nachos with steak and they forgot to put in the steak. I recommend going down the pier to Bubba Gumps over walking in here.
author: Maria H.

description: The tables are empty and they have an hour + wait time. Then they take another hour to take your order and another hour to bring food out. I feel bad for the staff. The are obviously understaffed.
author: Noemi N.

description: Bad service especially the manager and some staff. They are so rude and the nachos are so saggy. Dont go here its really 1 or negative the most.
author: Sid S.

description:
Worse service ever doesn't even deserve a star.
Starters came out with the food.
Had ask for our drinks and it was still wrong.
author: Alka P.

description:
Coming from New York I have been to multiple hard rock cafes. Saying that, this was a great atmosphere and best Hard Rock Cafe I've been too. I had a Serbian waiter who was super nice and talkative and fast. Everything we asked for (even if it wasn't on then menu) he got. Music great as the memorabilia.!!! Can't wait to come back next time in San Fran.


A lot of fun!!!! 
( 4 stars because of the awesome food and amazing Serbian waiter. Talked a lot about the Olympics)....:)
author: Riley G.

description: Went there once, had great service from the staff there. Had 1 small hiccup with the staff where they forgot the ranch dressing on the side when my friend and I asked for a side of ranch for our salads. It was a simple miscommunication from server to chef, but the manager actually came out, apologized for the missing sides of ranch, and gave us one of the salads for free.
author: Chris K.

description:
Three of these stars are for the great service, which made up for the high prices and touristy atmosphere.  So did the Legacy Burger (classic version, not the local version), which was rare, juicy, and decadant, exactly as ordered.  That was the best way to consume 2000 calories in one sitting that I've ever experienced! Now back to the DASH diet.

My partner had the barbecue sandwich, which was good but not spectacular.  The prices, overall, are unacceptably high, but our meals were prepared well and delivered promptly.  I've had terrible service here in the past, and when it's crowded, I can't stand it - it's noisy, chaotic, and haphazard. Makes you feel like a cheezy tourist just for showing up.  Another problem is that they make you wait when there are visible, empty tables.  They explain that this is because they try to maintain service quality by not overloading the servers, so they will only open up enough tables for the number of servers on duty.

But the bottom line is that we had a good experience despite the overpriced menu, because our server went above and beyond to make it happen.  I wish I got his name - it was late on a Sunday afternoon, and he was a very pleasant Hispanic man who was clearly a very advanced, sophisticated waiter. We sat right near the entrance.

Other pros: Manager stopped by and genuinely inquired about how things were going. We let him know the men's room needed attention, and he had someone take care of it at once.

Cons: The greeting/hosting staff need training.  Once our buzzer went off, we had to endure a few minutes of shifting from one foot to another while they discussed where to seat us, bent over the hostess stand with their backs to us. We were then escorted to a table so casually that it was hard to follow where we were supposed to go, and it just wasn't a very courteous or alert experience.

Other con: It's exploitative and greedy to leave prices off your drink menu.  C'mon - really?
author: Sheila L.

description: On par with any other Hard Rock cafe I've been to in the US. Although food and drinks are slightly overpriced, they are delicious and I just love the rock music environment here! I usually check out a Hard Rock when I travel somewhere that has one. Try the appetizer sampler, it's huge! We couldn't even finish ours...The beer is cold and if you get the large one, you get to keep the souvenir glass!
author: Brian P.

description: Paying with credit card? Careful! They take out money like they did with me. $10. Yeah it's not a big amount but I tipped in cash! So why take out from my card?! Thieves! If you're drinking water, make sure you shine a light from underneath the glass, phone flashlight or led light and see if there are any little floaters in your water before you drink it! I was a critic for a restaurant blog and I give this place a 2 thumbs down on charging and stealing money from customers and dirty water. I'd rather drink tap from my sink.
author: Tabby U.

description:
I have been to many Hard Rock Cafe's in the U.S. and Europe and this was the worst one. First off, they could not seat our party of 9 at one table because pushing the table together would have been a fire hazard. However, they did have a table set up right in front of the glass doors that led to the outside area. That seemed like the real fire hazard. Secondly, the audio quality was awful. It was difficult to determine what song was playing, you mostly just heard bass. Also, there were not enough tv's to get a good view of the music videos.  

Our food took a very long time to arrive and when it did it was cold as if it had been sitting around for a while. The restaurant wasn't even crowded.

On the positive side, our sever was very good and she had the manager visit us. He was very apologetic and provided us with a very generous adjustment to our final bill.  It seems they have some internal problems that they need to work out. I hope they listen and make some improvements. I really like Hard Rock Cafe's, but I won't be visiting this location again anytime soon.
author: Jeff M.

description:
The free dessert for checking in changed the rating from 2 to 3 for us.  The food is fine here just too expensive... $55 for 3 hamburgers and water to drink is expensive even for Pier 39.

Service was very good though and atmosphere typical Hard Rock.
author: Keith B.

description: The service here was not great. Took 10 minutes to order our drinks. We ordered an appetizer because we were hungry and the appetizer came with our food. What good is it to order an appetizer (supposed to hold you over until the food comes) if it doesn't come out early? The service was slow and you would think we would get the appetizer for free but that wasn't the case. Don't think we will ever eat here again!
author: Corey W.

description:
My dad and step-family came out to visit me for a week. My dad was super excited to show them the SF Wharf. Me, being a local resident, not so much. But, I put away my disdain that day and took them anyway. Of course a trip to the Wharf means a boat ride to Alcatraz. Halfway through the Alcatraz tour, the 11 year old step-nephew started to throw a fit. He was hungry. If this kid doesn't get exactly what he wants (which is usually a plain hamburger, some sort of meat, or chicken tenders), he gets super cranky and awful.  An absolute nightmare. So, we quickly got on the boat and got back to the Wharf and started to walk. That's when we stumbled across this disaster of a restaurant. 

My dad and the step-family said they loved Hard Rock. They ate at one in Pittsburgh that had the best ribs. Whatever you guys say. I am a vegetarian and usually ask to go somewhere more vegetarian friendly, but the 11 year old step-nephew was just being a horrible monster at this point so I agreed to go. We walked inside and immediately got seated. All is going well. We got the menus and I noticed the vegetarian options are very, very few. Even the salads are loaded with bacon and fried meat. The mushroom burger looked unappealing with it's special sauces and whatnot on top, so I special ordered a grilled cheese sandwich. I have done this at other restaurants with no problems because hey, seriously, how hard is it to make a grilled cheese? But doing it at this place was a HUGE mistake. At first the waitress brought out a chicken sandwich - sorry vegetarian only. She then brought out the grilled cheese sandwich and right as she put it in front of me she said, "wow, this looks very burnt, are you ok with this?" I took a look at it and noticed that one of the halves looked like they scorched it and then somehow managed to put the cheese on it. The other half looked ok - but seriously gross. So I said, "yep, this is ok". Mind you I didn't want to send something back a 3rd time and get my food spit on - which with the looks on how well this restaurant prepares food, you know it will happen. My meal did come with fries too so I thought those would fill me up somewhat. They were unsalted and tasted like they had been in the freezer for some time. My meal was just super disgusting.

My step-mom got the salad and it looked super gross and she barely ate it. She said it was one of the worst salads she has ever had. The kids got the ribs and they looked dry and after my dad tasted them, he said they were the most horrible ribs he has ever had. He said the food was a totally different experience from what they had at the Hard Rock in Pittsburgh. My dad was ok with his meal, which was the salad with fried meat and bacon on top. The waitress saw how little I ate and gave us the burnt grilled cheese meal for free, which was a nice gesture. But, my dad ended up paying $180 for some of the grossest food he had in a long time. He said he will never step foot in another Hard Rock again. 

It's obvious this place doesn't care because they know tourists come and go. If this place was in the middle of SF, it would be closed down in a heartbeat.
author: Denise D.

description: I love Hard Rock. We've been to several across the U.S., and consistently have good service. This time I got the hot wings with a side of fries, and my wife got the twisted mac and cheese. We sat up at the bar this time.   The food was great, as usual, and our server was awesome. They even validate your parking for the Pier 39 garage! I honestly don't know why it doesn't have better reviews.
author: Robbie G.

description:
We went there as we wanted to be away from the crowd from pier 39 without leaving the area. Service was ok, took forever to get our server stop by ( during weekday, not busy at all).

Had turkey sandwich,  and the meat was way to dry.

Restrooms were a mess. 

The place itself is nice with interesting memorabilia but service could be improved.
author: Mariel F.

description: Luis Baltodano is a great manager. He is the reason we will be back. Food= good, management= superb
author: Donald L.

description: Always great food.. The wait wasn't long .. Sat in the bar.. Server in the bar seemed a bit slow.. As in his personal skills .. A lot of people due to the water front
author: Nicholas G.

description: Hard Rock Cafes always have great food and this place was no exception. This particular location however was slow to get us seated and very slow to bring out food. The place was not particularly busy the day we ate there either. Appetizers came out shortly after our entrees arrived - huh?
author: Tommy G.

description: We went to the hard rock with high hopes and we left never wanting to go back. The food was way too expensive which I wouldn't mind if only the service  matched the price, which it didn't. The food was overcooked, over seasoned and the service was extremely slow. In the time it took for our meal to come out and us getting our dessert we could've had another meal. The kids didn't even want the dessert by the time it came out, it was ridiculous. The only thing that my kids really liked about the place was all the records on the walls and the pictures and the music but that's to be expected from the Hard Rock Cafe. So we will not be going back anytime soon.
author: Matthew P.

description: Amazing food, I was really pleased. Employees are very amiable, but it does tend to get a bit noisy.
author: Omar G.

description: Alexander took care of us tonight at the bar. He was way beyond kind. I can't express enough how far great service goes. Thank you so so much,Alexander, for taking care of two locals. It's people like you who make us keep coming back.
author: Lizzy A.

description: My bucket list is to attempt to visit all HRC locations!!  So, I'm now crossing off San Francisco location!
author: Eddie C.

description: The atmosphere was amazing and the staff was extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend trying this place - it's a classic. Good beef, good grief, let's eat
author: Linda V.

description: I was pretty disappointed with the service and pricing. The quality of food and portions didn't reflect the pricing. The atmosphere and history granted this venue 2 stars. I wouldn't recommend it.
author: Judge D.

description: We are regulars at the HRC .. Absolutely love the jumbo combo and the bbq chicken..  Looking for a strong drink try the purple haze or the Long Island ice tea! Love it!! Amazing service. Love coming here!
author: Sreelakshmi S.

description: My friend and I came here to eat on Friday for lunch. Despite the fact that the restaurant is merely 1/3 filled, not a single waitress or server came to our table to take order. We were completely ignored as if we were not there for about half an hour. That is not just slow service.
author: Cunwang C.

description: When my family and I first arrived, we were not greeted.  The hostess seemed exhausted and unhappy.  The Texan burger was cold by the time I got it. The green beans that came with the salmon entree tasted like it was frozen, left out to thaw and served cold. I left the empty kids cups out on the side of the table for refill. The waitress didn't bother to offer a refilled until we asked.  For the price of the food, service should match up too.  Unfortunately not here.
author: Mydua H.

description: I only like this place bc my buddy Sam Groovy is a good bartender always making everyone happy!  #tipthebartender
author: Angelica V.

description: My 1st time ever eating at Hard Rock and shockingly it was really good for a chain restaurant!  Free appetizer if you check in on yelp! Got the bruschetta and it was yummy. The ceasar salad was one of the best I've had in a long time, very garlicky! I had their steak and shrimp fajita which was also so good. The beef was super tender. Both the steak and shrimp had yummy marinade. And molten chocolate cake to end it was perfect.  Very shocked how good it was and service was excellent.
author: Karen T.

description:
So before my friend and I start our night shoot adventure we decided to grab a bite to eat first as we were both starving. We walked the entire pier 39 to scour the menu for vegetarian options. Luckily I found the hard Rock menu and they had what I was craving. 

I was a bit skeptical because I know that anyplace that does not specialize in vegetarian  cuisine their food is usually mediocre in that department.

I ordered the Veggie Sandwich - Portabello  mushroom with grilled zucchini squash  on sour dough with balsamic olive oil and pares an asiago  spread I believe?

Omg it was soooo Yummy!!!!! If anyone that has dined with me they  will know when I am happy. I start dancing in my seat as my taste buds dance in delight.

I also got a free appetizer with checkin . 

Ordered the Bruschetta 

Mmmmmmm soooo  DELICIOUS! !!!

THESE ARE THE TYPES OF FOOD THAT KEEP ME VEGETARIAN. 

YUMMY OH YUM 

CAN'T WAIT TO BE BACK.
author: Cheryllyn L.

description: Worst service I've ever experienced in my whole entire life. I don't mind pricey food but I expect great service not waiting over an hour and 30 minutes for a burger .
