Horrible service and obviously slow chefs .  To top it off I waited 40 minutes before getting seated then another hour and a half after I ordered . Save your money and stay away from the hard rock
author: Savannah M.

description: We went to Hard Rock Cafe this past Sunday on a great day in SF weather-wise.  Our server was phenomenal and the food was alright but it was slow to come out and when it did there was a hair on my wife's french fries.  Our waiter was apologetic and immediately corrected the situation by giving my wife a fresh new batch.  The manager came over only at behest of our server to apologize; however, nothing was comped not even the french fries with the hair.  Very disappointing.  Still gave a tip to our waiter who deserved it since he did everything in his power to make amends, but extremely disappointed the manager didn't do more on his end.
author: Steven W.

description: I love going to the HRC, just walking through the door is magic for me, we collect pins and make it a point to grab some. We had drinks and and some nachos on the patio, (they have WiFi). I'm not saying they're the best at food, but the experience makes up for it.
author: Bruce M.

description:
This place is home to the weakest drink I have ever had. I expect that when I order a drink I'm actually going to consume alcohol, not just throw away calories drinking a stupid soda. I ordered a Long Island ($10) which usually has the most bang for your buck and is sometimes even a little strong for my taste. Not here. Tasted nothing, felt nothing (on an empty stomach!) still not convinced the bartender actually put anything in it. I can only imagine what their other drinks are like. They would probably make you LESS drunk. 

I don't even know why they bother having a bar at all. What a tease.
author: Jaleh B.

description: THE SERVICE WAS TERRIBLE!!! I sit down with my family and we start to order and our waiter comes 20 minutes after asking about our drinks so we order some waters and we wait, 30 minutes later our waters come!! Then our waiter says what would you like and we order and the prices are INSANE!!! After we order the waiter looks at us like we're crazy and walks away!! OUR FOOD COMES 45 MINUTES LATER COLD, AND SOGGY!! WE WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN!! VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! I SUGGEST YOU BUY A SHIRT AND EAT SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!
author: Michael G.

description:
Great place to eat. Like many other Hard Rocks. Iconic. Food came out really fast
 Server,  Jesse, was awesome.  Great recommendations especially on the local beer. Long wait. 35 min for two at 2pm but that's not terrible considering it's location.
author: Coach V.

description: This is the worst restaurant I have ever been. So this is my very first time here and we check in for a table. The lady says about 30 min so we are cool with that and we wait patiently. 40 min pass and we still aren't being sit. We see other people who came after us get seated before we do. I'm like are you fore real. So I go see the lady again how much longer. She says we are looking for a table. So I go back and sit down and then a few min later she comes back and says sir from a distance and says it's ready but with an attitude. She didn't even bother to ring the buzzer instead she came up to me and said it's ready like what the hell is the buzzer for then. Just for giggles or something. So we get to the table in the far back corner and she puts the menu on the table and says nothing  just walks away. I say thank you and she just ignores me and goes away. So we get our table and try to read the menu and our waiter comes and she just throws us the coasters instead of putting it on the table. She then tells us let me know when ur ready and didn't bother to ask us for our drinks. She passes by several times and doesn't say anything. Finally she comes by and we put in our order and then another waiting game happens. It was about 20-30 until we finally asked is the food ready then magically tada it was ready. But the food was probably definitely not worth the wait. Fries cold sandwiches cold food was decent but definitely not worth my time nor money. I am telling everyone my bad experience so everyone can be more aware of this awful place and hopefully will avoid this place. By the way I'm on vacation and I think so far this is the worst part so far. Never coming back. #hate this place
author: Chewy C.

description: Music was decent; not like last time. Paul and Rob were great. Food was good. Dining room was completely mismanaged with tables sitting empty while wait times of over one hour. Restrooms were beyond nasty.
author: Nancy S.

description: Came here on Labor Day weekend doing the typical SF tourist stuff, decided to stop at Hard Rock knowing the Hard Rocks in Las Vegas, NV and Biloxi, MS and Hollywood, CA are decent restaurants to stop at having good experiences there. This one in San Fransisco, was pretty bad. After a bit of a wait finally getting to the hostess she said about a 45-an hour wait. Ok sure, not to bad. So after waiting an hour we asked the hostess again how much longer and she basically ignores us. Another 30 mins pass and we say something to a different host and he said "dang, you have been waiting awhile." He finally sat us. Sat at the table for 20 minutes before someone came over and took our drink order. Wasn't off to a good start but our waiter, Flash, was pretty good. He is the reason we stayed. He took our orders as fast as he could. The food took FOREVER to finally get to us. Food was good but still can't get over the first hostess lady. Will never be going there again with so many other options around.
author: Josh S.

description: Ordered a grilled chicken sandwich that was suppose to be gluten free and dairy free. Although delicious...I noticed too late they put mayo on the sandwich...so I got sick. Staff was great when picking up they checked to make sure the honey mustard (that was on the side) was dairy free...which they said it was. It was good(and hopefully dairy free). Used it to dip my GF fries in.
author: Catherine R.

description: Well the only thing good I can say is the waiter was great. The portions were terrible we each received 12 french fries and the rest was just average. The ladies bathroom was disgusting and dark.
author: Dawn K.

description:
Not impressed by the greeter. It took us telling him three times that it was just two of us in our party. He kept trying to seat is with the couple in front of us and their baby. Ummm how hard is it to figure out that we said there are two of us in our party? 
Other than that, we were seated and served quickly, the food was good and our waitress was great. We'll come back, Hard Rock is always a classic.
author: Rosalee R.

description:
The only special thing about this place is the big screen and loud music that young people refer to as "wikkiedly kewl" these days. It's so loud that I would never suggest bringing your kids here. It can damage their poor little ear drums.

The food is also very mediocre. My friend got sick after eating a burger there. fart, fart, fart... ewww wtf? sorry, didn't mean to gross you out!
author: Shannon W.

description:
Go for crappy greasy food here !!

This is one of the horrible places to go on the Pier. Food is absolutely crappy and greasy. You might get a heart attack just as you walk out of this place. We ordered the Bruschetta and spinach dip for appetizers. Both were extremely cheesy and would have tasted much better if they toned down the cheese. For Entrees i had the texas pulled chicken sandwich which was a piece of crappy bun with loads of cheese and uncooked chicken pieces. The only good part was the fries which were surprisingly not greasy.
author: Singaravelan V.

description: First time there 2 months ago..good burgers..Not to crowded. Our Server Was A lil Slow Checking up on us but someone else came by that was nice.
author: Miz M.

description:
$17 Nachos. What?

Food was... decent. I guess I didn't expect much being a Hard Rock, but I have definitely experienced better from other locations.

The Texan was dry and unappealing. 

Service was a little slow.
author: J T.

description: JESSIE IS A SPECTACULAR WAITRESS! I've been to a lot of Hard Rock Cafes over the last 20+ years ..... including the original location in London! The one in San Francisco is definitely near the top of the list! My wife and I took our 3 kids in for dinner, because our oldest was celebrating his 18th birthday. Jessie delivered excellent customer service and went out of her way to make the night extra special. She even tracked down a charger when my iPhone needed a boost. I cannot remember the last time we encountered such a pleasant waitress. I truly hope the managers of this store recognize Jessie for her great work! You, my fellow Yelper, will also love the San Francisco Hard Rock ..... it's always the right spot for a few beers or a delicious meal. Cheers!
author: James B.

description: Oh yeah! The Hardrock Cafe is consistent. CONSISTENTLY distrusting! Totally over rated tourist trap! Fajita veggies are barely grilled. Inferior cuts of beef. So much fat and grizzle I wouldn't feed it to my Yorkie. Leaving here to get something to eat.
author: Carrie B.

description: Came here once again for lunch and just to chill and forget about work... Dont really care what other yelpers have said about this Hard Rock Cafe of San Francisco... All I know is that I love this place no matter what!!! The burgers that, I have eaten here were really good!!! The last time... I came here and had a HRC Bacon Cheesburger... This time, I wanted to try something different from the last time... I ate here it was time for a change... So I went after the California Burger and also had a Root Beer to wash down my California Burger!!! And I love it and plus the hostess and server were very friendly to me... I definitely would love to comeback to this Hard Rock Cafe Of San Francisco!!! ROCK ON SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!
author: William B.

description:
Food: 1 star, Had a half rack of ribs and they were cold and hard to bite. "Off the bone" is false advertisement. My fiancé had some nachos and they were cold by the time she got them. Not worth my money. 

Staff was very friendly, but I don't think I'll come back.
author: Ivan T.

description: Great spot for lunch while at the pier! Good food with a great atmosphere! The mixed drinks were tasty and the service was friendly! I'd gladly come here again.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Wow.... Where do I go from here??? Wanna be Rockstar boy band name Colby???? Can I say douchebag much????!! Unprofessional name calling ass*** Learn some manners. That doesn't make u so innocent "BLONDIE" bartender who rattled out  beanie wearing Colby!!! As if I won't yelp this..???? Have some manners a hole!!!!! All in all if u want respect and a good time go somewhere else. Don't waste your time at a place where they're trying to charging u for something u didn't order. ENOUGH SAID!!!!
author: Sammie P.

description: We were in a hurry and they had plenty of seats at 4pm. The food was fine and service was fast. The music was a little loud.
author: Cindy M.

description: Terrible service and food. More expensive than a chili's or Friday's but has the same quality, if not, worse! I've been to other hard Rock's and none of them have been bad. They're usually just average. But this one in SF is horrible.
author: Honey T.

description: One star for good service. And another star for the chicken wings. But the food was gross. I got the burger and it had no flavor it was so bland. The fries... Some were cold some were hot. My friend got the Mac and cheese and it was too damn salty. My other friend got the jumbo appetizer and it was nothing special, kinda dry. Ordered the chicken wings for appetizer and it was good and juicy. I went here last year to eat and food was great but idk why this time it wasn't good. Another than that, won't be coming back.
author: Donna B.

description: I generally love Hard Rock Cafe, this one couldn't have been worse! I don't know where to start the food or the service! I'll start with the service! Our waitress was rude, no personality, never checked on us at all! I had planned on having a couple beers with my lunch but that never happened because my waitress was MIA and would ignore us when we would make eye contact signaling politely "we may need something" but no! Nothing even when we had asked for the check she was rude! But she sure did have no problem circling and highlighting the gratuity percentages on my receipt! That was the worst tip I think I've ever given! Service was the worst! The food was absolutely NOTHING to write home about! I had a club sandwich, the bacon was all clear fat and had a strange flavor as if it were old! My bread falling apart! My husband had the Big Texan which also tasted as if the meat was going bad soon! We up charged for the herb fries on his! They were only saturated in oil! I liked my regular limp fries more so because they didn't send me to the bathroom like my husband did! 60 bucks awful food and worst service! Walked away shaking my head.
author: Judy B.

description:
We had to eat here out of covenience from the rain.   They didn't have enough staff so our server was ribbing around line a crazy guy.   The chef was the one delivering food since they didn't have enough people to do it. 
The turkey sandwiches were really dry but surprising the rib eye was tasty.
author: susie g.

description: Hard Rock has great service and a wide selection of drinks and good food however I dont feel they embrace the local fish, fruits, veggies that California is known for. They need to embrace California and reach out on the food menu. They should "OWN" the Wharf.
author: Josh R.

description: Delicious food. I had a burger and it was sooooo good. However, it was kind of pricey for pretty basic food, I think they could cut it down a bit, but they're the Hardrock in San Fran so not like anyone expects different.
author: Greg C.

description: Decided to eat here yesterday and it was the worse experience ever! My fiancée ordered the cowboy steak, I ordered a burger and our kids ordered the "chicken tenders" from the kids menu. My son also got "fresh fruits" with his meal. We also ordered onion rings. Got our onion rings pretty fast, we finished it and our server told us our food should be coming out shortly. We waited.. And waited.. And waited.. 40 plus mins I want to say and our server came back and looked surprised we never got our food. The table in front and back of us got their food, finished their food, and new customers were seated before we got our food. He apologized, went back to the kitchen and got our food. Our server kept apologizing to us. My fiancée lost his appetite at this point. He took one bite from the $37 steak and it was cold. My son didn't touch his chicken tenders and his "fresh fruits" was just three pieces of oranges that looked old. The chicken tenders were small and looked over cooked and of course the food was not hot anymore. The manager did come and apologized and gave us a small 15% military discount.  Still not worth the $83. Giving it a one star only because the server kept apologizing to us.
author: Stacy L.

description:
My husband and I were looking for a bite to eat after taking one of the Bay Cruises on a Saturday afternoon. Having been to a Hard Rock Cafe before in NYC, we decided on that.

Hostess couldn't be bothered to crack a smile and ignored my request for a booth 3 times before sending someone else to seat us in a regular table. I kindly asked for a booth and they told me there was going to be a wait, which was no problem. They gave us a pager and about 2 minutes later, it went off and we had a booth.

Sat down and got our drinks. Waiter wasn't very smiley either. Food came out fairly quickly so no complaints there. I had the shredded BBQ chicken sandwich which left a lot to be desired. Tasted like boiled chicken put into a bun and then BBQ sauce poured over, it wasn't even coated in it. Husband had the steak with "mixed veggies". He says the steak was overcooked (even though he asked for medium) and under seasoned and the mixed veggies was just green beans.

My husband is quite clumsy and spilt an entire soda on our table. Yes, not their fault, it was ours/his but seconds after it was spilt, 3 waiters walked by. My husband said "sir" to get the attention of one of them to get us some towels, one of them looked straight into his eyes and they all walked passed, as if they didn't hear him.

We sat there for a good 5 minutes before anyone even came by our table so we could ask for some napkins.

I told our waiter what happened and he told the manager who gave us 20% off our ticket. I am giving a 2 star rating just because the waiter was kind enough to give us a discount for the employees ignoring our request for help.

I will never be back to this location.
author: Vanessa B.

description: We didn't eat here today. This was for the souvenir  shop. They have a lot of stuff, but man, there are big dollar signs here. Clearly everything in here is for HRC swag. I bought a t-shirt for $27 bucks. Is that pricey for a t-shirt? Anyway, I'm sure it costs a lot in rent on pier 39. So next time i'll leave it.
author: Corina J.

description: Great place! excellent service, I'm here on New Years Eve and their busy yet we got our food in less than 15 mins!! Amazed!
author: Carlos B.

description: We went to Hard Rock for lunch. After having good services and food at other locations. When we arrived we were seated right away.  Then we sat for 15 minutes wit lots of employees and servers walking by.  We even wants one boy doing push-ups in the corner   Since no one came to our table we got up to leave. A male server ran up and asked why we were leaving.  He claimed it was not his table but help us. Since our kids were hungry we decided to stay.  Big mistake he took our order we never saw him again someone else brought her food and drinks food was horrible I would not recommend this hard work at all
author: Sal B.

description:
To be honest, as a Hard Rock Cafe fan, I actually had high expectations to this place. Sadly, those expectations were not met during my visit.

My friend and I came here on New Year's Eve and we first ordered a Pickled Tink and a Ultimate Long Island Ice Tea just to kick start the night.
As for the ambiance, it was chill, but the music was SUPER LOUD. My friend and I didn't do much talking as the music made it hard to hear what was being said.
I know it's Hard Rock Cafe, but trying to have a conversation there is really a challenge when your ear drums are about to be blown.

When it came to the food, my friend ordered a California burger with added bacon and onions along with twisted mac and cheese and a side salad.
I ordered a California Chicken Club Sandwich with a caesar salad on the side, and we specifically asked for the salads to be served before the actual burger and sandwich.
However, that did not happen as both the burger and sandwich came about 30 seconds after the salads.
Our waiter apologized, but still.

My friend, who ordered the California burger, said that both the burger and the fries that came with the burger, were a little bit too salty.
Even I, who love a little extra salt on my food, wrinkled my nose at the saltiness of the burger and fries - it was simply too much.

As for my own California Chicken Club Sandwich, it was really dry. And they could might as well just call it the California Club Sandwich because the chicken had almost gone MIA.

The total came to a stiff $75, and that considering the quality of the food, that was NOT worth it.
I bought a t-shirt at the merch store, and to be honest, I only ate there because it's Hard Rock Cafe.
I won't be coming back to the SF one - it was a one-time thing, that's for sure.
author: Lina A.

description:
I love hard rock cafè because it resembles my musical interest. I went there several times and each time had a very different experience. Whenever i dine in, i feel like it is just another american style burger restaurant but when i go to drink it is awesome. They have very limited drinks, so they should improve the menu.

The atmosphere also varies from time to time: i perfer rock music so whenever there is a DJ playing rubbish music i feeling like getting out, but most of the time i have heard good music.. 
 
I remove one star because of the limited drinks and not outstanding food, especially for the price.
author: Ashish N.

description: "LITTLE SAM" was our server and omg she was so wonderful! She was very sweet and patient with our indecisiveness
author: Shelly A.

description: Service was fabulous.... food good .... took forever to get our order but we weren't in a hurry.  Ordered an appetizer but the food came before ... all good as it was taken off the order.  Got a bloody Mary with no garnish ... weird.  Would I come back? Not sure .... speed up the kitchen and teach the bartender how to make a proper drink and maybe.  I'm in the industry so I get that things happen .... this could have been a ton better .... at this point would not recommend to my guests.
author: tammy c.

description: The best Hard Rock I've been so far and Alex the bartender made my night. Great experience!
author: Manuel D.

description:
Major HRC Complaints: 

Realizing SF Hard Rock Cafe has moved was unsettling.  I had to ask where and when did this HRC move?  O=:-o  

Realizing the SF HRC moved to Pier One, I instantly knew the rent per square foot at SF HRC Pier One location was definitely going to jack the food, beverage, and memorabilia through the roof, so I NEVER visited SF Pier One HRC due to the tourist location!

The We-Ho=West Hollywood Beverly Center Shopping Center (Los Angeles) with the Pink Cadillac on the roof is one of the better locations-small but, quaint . . . just steps away from Cedar Sinai Hospital  The food/beverage prices are not jacked up as the other HRCs I have visited around the planet. 

The Bangkok HRC eight blocks from Central World does bait and switch:  The bartender tells me-"You get two free beers, if you buy one."  To my utter dismay when I got the bar bill, I was charged for ALL THREE BEERS!  My Bangkok HRC T-Shirt costs $17.00 USD/Bangkok Dollars which $28.00 USD was CHARGED after the credit card exchange rate!  The beers costs me $15.00 USD/Bangkok Dollars and I was charged another $15 USD for the credit card bank exchange rate!  WHAT!?  I got two enemas without asking for one!  O=:-(  I wanna cry!

Let's talk about Singapore HRC:  CAN YOU SAY MEAT MARKET???  I know you can!  Mr. Rogers would roll in his grave if he saw what I saw at this HRC location-it's a slutty, sleezy, dark location in the neighborhood next door to Citibank off Orchard. Oh-the HRC was empty inside while sleezy peeps hung outside smoking with whatever was walking by with short skirts and wearing no underwear showing their "world" for a viewing fee.

Itaewon HRC South Korea diagonally across the street from Outback Steakhouse was closed at 7:30 PM on FRIDAY EVENING!  What's worse?  Itaewon did not look like a typical HRC-THIS LOCATION JUST SELLS MEMORABILIA????   O=:-O   WHAT???? 

What's up with these HRCs?  I am so sad HRC is so commercialized now and it's not like it was in the 80's!  No live entertainment anymore!  O=:-(  Uhhh~Except the live entertainment you see walking up and down the street at Singapore's Orchard location!
author: Shirley M. J.

description:
Pro's
 
Amazing entrance with the guitars

Awesome location, right on Pier 39

Bigger gift shop than the Seattle location with a lot of neater items

Outstanding music,

Servers more of what I am used to seeing at Hard Rock, tattoos, weird hair, pins and patches, smiles and fun
 
 
Con's
 
Usual touristy food

Upstairs closed off to patrons, that is where most of the memorabilia was

Usual over priced menu items

Smaller dining room, but not as small as Seattle
 
 
 
 Summary-

 Since this was my first visit to California in a "few" years, we wanted to make every moment count. We stopped in San Francisco on our way back to Seattle and vowed to see and experience everything and this was no exception. Once you have been to a Hard Rock, you pretty much know what to expect with the food and the ambiance, although exactly what you might see is a little exciting.

By the time you have seen one or two Hard Rock café's you have a reason for going. Since we don't eat red meat, it is hard to order, but we managed to find something chicken based and it was unremarkable, but the experience is always fun. This location was no exception.

 I would recommend this as a stop on your trip to San Francisco especially if you are going to be spending any time on the Pier as the other restaurants we tried weren't near as fun or good. I am almost miffed at why places such s this believe that tourists have no taste buds, but won't hold that against them, because they offer so much more.
author: Steve T.

description: Garbage customer service cause they were understaffed for a Saturday. The nachos were super soggy cause they just let it sit at the counter for several minutes. For it for free cause I checked in. Will I I back here? Nope!
author: Herb C.

description: Went here and watched the superbowl  (go Peyton!!) With family. I'd never been to a Hard rock before so I was kinda expecting more than a glorified Applebee's. There's not like a lot of cool interactive stuff as I expected. It's basically a big open space with seating and cool stuff on the wall. I think the group beside us ate some ecstacy. They were dry humping and grinding on each other and had their own boom box  and we're dancing around engaging all the people around with weird drunkenness and alcohol fueled sexuality. My 12 yr old didn't really mind of course and after about 10 IPAs neither did i. I think the food was ok. I've been on the stool all day today though so something got to me. I'll probably go back when I want to pre-game some bad decision making.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Nice causal lunch on the pier.  

Great customer service.  I have a food allergy and the chef came out to talk to me and even brought my food directly to me.
author: NJ R.

description: hello hardrock.start with a Long Island iced tea . Followed by a margarita. I'm trilled ！
author: Karina Z.

description:
I find the food is good enough if you don't order anything too sophisticated. The area around is great but a tourist trap for "locals" like myself. Part of the usual attraction are on the walls and such like all Hard Rock Cafes.

I met a wargaming buddy and his wife who were visiting from Louisiana. Good times.

We had a 15% check in discount a la Yelp but the waiter forgot to add it to our bill and the gracious person paying for us all didn't really want to follow it up (the waiter was off work by the time we got our bill).

SERVICE: B

HAMBURGER SPECIAL (red, white and blue?): B to B plus

DECORUM: A minus
author: Shannon M.

description: It's a chain, so there's that... But actually, their service was great and the food was delicious. It's overpriced, but we used the free appetizer with check-in special, and the final cost was very reasonable. My sister and niece were happy to visit a famous place like this, and I enjoyed my burger and fries. I'd be fine coming here again with visitors who want to try it out.
author: Josue M.

description: Never disappointed at any hard rock but the service at the SF hard rock was AMAZING!!! Our server Gina (who claims she's in training) was the sweetest server I have had in a long time. She was helpful with suggestions and made us feel right at home. If she is in training then she is ready to be on her own by my book. Also my friend spilled his soda and manny was quick to clean it up and get him another drink. Great service and not to mention the food was great!
author: Bobby S.

description: Awesome music! Awesome setting! Came here with my friends and the waiter was super friendly and funny. It was pricy but we got a lot for our money so I guess it was worth it. Definitely was good.
author: Elenie V.

description:
Came here for some good burgers because I remember eating here a couple of times before and have memories of really delicious burgers. Today wasn't one of those days which is really unfortunate.
I got The Texan: it was incredibly plain with really dry pulled pork. I ended up putting the sides (baked beans and coleslaw) ON the burger which gave it at least some flavor.  My husband got the Fiesta Burger and also wasn't impressed.

The fries are great and the wait staff we encountered were super friendly so that's a plus. The music vibe is fun though. 

So, come here for a good vibe and a fun store in front but my experience with their food is mediocre.
author: Savonna S.

description: My parents are in town for my graduation, and after a morning at Alcatraz, stopped in at the Hard Rock Cafe for lunch and had a horrific experience. After eating, my elderly mother stepped out of the restaurant to take a phone call, while my father remained at the table. Their waitress ran out of the restaurant and began verbally assaulting my mother, accusing her of trying to dine and ditch, yelling at her in a very crowded street, and profusely embarrassing her. (Again, my father was still at the table). After my mother responded that she wasn't a thief, and was just taking a phone call, the rude and apparently also blatantly racist waitress then brought out a Spanish speaking waiter to talk to my mother. Yes, my mom has an accent but she is a fluent native English speaker. My parents eventually resolved the error- that my dad was still in the restaurant!!!!- and paid the bill, but my mom was so rattled by the aggressive demeanor and accusations of the waitress she lost a bag of expensive gifts in the ensuing chaos. Don't eat at the Hard Rock, their wait staff are racists and had the audacity to charge my parents for their meal after accusing my parents of stealing and humiliating my mother.
author: Heather K.

description:
When we first walked in there was no wait. We were seated immediately. They seated us near the bar at the high seats. When I asked to sit at the booth, the people at the front that takes you to the table, told me that they couldn't sit us at the booth without a reason. I let it go since I was on a date. A couple minutes later they sat two people at a booth.

The waitress that first served our drinks was extremely nice and attentive. Then after about 10-15 min our food came. They served our sides and one entree first. When they brought out the second entree, they only brought out half of it. So they went to the back to grab my other half. Without communicating with each other, they ended up bringing me two.

The food overall was distasteful. The twisted Mac and cheese was completely drenched in oil. The bread that came with it was stale. The fajita was really salty but their chicken was good. I liked that they put diced garlic on it. It really brought out the taste. The cheesecake tasted like it was in the fridge for a long time, besides that it was good.

Overall, the service is slow, there were music videos in tv that was not child friendly, and the food was not appetizing.
author: Jojo C.

description: Oldie but goodie always fun coming to this spot! :) I always order the Nachos which are way more than I can handle! I can never finish my plate and they are always served fresh and hot! The service is always great! and  I like how every location is unique and different.  This Hard Rock has a perfect location sitting on the pier.  There is plenty of seating and Thank you for the nice cold Anchor Steam!
author: Connie G.

description: Great meal!!! Had the fiesta burger but substituted the meat for a veggie burger. It seemed fresh and tasted great! Only complain was that the pico de gallo was cold, would have been nice to have that warmed up.
author: Kaitlyn H.

description:
I really don't like giving one star and it's not something I do often, in fact I'm going to try and come back just so I can believe that it wasn't as bad of an experience as I really believed. 
This was my first time going to the Hard Rock Cafe ever and was looking forward to dining at an American landmark if you will. I was meeting up with some friends and got there a bit late. It took 30 minutes before someone was able to get me a water or even offer me a drink. By the time everyone got there food I was offered a menu. I ended up snacking on my friends food which was pretty standard, a burger, a steak, potato skins, nothing extraordinary. She dropped off the check and asked if we needed anything else. My friends parents paid in cash. She came back and counted the money in front of us and then spoke with me directly about how gratuity was not included in the bill. 
I didn't order anything nor did I get a drink so why would you talk to me? I guess I've just never been treated that way, I'm sure there are nicer servers at that establishment and just wish I remembered her name so you don't have to go through the same thing I did
author: Jean-Luc D.

description: Matt is AMAZING!! I was about to order a pulled pork but wanted a second opinion and he suggested to go with a pork Texan instead. It comes with Cheddar but I substituted with pepper jack (yes I am one of those customers) he was attentive and didn't bug me every 5 minutes like other servers so at other locations. Thanks Matt for making my bar experince fun.
author: Lo L.

description: I intended to just get appetizer and dessert. Wait time was long especially for the time it was because there was barely anyone there. A different waitress brings us our appetizer. We get our appetizer, perfect. Sweet small wait. We finish our appetizer. The waitress never comes to ask us anything and doesn't even approach us at the table once. We wait about 30 minutes and then finally she comes to let us know that she's going on break and a new server will come. We wait about 10 mins and we see our new server socializing with a family member that came to sit right next to us. The waiter finally comes and takes our order and goes back to the family member. In total it took us an hour to get 1 app and 1 dessert.
author: Amir L.

description: I love Hard Rock Cafe, but I was a little disappointed to find that they were under construction. I understand that it's (hopefully) gonna be amazing when it's done, but as it stands right now it is barely a Hard Rock. More like boring restaurant that plays random pop music. I'm a total rocker, as were my friends with me, so the tried to play some Hard Rock which I commend them for. Due to technical problems Van Halen replaced the pop music just as we were leaving. Also, most of the memorabilia is off the wall for the time being. Food was amazing quality, but more than would have wanted to pay.
author: Max S.

description: Brought the wife and kid to the bay area for  the first time. Like always, being the hrc fanatics that we are, we stopped at the cafe for a late dinner. Happy hour special included $4 sam Adams and half price apps. Our waiter took long to take our order but after that he was great.
author: Juan M.

description: I like this place but it is for the tourist so get your merchandise and burgers. I'll get the ribs!
author: Ken I.

description: I have to tell you that I was very disappointed with the location. I'm a BIG fan of the product, I have been to 20 plus locations and again I was very disappointed. I took one bite of my burger, I'm convinced that there was something wrong with it, the burger even smelt bad. I clearly did not eat it but the waitress was so busy at the bar doing nothing that she did not even say anything or do anything for me even after I mentioned that it was bad. I got my check and thought I would mention the situation to the manager. After waiting over 15 minutes for the manager I just walked out. This location is very busy from time to time but this particular day the restaurant was empty. I do not understand it!
author: David R.

description: Aside from being on the touristy busy wharf the Hard Rock for me is always a good time. The memorabilia, music and vibe here is always good. The food is good and service good enough.
author: Nick G.

description: Slow service, they weren't busy. Tough atmosphere for those who have small kids between the slow service and large booths. Get a highchair over a booster seat... There are no straps on the booster seats. Wife got the little Rock burger. Honestly, it looked and tasted like McDonald's. I got a hickory barbecue bacon burger... It was good, just not great for $16.95. I wouldn't recommend it if you are trying to impress someone out of town. There are better places to eat.
author: Pat O.

description: Can't beat on HR cafe. Only one thing, if someone at the bar is ordering food have the untensils and napkins already ready to rock n roll. Don't wait until the customer asks when he has his food in front of him.
author: Alejandro C.

description: I give this place a 3.5. Came here on a rainy Sunday to pier 39 and just was one of does go with the flow days. Never had been to a Hard Rock Cafe restaurant so figured why not give it a try. They had just opened up and the staff was still trying to get thing up and running. We sat down and were welcomed by a nice sever. We order as a app the bruschetta and I ordered the legendary 10oz burger(I love burgers lol) bruschetta was very soggy they design the plate in balsamic reduction that gets the bread soggy, so was not pleased with that app. The burger came out to perfect order. I had a med rare and got what I asked for. There brioche bun they use on there burger was amazing, very butter complimented the burger very nicely. Overall it was a nice visit. As for if I would go back idk depends on if friend are alway there. Toss up I suppose.
author: Alberto L.

description:
My daughter ordered a meal with french fries and complained about one of the fries tasting horrible and how she couldn't get the taste out of her mouth.  So I figured how bad can it be and took a bite.

OMG!  If FECES was shaped like a french fry then that was what we had eaten! It had the most bitter, horrid, acrid taste of anything that I had ever experienced!

Will.Never.Go.There.Again!
author: Chuck B.

description: The food was amazing. A little on the pricey side but what do you expect from Pier 39. AWESOME service. Highly recommend to any human that likes bomb food and good vibes.
author: Serenity H.

description:
Cool rocker place. good music. good food. great waitresses.
Came here on a friday night,no wait time. Awesome.Yelp usually had check-in deals..
author: Theresa C.

description: Worst HRC experience. My wife and I have been to over a dozen different HRCs and this was the worst in regards to our experience. Our server was great, she was kind, welcoming, knowledgeable, and patient. First off the kitchen was closed for an undisclosed reason, ok sometimes things happen. We could only get drinks at the bar. Bartender was sour faced the entire time having to attend to 8 patrons with the assistance of another bartender. Finally kitchen opened and we were sat at a table that was in a breezy point of the dining room due to an open patio door. After an employee closed it at our request it was constantly propped open after that. Anger oozed out of me since my wife was under the weather.   Last thing. We ordered the souvenir glasses. Originally I ordered a drink to be served in the beer glass. Instead it came in the mason jar, and if you are following along the bill indicated a souvenir mason glass; this was after I explicitly indicated that I wanted the beer glass. When it came time to redeem the glasses the store clerk stated that the beer glass would cost an additional $1. Perplexed at this proposition. All of our other visits to various cafes did not have this. The eventually caved stating 'they don't normally do this'.  It's frustrating when staff doesn't listen. Oh and one more thing they didn't have the garlic fries.
author: Elliot R.

description:
I'm a fan! I just love the atmosphere!

Burgers are always a hit!

Skip the souvenirs there so over priced! 

Instead Take some pics there is so much to see here and there are many local celebs from these parts with memorabilia on the walls at hard rock!
author: Erin N.

description: my wife, kids and I stopped in to have a drink. We didn't eat because we been munching all day walking around the wharf. I ordered a beer and my wife had the same and we ordered two kids sodas. THEN THE BILL CAME... The beers were around 6.50 which is high but decent priced. BUT the kids drinks were 3.85/each! $7.70 for two 8 ounce sodas.. I just think that is total crap they charge so much for a 8 oz child size soda.. Needless to say I won't be returning to a place that is over priced for food and drinks and had drunk men screaming at the top of their lungs while watching a football game... And the service was wayyyyyy slow and the restaurant was only 1/4 full
author: Deez N.

description: If your in the pier 39 area this is a great place to stop by and have a beer or two they have a nice little bar area the staff here is nice, friendly the place itself is pretty clean and decent and if you eat here they do validate parking for the garage
author: Johnson Y.

description:
I have always found the Hard Rock kind of fun for a once in a while meal.  I have been to several locations, with the exception of this one.  We happened to be in SF early in the day for the 4th of July fireworks and the prestart festivities of America's Cup.  We opted to eat here for an early lunch.  

I want to premise this review by stating they were not busy when we arrived.  Having said that, let's start with the fact our waitress took 20 minutes to come take our order or offer drinks.  Meanwhile we watched two other wait staff not only wait on but bring appetizers and drink orders out to people who were seated after us.  We finally asked one of them and they went and got our waitress to get the ball rolling.  Not a good start!

When she finally showed up, we ordered our food and drinks all the while feeling like she could not get away from our table fast enough.  Another 25 minutes went by and again after flagging down another employee (this time a busboy busing the table that arrived at the same time we did but apparently was in another waiter's section so they were leaving while we were still waiting for our drinks and food), our waitress appears with our drinks.  The gidgets' drinks were fine and they were happy to have something to sip on while listening to the live music playing on the pier near HRC.  Our drinks on the other hand not so much.  Apparently they had a new bartender. 

No apologies for our wait time or the drinks being off or even acknowledgement that she had not checked in with us unless we had someone go drag her out to our table.  Again, while watching other wait staff efficiently and professionally handle and provide decent service to other people around us.  When we asked about our food, we were advised she would check on it.  20 minutes later she finally appears with it....basically about the time we were ready to walk.  Mind you we still had not gotten the water we asked for when we placed the original order 45 minutes prior, nor had we gotten the correct drinks she had supposedly gone to have the "new bartender" make.

By this point, I was ready to leave; but the kids were enjoying their drinks and food and of course listening to the live band....so against my better judgement we stayed.

Both my BFF and I had ordered our burgers well done.  What we got was just this side of not mooing.  I was too frustrated to even bother asking our waitress to have the kitchen cook the burger a little longer (that is if we could find another person to drag her back out to us).  When she finally showed up to present the check (not asking if we liked the food since our burgers remained on our plates with only a couple of bites out of them, still no apology for the shoddy service, etc), she waited impatiently as I checked the bill and pulled out my bank card to pay.  Luckily she had amended the check to show our "mistake" drinks were taken off.  Once I handed her my card and the check, she scampered off....again to leave us waiting another 10-15 minutes.  

I finally just went and looked for her myself.  In doing so, I approached the hostess stand and had to ask three times for assistance to get someone's attention because they were too busy chatting amongst themselves.  Finally one waiter noticed my growing irritation and asked me what I needed.  I advised him at this point, I would like to see their manager.  He then scampered off to get him.  10 minutes later, our waitress walks over and advises me the manager was busy in the back and sent her to see what I needed.  Oh, and by the way....here is your receipt.  Can you sign it?

Needless to say, we will NEVER be back to this location.  I basically paid over a $100.00 for an unedible lunch and to have some of the worst service I have had in a restaurant.
author: Michele P.

description: Yikes 16.95 for a med rare burger that they made well done. Way overpriced. I won't be back
author: Josey T.

description: Had the nachos with beef brikets and guac. The chips were crunchy. Plenty of food for four as an appetizer.  Fast service.
author: Frank S.

description:
We had the potato skins and burgers (I had the "S.O.B." with bacon, nice and smoky). Good food. However: I felt the prices were very high for what you get (over $16 for a burger and fries is quite exorbitant). I suppose part of it is paying for the experience of being surrounded by memorabilia and we had a tv by our table.

Also, there seems to be a communication breakdown somewhere along the line: although our server was very friendly, through no fault of his own (I assume), he was completely unaware of the menu's Baker's Choice dessert (turned out there wasn't one at all), nor the local resident 15% discount (although he did give it to us as a military discount, without checking IDs).

Lastly, considering their efforts to introduce a little local flavor, it would've been nice to have at least one local beer available. What I did enjoy was the feeling of detachment from San Francisco, in a good faux vacation kind of way.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I was really looking forward to going to the hard rock café tonight because I am so tired of the preprogrammed crappy pop and rap I am inundated with on the radio every day. I wanted to go out to eat and enjoy some HARD ROCK in the background while I ate some good food and hung out with my friends. Unfortunately, although the food was good, I felt like throwing up my food because I was forced to listen to "artists" like Rihanna and Nikki Minaj. I think the hard rock café should either change their name to the crappy pop café or go back to playing "HARD ROCK", like their name suggests.
author: Lisa M.

description: Good visit - first uncrowded Hard Rock I have ever been to...kiddies are in school!  Andrew was our waiter and he was awesome.
author: Dave T.

description: Came for lunch here this past Saturday. Food is expensive and definitely not worth what you pay for. I got the honey mustard chicken sandwich with a side of fries all for $20! I could've gotten the same thing elsewhere for half of that. Only pro was that our waitress was really nice, didn't get her name though.
author: Marisa G.

description:
It is just a common restaurant.

I don't know what so special about this place, for me is just a restaurant with a famous name. I didn't feel anything of "rock" in the menu. I mean, the food is OK,the service is OK, but that's all. I felt the ambiance wasn't real, wasn't authentic.
Anyway, I'll not go back and I don't recommend it.
author: Beatriz L.

description:
***BEWARE*** STAY AWAY FROM THIS POOR EXCUSE FOR A RESTAURANT.

I have been to numerous Hard Rock Cafe's and never had any sort of the MANY problems I experienced at THIS location.

The food was HORRIBLE to say the least. I ordered the BBQ Chicken and my wife ordered a chicken sandwich... both were stale. My chicken was undercooked and had no flavor outside of the BBQ paste that they put on the outside. My wife's meal was stale to the point of the bread tasting old as 2 weeks ago. Even my ICE TEA was disgusting to the point that I had to order a glass of water instead. 

The waitress was nice, but she was a new trainee and messed up a few things. Being that she was nice and had good intentions, I still tipped at 20% of the bill (bill was 60$). 

I would NEVER come here again, and I will never even go to another hard rock cafe based on this experience and the fact that they would allow such poor quality food. 

I ended up getting sick from my under cooked chicken as well, so save yourself the miserable dinning event and go elsewhere!! Looking back on it now, I would prefer a pretzel from the pier stands over a meal from this place ever again!!!
author: Jason S.

description:
I'm writing this as me and my husband sit and wait for our root beer which we ordered almost 30 minutes ago. Sheesh. 

Let's start with the interior, it's dark ish but you can see everything. The lights on the wall illuminate all the guitars and posters of rock legends. 

Waiting on the root beers. The waitress brought us out 2 seltzer waters with brown dye. She said their fixing the machine... Why would you bring them out in the first place if you know they are not right?! O_O

It's been so long since we (husband and I) ordered our food that I forgot what we even ordered.... 
 
....if there's anyone out there reading this... I just want to let you know that we are close to being starved to death! (Jk)

But seriously where is the food?

Finally we have drinks. Food? Is this a restraunt? Where am I?

We got the food. Sad. Disappointing. Disgusting. Plastic. Fake. Canned. I don't know what else to say. 
This place is not worth it. Just stick to buying the overpriced merchandise I guess :/ skip he crappy food. They should have better quality ingredients for what they are charging. 2 people came out to $70. We should have just went to get clam chowder bowls :( 

Also! The waitress lacked enthusiasm and makes  me feel slightly depressed :(

On extra star for the jimi Hendrix jacket.
author: Ariana L.

description:
We stopped into the Hard Rock Cafe around 3 p.m. after a boat cruise for some delicious guilty carb pleasures, since a disappointing visit to the nearby Corn Dog and Churro Kiosk left us wanting more.  

The already-excellent potato skins we ordered were made even tastier with the addition of avocado (a recommendation from our friendly server).  We asked for a variety of dips for our french fries and got spicy Thai ketchup, regular Heinz, and a Sriracha mayo that they whipped up just for us.  Finally, we couldn't decide what drinks to order, so after hearing about our likes and dislikes, our server made us an absolutely fantastic (and huge!) Chambord margarita.  

I would recommend heading to the bar and asking for Lauren -- she is absolutely tops!  The manager was extremely nice, too.  Overall was a surprisingly good dining experience for a chain restaurant, and the drinks were as good as any fancy mixologist would concoct.  If I'm stuck at Pier 39, I'd certainly head here to get tipsy enough to deal with tourists.
author: Sara C.

description: The food was good,  our wait was long. I came up  45 minutes after I was told 20 min and I was told "oh I was just about to call you" funny,  u just told that to the dude in front of me too.. anyways host sucked. Waitress was very nice, I forget her name but she is the one from Macedonia very polite and on point, all in all after getting sat down it was a good experience
author: Stagz L.

description: I came here with some friends who were visiting from England.  Two of them have this thing, they must have a Hard Rock Cafe tshirt with the city name.  He sat at the bar to have some beers and shared some appetizers.  The food is okay in my opinion but the mates wanted to hang out there after buying their shirts.
author: Liz D.

description: My Dad and I decided to pop into HRC since I was visiting and haven't been to San Fran in a LONG time. I'm a Hard Rock junky and have been to tons of their locations around the globe, and San Fran didn't disappoint. The service was awesome, the drinks were great and we actually got to "test out" the Fish & Chips before it was available for other locations. My only gripe is that the music was loud...as in WAY loud. I realize it's a music themed place to eat, but even our server was having a hard time hearing us. I'm sure it was a fluke. Anyway, great location and wonderful experience!
author: Erika V.

description: We were there on a Wednesday night,  got sat quick.  The place was not very busy but we waited quite a while for our server,  jasmine,  she was nice but never checked on us or refilled our drinks.  Memorabilia was cool as always.  Food was good,  service was okay.
author: Harmony N.

description:
Overpriced for the quality of food. In addition our server was not very attentive and the restaurant was cold. 

Upsides were that we were seated quickly and greeted by the manager. Also the food came out quickly.

I wish they had more options for salads as well.
author: Rosalyn M.

description:
My husband and I decided to take a day trip out to San Francisco to enjoy the sights, as we had not gone there together. We started the day with a nice walk on the pier, and decided to have a late lunch at the Hard Rock Café. We walked up to the hostess and requested a table for 2. We were told it would be a 30-45 minute wait, so we decided to kill some time by walking around and watching some of the street performers. 

After 30 minutes, we go back to check on the table, and we were told we still had a 20-25 minute wait. Definitely not within the time range that we were initially told. 
After waiting for close to an hour, we finally got seated at a high table near the bar area. To our surprise, the restaurant was not more than 40% full. One entire section of tables (about 20 tables) was available. 

After about 10 minutes of sitting down, we saw people entering from the side door - completely bypassing the hostess stand - and sitting down at the tables. Shortly after they sat down, they were brought menus and water and ended up getting their meal roughly around the same time that my husband and I did. On top of that, my husband's burger was flavorless (have had better at a home BBQ) and the fries were burnt. $30 not well spent. 

Will not be going back to this location any time soon.
author: Sonia D.

description: My son and I had dinner here on the 16Jul15 we had a very good meal. The waiter brought my check I gave him my card. he returned and said that my card was declined, I called the bank who stated I had used my card too many time that day. the manager came to the table and stated that he would give me 50% off of my bill so that I could pay the bill. This had to be the most embarrassing day of my life. I wish I had the managers name he was a very nice & understanding man. He didn't have to do that so Thank you so much. It was around 9:00 pm he was a young Hispanic man. thank you again.
author: Lisa O.

description: Location is great. Music a little loud but it works considering the venue. We got the legendary burger and the big Texan - both were delicious. The cocktails were also good. However, I think it's a tad pricey and the service isn't great.
author: Samantha B.

description: We had just stopped in here for drinks, so I cannot comment on the food. We sat at the bar, so the service was fast and friendly.  I love walking around and looking at the memorabilia!
author: Anj L.

description:
Tonight was my first time ever going to a hard rock restaurant in my life and I was super satisfied with the quality of service from my waiter Cee Cee, and the quality of the fish and chips I ordered. The fish tasted great and the fries were some of the best I have had in a while. And the busser named Kendra was super awesome! She brought my food out for me and my mother and was super nice.The vibes are great here. Everyone is having fun. Come on a Sunday night if you are in the area. Wasn't too busy.
I will definitely be back
author: Anthony F.

description:
Ugh.

It was a Monday night around 9 when we walked in, were told about a half an hour wait. Fine. After a little more than thirty minutes we were seated and then promptly ignored for about ten minutes.

The waitress seemed absentminded and even downright lost at times. She passed our table at least three times without acknowledging our existence. She could have said "Be right with you, or I'm sorry I'll be right back." Nope and nope.

I got an iced tea and the bf got a beer. Five minutes later my iced tea appeared...no beer. Another five minutes go by when she comes over to take our order. We ask about the missing beer, and she giggles and says "Oh yeah, right." So she leaves to retrieve it before taking our orderer. Nice.

She comes back with a flat beverage, don't feel like complaining tonight as we are on vacation, then takes our order without writing it down. Here is my problem, Ive been a server for years. Even if you have a good memory you should always write down someones order. Even just to double check or cross reference in case a guest says they order something else, to which you can see that no they did not order what they say because here look, I've written it down.

Our appetizer  takes thirty minutes and then five minutes later the food arrives, lo and behold our order is wrong. AHHH! We have to flag her down for refills, nakpins, and silverware. Its just a disaster. NO sense of urgency from her, and she couldnt care less that we were visibly unhappy.

I'm so irritated at this point that I just want to leave, the food was mediocre at best and then we had to wait forever for the check, and then forever to get change.

My advice....skip. Its SanFran, there are so many other great options, no need to get treated like crap here.

EDIT**** I keep my review at two stars, as neither the food or service were satisfying. However, the general manager contacted me and apologized for my less than satisfactory visit. He really did try to make amends, and it is clear he cares about his guests. So I just want to say thank you, and also if you have an issue at a restaurant, ask to speak to the manager instead of going home angry and yelping about it later. It is possible your problem can be solved on the spot. Thank you for the consideration Barry.

SECOND EDIT*** My above edit was written because I was witness to some sort of dedication by the general manager of this restaurant to try and make amends for a bad experience. I was promised a gift card in the mail, and although the gesture was nice and really not necessary, he did not follow through. I wrote this review in August and so far it is December and I have not received anything. I find it more rude than anything to promise something and not deliver, it really shows how little you care about the people who come and spend money at your establishment. For this I docked a star, and am seriously disappointed. I never wanted anything, just to voice my opinion, but when you tell someone you are going to do something and dont, that is not okay.
author: Sherry M.

description:
We came here after checking out the 7D Experience (which was okay), having been won over by a deal we got for two burgers for the price of one (given as a business card over near 7D). The place wasn't too busy, which was nice, and have about the experience we were expecting.

The restaurant serves classic diner food, so we played it relatively safe with the SOB burger and the California burger, with a side salad. Everything was good, although oddly enough the salad stood out for being particularly tasty vs. expectations. The female component of this review team prefered the California burger, while the male prefered the SOB. 

Overall, it was good food although a little pricey for what it is (if they offer this deal again though will be here in a heartbeat).
author: Sami R.

description: I honestly would have gave one star due to waiting so long for our food to come (about an hour) then my food being cold BUT the server was very kind and friendly, he went out of his way to make the bad experience a better one. Thanks Audie!  would go back only because he was awesome.
author: Amber M.

description: The atmosphere of a Hard Rock Cafe is hard to not like. The decor is great to look at while waiting for your food.  In our case, it took almost an hour for our food. Our waitress was very nice and apologetic.  The food was sub par.  I got the southwest salad.  My chicken was soggy, very little to almost no dressing.  The other meals at the table were fine but not great.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Even though we have one here in town, I wanted to check out the one in fisherman's warf. I've never been crazy about hard rock but we wanted something familiar before we left town.

I feel that all of the HR cafes are the same, big round restaurant with loud rock music and a ton of "memorabilia" hammered to the walls. The menu itself is just traditional American food, ain't nothing wrong with that, but nothing special either.

I had the chicken mac n cheese which was AWESOME. One of the best 'pasta' dishes I have had, It was cheesy and had a surprising spciy kick which I loved. The chicken was perfectly cooked and the portion was great.

I could do without the loud music, but I can't really complain about the food. Definitely worth a check out if you want something you can't go wrong with.
author: Justin G.

description: First time in SF , so we decided to try one of the most famous american restaurants.. and everything went just fine. tasty chicken wings as starter and then one ceasar salad and a lengendary burger. both were delicious. totally recomended.
author: Paulo G.

description: A bit overpriced but the food was good and the service was excellent. The chicken club was good, could have used a bit more flavour, a bid bland. Fries are amazing with crispness and seasoning. The fried cod was great too.
author: Nickole L.

description:
Went to Hard Rock Café with my girlfriend when she was visiting me. To celebrate, I just invited her for dinner at this place. We were immediately greeted by our server, Colby, very cool and friendly guy. He presented the specials and even sat at our table for a while for a chat.

The service here is fast and if it's not too crowded, it's a nice place to be. They have cool decorations,nice music and the menu looks great.

I had one of their burgers and that is actually the reason why I only gave them 3 stars. The overall taste was ok, but the meat was a little on the dry side, even though it was baked medium-rare and the fries were even worse, almost cardboard, a little like those you get at Mc Donald's. Without judging them, dry fries are often a sign that the fries aren't freshly baked and reheated.

So, the service was awesome and the taste of my food was good, but this place would've had at least one additional star if they manage to get quality meat on the patties and nicely baked crusty fries. I'll be back!
author: Nicolas S.

description:
Horrible service and experience!!! 
We got served by Rodolfo, ask for a different server if you get him.
My family ate for dinner on Christmas day and got seated around 7pm. 

Rodolfo was very rude! He made our Christmas dinner unforgettable in a negative way.
1. He did not introduce himself
2. He rushed our order and didn't ask if we wanted anything else (sides or drinks)
3. I had to wait until he came back after he took our order so I can ask for my drink. When I did, I nicely said "Excuse me, you forgot to ask if I wanted anything to drink". He responded, "Oh yea. You didn't tell me! What do you want?" Seriously dude?! You forgot to ask!!!
4. He didn't check on us to see how we are doing. Thankfully the nice busser did!
5. Not once did he smile or say have a great night! 

I could have been rude and told him what was on my mind, but because I was with my family, I didn't want to ruin the moment even more than he did. I am so sad that we spent a special day with a bad server :(
author: Alytzel M.

description:
After a cruise on the bay for my mother-in-law's 60th birthday we (party of 10 with kids) headed into the Hard Rock cafe for our reservation.  We actually got done with the cruise and activities 1 hour early but the Hard Rock staff easily pushed up our reservation and took us right in.
The waitress was a Macedonian exchange student and very attentive and sweet.  The timing of the food and drinks were good and we had a great time.  
A very SPECIAL note to manager Barry: we were looking for a cake for mom's 60th and we were short on time.  He said we could order a cake from Safeway down the street and he would even go pick it up for us.  So at the end of the meal, the wait staff brought out the cake, got everyone's attention in the entire restaurant and everyone sang Happy Birthday to mom.  It was awesome.  I've never had such a fantastic customer service than we did for mom's birthday.  BRAVO to Barry and his staff.  5 stars!!!
author: Lawrence R.

description:
Recently dined at this Hard Rock Cafe during a day excursion to Pier 39.
The staff was great and even allowed for adjustments/substitutions to the menu to accommodate.  
It's a fun, entertaining stop in and a great place to get off of your feet and have some great food after being out and about enjoying the scenic and fun pier.
The burgers are great and never went thirsty!
Don't forget to get your parking validated!
author: Michelle J.

description: Strong drinks, tasty food, fun atmosphere. Forgot our waiters' name but he had long curly black hair and was a delight.
author: Giselle H.

description: I would give it zero stars if I could! As we walked through the gift shop going towards the café we asked if we can sit at the bar and if it was open seating he said yes just the barstools. We noticed that there wasn't seating for four so we went back and asked if we can have a table in the bar so we can order for happy hour.  They have plenty of seating however the table we walked up to a woman stopped us and said that we cannot sit there. I told her that they said that we could and she said no and because there was a language barrier another employee walked up to us and said that we cannot sit here. Once I went to go get the young man that was in the front, who originally sat us said it was okay to the bartender. But the time we were finally sitting down we were already over it because of the experience that we just left... Sad day. I was ready to spend some money.
author: Alexandra Linette S.

description:
Outside seating as the sun goes down...

The food was not as good as i though it would be (due to price, or i was being cheap)
Service was a Solid B
Overall experience A-OK!
author: Lupita Z.

description: We went on a Friday for lunch. I loved the atmosphere! We only waited a few minutes. Our server was great, very helpful :) Food was good and so were the drinks.
author: Erica R.

description: Service was great, but the burger I ordered had no flavor. Definitely not worth the $17. Atmosphere is really cool, great music but again food was not up to par.
author: Adam D.

description: My first time in a Hard Rock Cafe and I was SOOO dissapointed.  It's too expensive in my opinion and the food is not good.  I had the mac and cheese with chicken and it had no flavor what so ever!  AND it was $20 for that plate!  My boyfriend had the bufalo wings and it was average.  My first experience and I will never come back to any Hard Rock Cafe.
author: Marilyn S.

description:
After being tourists in our own city, we decided to keep the ball rollin' and head to the Hard Rock Cafe for my Mom's birthday lunch.

Since it's summer, and tourist season, there was about a 15 min. wait. While we were seated, I mentioned to the hostess and later to our server that it was my Mom's birthday and I assumed that they would get the hint.

The Hard Rock Cafe offers a variety of food ranging from BBQ to seafood to burgers. My sister ordered the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with onion rings, which she really enjoyed. My Mom ordered the beer-battered fish and chips and I ordered a cheeseburger with fries, cooked medium. Overall, we all really enjoyed our food but I wouldn't say there was anything about it that stood out. 

After we were done with lunch, I was expecting that our server would bring over some ice cream for my Mom but there was nothing. Instead, she asked if we would like to see a dessert menu. I was surprised because usually restaurants will bring over a small sundae for people who are celebrating their birthdays. Even at Red Robin they bring you some ice cream! 

Service was okay - another server took over for our original one, who was going on break, but both didn't check up on us too much. I know we're not tourists, but we're still customers, and I would have appreciated a little more from them. 

Overall, if you are in the area or visiting Pier 39, the Hard Rock Cafe is an affordable option. However, with many other restaurants at Pier 39 and on the wharf, I'd look elsewhere.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Came here with the family for a day at the wharf.  Food tastes ehh at best.  Ordered 2 appetizers and an entree.  For some odd reason, the entree came before the appetizers. The twisted Mac and cheese with blackened chicken were barely grilled and not even blackened and didn't come close to what it looks like on the picture in the menu .  The hot chicken wings and twisted Mac and cheese were be supposed to be spicy and were warned by the waitress it was really spicy.  I am a person who doesn't eat spicy food often and I didn't even feel a thing.  More sour than spice.  The potato skins had so little bacon and cheese on it, it was more like a baked potato with cheese sprinkled on.  Waitress also took my plate before I was even done, but just let her take it because I was pretty much done with the place.

For dessert, ordered a hot fudge sundae.  Barely any fudge and the bottom of the glass was empty.  Manager or whoever, I don't care anymore, said it's supposed to be like that.  Funny because ghiradelli down the street doesn't do that. 

Only came because I had a gift card.  Won't be coming here again and will not recommend visitors to come.  Place is really crowded and really loud (which I kind of expected the noise), and could barely hear any of the music, which this place is supposed to be about.  Definitely not worth the price for the food even with the atmosphere and memorabilia carelessly placed on the walls.
author: Nicholas L.

description: First of all, I have to give major props to the staff at this hard rock. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. They had a couple groups of 100+ and the staff was hustling! The GM was bussing tables, serving, checking on tables and even handling a disgruntled employee. The food was what you would expect from a big chain restaurant...but we really really liked the fajitas and the apple cobbler was out of this world!!! Thank you Hard Rock staff for an impressive show of service on an incredibly slammed night!!!
author: Toni M.

description: As a local, I rarely venture into the Warf but for sake of spontaneity my girlfriends and I decided to embark on a little sailing adventure (Shout out to Adventure Cat). Post sail, we found ourselves in need of a beverage and snack (and a mirror to fix the birds nests on our heads created by the whipping winds of the bay). Once the wild nests were contained, we belly'd up to the bar and were greeted by Lauren, an awesome bartender with contagious energy. As she fixed us up some fancy margs, she assisted us with the menu and made some fantastic suggestions! We decided on french fries and potato skins! And not just your run-of-the-mil tato skins. She made em extra sassy with the addition of some avo and extra dipping sauces. We had a great experience! Well done Hard Rock Cafe and well done Lauren! We will be back soon!
author: R B.

description: Colby!!!! (Dramatic rude bartender ) he seriously thinks he owns the restaurant!!  He was such a jerk!!! You don't own the restaurant ok??!!! He is in such a seriously need to redo a customer service training service course or better off getting fired!!!! WOW!! Hard rock please hire people who seriously have manners and please make sure your bill is correct before you pay for your bill!!!!
author: Faymarie B.

description:
After reading some of the scathingly negative reviews, I was leery about visiting this location of the Hard Rock Cafe.  However, since I was with visiting family with children (I'm a native San Franciscan but they live in Pleasanton), we decided to take a chance. Maybe because the restaurant was a little quieter (Monday night around 7 pm), we found the service and food quite nice.  Received a table immediately and our friendly waiter greeted us promptly.  I found he was very attentive checking on us on a regular basis and making sure we were enjoying our meals.  Most of us had the BBQ combinations and the food was decent and very plentiful!

We also took advantage of the generous Yelp Check-in 15% discount, as well as the 2 hour parking validation (a $16 savings - that's kind of substantial!).  Oh!  The Yelp discount was also good in the gift shop!

So I'm happy to report SF's Hard Rock Cafe can be a pleasant dining experience!
author: Keefe C.

description:
I work in the area and often end up at Pier 39 to grab a bite to eat or a drink.

I really do try to avoid this place. I know, I know, Hard Rock is a tourist trap. It's over-priced, blah blah blah. Even with the discount I receive it is was too expensive and the service is slow.

It's taken me 2 years to find a meal I actually like and am wiling to pay  money for --- which is the grilled chicken sandwich.

The drinks are generally too sweet and too expensive, though I must admit they do make a decent mojito.

If you're a tourist, come here and enjoy the ambiance and get your collector's glass with "San Francisco" on it. If you're a local, go elsewhere.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Went to grab lunch before a boat ride in the bay. On Sunday,kids eat free and they had a balloon entertainer (also free). 
Food was slow to come out of the kitchen and standard. Nothing to note. I'd say the prices are even a bit high for a Hard Rock Cafe.
author: Greg M.

description: Average Hard Rock food, terrible service. We had reservations on Valentine's, food took an hour and a half to arrive. Food was mediocre and pretty small servings compared to similar restaurants around SF.  Fudge Brownie was amazing and wine list was great! But overall, would not return because we would not want to wait so long for food, bad service, and restrooms that are too small for the number of patrons. Always a restroom line!
author: Mike C.

description: Food was good and the service was great. It's a really small Hard Rock Cafe so I wouldn't go there if it's your first time! Go experience it in a bigger city!
author: Michelle N.

description:
So, I finally ate at Hard Rock Café after many years of never stepping foot into one and I must say that I was very impressed. This place has so much memorabilia in it that it felt like I was in the Rock n' Roll Hall of Fame. Okay, I've never been to the Rock N' Roll Hall of Fame but I can only imagine it looks like the Hard Rock Café minus the food, crying babies, and the cute waitresses. Because of this particular location and all the tourists in San Francisco, I was worried about a long wait but it was only about ten-minutes, which I thought was very good for a Saturday at Pier 39 and so the fun began...as we walked to our booth. I immediately recognized that the booth my friend and I sat in was huge. I mean this single booth could seat six people or a dozen midgets (OK that was wrong). 

SERVICE:

We had a waitress who had an attitude like she was about to crazy and throw onion rings if we asked for water with lemon instead of actual drinks but THANK GOD she went on her break and we got some guy who was great. He kept our waters (with lemon) filled to the rim and brought extra napkins and ketchup. I noticed the waiter who waited on our table was very social and sitting at random tables talking to customers. 

FOOD:

I had the Turkey Burger with jerk mayo, lettuce, tomato, red onion rings and topped with pepper jack cheese and fresh avocado slices...is was to die for and then come back to life like a ZOMBIE! It was one of the BEST Turkey Burgers I've ever had besides Ford's in Sacramento.

LOCATION:

This is a great location if you are spending the day at the Piers in San Francisco with family or friends. I would recommend sitting outside (I'll do that next time I go to this Hard Rock Café) to enjoy the lovely San Francisco weather to take in the entire experience of the day. If you want to get away for the heat or sunny (if out), then you'll want to relax inside and watch great music videos on flat screen TV's. It's pretty loud inside so if you plan to have a romantic date with plenty of intimate conversation, then this might not be the place as the music is blasting and you hear a lot of chatter. Hard Rock Café in San Francisco is a GREAT location to enjoy a quick meal before heading back out on the pier. Give it a shot!
author: Jovon T.

description:
I was at the touristy gift-shop to meet a friend. And at the gift-shop, they have Bruce Springsteen's 25th anniversary of his "Born in the USA" album cover tee for $30.00. 

"Damn, has it already been a quarter of a century already since his release?"

"Wow!"
author: Matt G.

description: Awful service! Waitress  Fuzzy ignorent and not friendly. Forgot about the salad I ordered, couldn't get her attention for 20 mins, friends were halfway done with their meal when she came up. Charged us for an extra appetizer we didn't get, and didn't get refunded because she pretended not to see us. I just got upset and walked out, which I regret..should have asked for a manager!
author: Dina M.

description: Cool music.  Use AAA card for discount and get parking validated. Good food. Fajitas and Tupelo chicken are good.
author: Thomas F.

description: Don't come here! Service appalling and  staff have no personality...like they just don't want to be here. No organization AT ALL...Still waiting on food...guy next to me waited 30 mins for a clam chowder...lol...jeez... And the place isn't even slam!
author: Fiona M.

description: Horrible service!  if i could give less stars i would! We were over charged by the server, "fuzzy" i think was her name, and after we showed it to her she didnt even fix it. We waited over 30 minutes to get it corrected and she was instead serving other tables. That just ends our night, we didnt get all our orders in and some of us didnt even get a chance to eat because of that. it was as if our table was the last priority on her list. What was supposed to be a quick dinner turned into 2+ hours at a table.  I will never return again and i wouldnt recommended anyone else to either.
author: Angelina K.

description: The surrounding is pretty cool, but for dining it's not that great. the food was and probably still is awful and overpriced. I saw our server 3 times throughtout the whole meal and it didn't help with that attitude she had. This place needs a lot of work.
