author: Josh K.

description:
I wish they would carry the cute ladies shirts in large women sizes.  I notice that most of the Ladies clothing only go up to XL.  I am a large woman and would be more inclined to buy a souvenir if there was more clothes in my size there.  There are unisex t-shirts available in large sizes however. 

Also I wish they would offer a more healthier menu of food as I am trying to be more careful about what I eat.  I would like to see more salads, sandwiches with lean meat, and pastas available.  Although you can substitute beef on your burger for a veggie, chicken or turkey patty.  Still the only side you get is fries which although are tasty, not very healthy.

Pros:
-a fun place to eat if you are a huge hard rock fan like me
-located conveniently at Pier 39 in Fisherman's Wharf
-cool souvenirs but a lack of large women's clothes
-lots of rock memorabilia and great music 
-has rewards program
-is a popular franchise with restaurants and hotels throughout the world

Cons:
-as I mentioned- lack of large women's clothing at gift shop
-lack of healthy entree options
author: Irene S.

description: Had a veggie burger and it was ok nothing major! Wait wasn't that bad and they were pretty busy!! I do think is too expensive for the quality of the food! Service was whatever
author: Rebecca M.

description: Great for what it is - a tourist destination for those who aim to do a lot of drinking. They hosted a great event for some volunteers and the staff and management could not have been nicer. Alas, just not my cup of tea.
author: Robert M.

description: Ate here randomly today while exploring. Staff was super attentive and friendly. A window broke in the kitchen apparently which caused our food order to be delayed. We all have worked in retail and understand mistakes happen, but the manager was proactive about the situation and paid for our meal! Great service!
author: Chase E.

description: My boyfriend and I came into hard rock after a long afternoon at the exploratorium. We were excited because the burgers are amazing. The hostess team was amazingly sweet. They even sat us a little earlier than promised. Everything was great until we got seated at our table. Our server, Chris, was rude, inattentive and uneducated about his menu. I pointed out that my boyfriend and I had different menus. He tells me that it's due to them making upgrades to the restaurant but everything was the same, but it wasn't. The prices were different as well as the listings. Again, I pointed that out to him and he tells me the "local legend"burger was the same as the "burger of the bay" despite their listings being different and prices. During me pointing these things out he responded with an attitude and from there our service went downhill. My water was never refilled despite us being there for well over an hour, he never asked us how the meal was and when we pointed out the price on our check was wrong he responds "I can have the dollar taken off" and rolls his eyes. This is disappointing because every other hard rock I've been to has been amazing. I will never return to this one again.  I would like to thank the manager, Luis, for being so understanding and willing to listen to our concerns.
author: Jenise H.

description: I ate at the Hard Rock Cafe after me and a friend did Alcatraz. Food was alright it didn't blow me away. The price wasn't good but it was San Fran and on the pier. What really got me was when the waiter asked if I wanted avocado for an extra $3.50. I don't know if that's normal for California but I live in Oregon and they don't charge any where near that for a small side of avocado. I wouldn't probably go back unless I was starving and wanted to eat right then and there.
author: Brandi F.

description: No worth it. Food was lacking all the flavor and the wait wasn't worth it. The only saving grace this place had to offer was the great service from our waiter Jesse.
author: Paul S.

description: Love their massive portions of nachos! Try chicken or pork both are really yummy :) Great American food, bit on the pricy side but it's really close to work which is a plus. Would definitely recommend for those who like typical American restaurants, huge portions always awesome to take home and this place is great for parties!
author: Shells M.

description:
Just started to make this place my new home.  The bar is quick to get you your drinks at good prices, food just as good.  So far I've had the BBQ Platter with ribs and Chicken and the BBQ Pork sandwich.  

Both had great flavors and large portions.  Put the cole slaw on the sandwich...its great!

I for one will be back...great place for locals....
author: Kenneth G.

description:
SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOWWW service! Expensive, little food. and our waitress snuck in an expensive $10 virgin drink to the bill!!!  DO NOT EAT HERE!

1. bacon cheeseburger -good portion (my 12 year old liked it)
2. chicken marsala pasta (SMALL PORTION for an entree, might as well been an appetizer and tasteless)
3. kids mac and cheese - probably the best thing we ordered
4. kids cheeseburger - average portion
5. virgin pina colada - good
6. virgin mango smoothie ($10 includes take home glass!!!) - good but not worth $10!!! 
7. coke
8. creme brulee 
=$100 (includes 15% tip, which we shouldn't have gave at all)

Our waitress took 25 minutes to greet us and that's only because we had to wave somebody down to serve us.  Did I mention that it was already @ 3pm?  It wasn't even busy! When she came to greet us, she literally threw down our drink coasters with no smile.  The only good thing was that the food came out fast after our order but took forever for the check to come.  Total time spent for a "Linner" was about 2 hours!
author: Leisheung P.

description:
This review is written from the perspective of a foreigner, opinions may differ!

I'm from Germany and I've been living here for a couple of months now, which means that I still have an accent. I was at the Hard Rock Cafe with my parents and my sister who were visiting me over the holidays; they all have pretty strong accents. 

So in the moment our waitress noticed that we were from Europe, she suddenly stopped giving us good service because at this location (it's located at Pier 39, the most touristy place in SF) they deal with a lot of European tourists and in Europe it just isn't common to give a high tip at restaurants. So she probably thought why make an effort when they won't tip anyway.
Here's the deal though: along with our bill, we got a piece of paper on which it said in different languages that it is common courtesy to tip waiters here in the US. Furthermore, our waitress circled the gratuity suggestions on our bill with a neon highlighter, almost forcing us to tip at least 15% although the service was really bad. I  think this is behavior is just really rude. I get why they would advise foreign tourists to tip, but then I would like to have an appropriate reason for why I should tip 15-20% and not this kind of poor service! And I saw her being really nice and friendly next to us!

So if you're from the US, I can't speak for you; but if you have a foreign accent, I would advise you not to visit this place, they might just be rude to you and still demand a good tip.

I would give this location 1 star, but the food was really good and the atmosphere is just wonderful! The music is really nice and all those guitars on the wall make the Hard Rock Cafe a beautiful place to go to if you're into rock/blues.
author: Christian B.

description: Went there for dinner with my significant other this past November. We had an amazing time dining there. Everything was on point and great. I wish I had pictures to share images of our yummy food. But sadly both our phones had died after taking many pictures in our Alcatraz Island tour. The  location is just perfect. When we arrived there was no wait. We both had cocktail drinks which were great. I had their BBQ trio which was delicious. My SO had their tango burger I believe is call. We both loved that burger we have even tried making it at home sadly it doesn't taste the same lol but def a spot to grab a bite and a few drinks if you are in the bay pier 39.
author: Ana G.

description:
I love the Hard Rock Café, don't get me wrong, but this one is just disappointing. We usually go to the HRC in Amsterdam because I crave their veggie burgers and they're the best I've ever had.

Now, as for this HRC. The place is already small and crowded, so noise level is always going to be a problem but don't try to drown everything out with the music. The music is seriously so loud that you have to yell at your server and personally, I feel ashamed of myself and like a douche when I yell at a server. Even if it's only because of the loud music. My second problem with the music: the music. Justin Bieber and Miley Cyrus are not, never have been and never will be in any way appropriate to play at the HRC. Seriously, you guys could learn something from the Amsterdam playlists.

As for the food goes, I figured I'd order something different for once and went with the twisted mac, no meat. Le boyfriend had the turkey burger and we shared the garlic fries and onion rings as sides. I have to say, the garlic fries really were garlic-y (yum!) but drowning in their own grease. The garlic toast that comes with the twisted mac, I wonder if even one molecule of garlic touched the toast. Le sad! I love garlic! The mac and cheese wasn't anything I'd recommend to anyone. Le boyfriend liked his turkey burger, so yay! As for the onion rings. They came out sloppy and slightly raw in the inside, so I sent them back and asked for superextramega crispy. The onion rings return, only slightly crispier. Fine, I liked our server, so I didn't want to be too much of an annoying customer so we kept the still floppy, slightly undercooked onion rings. Such a let down as they are always perfect and super crunchy in Amsterdam.

One thing that's universal: great drinks!

As for the service. We're used to the friendly international staff at the Amsterdam HRC. Our server was friendly enough, but others just seemed hurried, cranky and all over the place. Maybe work on some team building and customer service exercises guys? I remember when I worked at a café that no matter how cranky I was, customers would always see me smiling. Even if I was on dish duty that night. So I think it's important to receive the same kind of service that I would give and it's what I always look for. Everywhere.
author: Bekkah R.

description: Worst Hard Rock experience. Messed up 2 out of 3 orders and waited 15 mins to get our beer and mixed drink. When I needed a soda refill it took 15 mins to get one. After my bun was soaked in grease the manager tried to stop by when I was in the bathroom and told my friends he'd be back once I returned and never showed up. Must have been other screw-ups to fix. Save your money, save your time.
author: Nathan E.

description: First of all don't come here if it isn't for drinks. The waiters are trash. They sat four of us in a tiny round table and when we asked for another table they denied our request. After finishing our appetizers they brought our entrees, there was no space for anything on that table so we were making room for our dishes the waiter didn't even ask to remove the appetizer we were done with. She knew we were struggling to make space and instead got mad and slammed our macaroni dish on the table. Her name was Yari or Yadee i don't know. The whole night she came by she had an attitude. She needs to get fired or keep her problems at home. The drinks were really good but another girl who brought them also had an attitude. The food was terrible and overpriced (macaroni cavatoppi and the burger). I wouldn't come back here, kudos to the african american male server who served us; he was the only one with a great attitude.
author: Sol R.

description: The food was so so had the ribs and the last few pieces were burnt the bathroom was clog up  won't be back
author: Patty H.

description: Horrible service, not very clean, and the food all tasted like it went straight from the freezer to the fryer!
author: John T.

description: I've always been a fan of this Hard Rock. I usually get the BBQ bacon burger and its always excellent. The potato skins are also very good. This place gets crowded from its location so expect a wait and sometimes service can be a little slow.
author: Ryan H.

description: I came here obviously expecting too much. We were waiting for a table and the host didn't seat us until I went to ask how much longer it was going to be. The waiter we got was pretty good overall. He checked up on his regularly. The food was very mediocre. I ordered fajitas and the tortillas were store temperature cold. The 5 pieces of beef and 4 pieces of chicken with some condiments was a $21 dollar dish. I thought the tortillas being cold was bringing the rest of the food down but when I asked the waiter to heat the tortillas up it still wasn't very good. The mac and cheese i ordered as a side for 6.75 was bland and very greasy. I was so disappointed. The only reason I gave 2 stars was because the waiter was attentive and also he talked to his manager about my food and we got it taken off the bill. I was happy to not have to pay almost $30 for food I did not enjoy. Will not be coming back but still has $10 dollars left on my gift card if anyone is interested lol
author: Jane S.

description:
This review is solely for the customer service I just received on the phone.

I call restaurants surprisingly frequently in my non-work life, and I also often call them for business. I also answer phones for a major part of my work. Personally, I try to be friendly on the phone, because hey, people are stressed.

Usually when I call a restaurant, it is loud. Super loud. And whoever is answering the phone seems to have *much* better things to do than answer a simple question or direct my call. Having worked as a hostess in a few restaurants, I know that this is part of the job, so it never fails to amaze me when this isn't done well.

However, the person who just answered at this Hard Rock location (I think her name was Christy or Kristy?) was SO friendly, and even though my reason for calling actually was kind of a waste of her time (calling back a missed call from an anonymous person), she treated me with courtesy and cheer. I don't know if she's just a really nice person, or if they have great staff training, but it was an interaction that is the exception to the rule, and I thought it deserved to be shared.

(Also, I have eaten here, and let's face it -  Hard Rock is a chain. As far as chains go, it's fun, and as far as chain locations go, I think SF has a great Hard Rock.)
author: Carrie D.

description: I had the cowboy rib eye medium/well and my daughter had the swiss mushroom burger.  My steak was perfect....mashed potatoes lukewarm on the outside hot inside....blue lake string brings bland but cooked perfectly and tasted good after I put some of the herb butter that was on my steak on them.....I tasted my daughters burger and it was hella good too!
author: Shaneka S.

description: A good selection of dishes and great atmosphere. This is the place I come most when I am visiting Pier 39. Prices also are not too bad. I like the novelty cups.
author: Jason W.

description: Delicious food! Loved the Parmesan fries. The clam chowder was the bomb! Our daughter loved the hot cocoa. The Long Island was amazing
author: Carrie A.

description:
Loved this place!! 
I had the twisted mac n cheese n chicken and it was DELICIOUS! I'm still raving about it a week later, seriously it was that good. 
The atmosphere was great. They had some rock music videos going on, and my little one really enjoyed that! 
A bit pricy, but that's Hard Rock!
author: Jess F.

description: Went here Christmas Day and the place was packed prob because it was one of the few spots open. Got the Jumbo Combo appetizer plate and it was very good. Shouldn't have gone on Xmas Day, it was obvious the staff didn't want to be working, and I don't blame them. The place should close and let the workers have the day off.
author: Anuj V.

description:
This building used to house a massive arcade. It had all the cool games my little hands wanted to play with. I remember how it robbed me of quarters because it only dispensed 3 tokens for every darned dollar I had.  

This place is still another Hard Rock, like all other Hard Rocks. The appetizers invite my hands to molest them in a frenzy of a food orgy.

Beyond the usual appetizers and the beer on tap, I don't think there is much that separates this place from other chains such as BJs.
author: Alfred Y.

description: Horrendous service. Came in with 2 children and ignored for 15 mins before being told where we were to go to out our name down to wait for a table. Told to wait at the bar and ignored there for 10 mins until we were told that children were not allowed at the bar. Food looked dry and overcooked, staff were surly and very unhelpful. Walked out and so so glad we did not part with any cash for this dive.
author: Lucinda D.

description: Not a bad place to grab a bite, after a trip to Alcatraz. American food, pretty standard. Quite loud in there, and my avocado burger gave me stomach grief hours later, but the food and service weren't bad.
author: Monica M.

description:
This was my first time eating at a Hard Rock Cafe, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  After glancing over the menu, I had already decided that I would most likely never eat at another one because it is overpriced American food.  I ended up splitting the pulled pork sandwich and the SOB legendary burger with my boyfriend.  The pulled pork was alright;  it was a little dry for my taste and the amount of sauce was not sufficient to compliment each bite.  The coleslaw and beans that came with the pulled pork were pretty good, but nothing spectacular.  The burger was pretty good, but again, nothing too special.  It also claimed to be spicy, but neither of us thought it was spicy in the least.  

I like that they gave us wet towelettes and dry napkins as well because it was messy! So props on that.  I appreciate the small things!  The decor is also pretty cool, with the walls covered in relics from rock stars and such.

Overall, mediocre food experience.  If you're in SF, there are obviously thousands of other (and better) choices.
author: Can C.

description: Best food ever! Got the Classic Nachos and Spinach dip as starters. Best nachos that beat Cheesecake Factory's nachos hands down. My girlfriend got the twisted mac n cheese and I got the ribs. Best taste ever. Cooked to perfection. Lovely atmosphere, great music and lively. Right in front of the pier also. Really huge space and environment.
author: Johnny V.

description: Worst service ever..after waiting 30 mins for a water we did not get water and we had one drink and were advised we were cut off because we were "rude" to the waiter because we said excuse me where's our waters ..they are some racist f**** don't waste your time here there's better hard rocks out there don't come to this bs u will never get ur food or drinks maybe after hour of waiting or if you white they really could suck it easy if there was zero stars I would give them at
author: Jesse G.

description:
I went into this place without a headache and came out with a massive headache.  I listen to really loud music almost every day of my life because I prefer it loud, but this place was too loud.  And the music was awful; I would expect to hear at least a few rock songs at Hard Rock Cafe, but all that played was current hip hop.  

The decor was not what I expected in comparison to other Hard Rock Cafes.  It was unimpressive.  There was almost no light in the ladies' room.  If you don't mind peeing in the dark, I suppose you'll fit right in.

The service was not nearly the worst I've had, but it wasn't great.  The nachos were good and the beer was fine, but the chicken in my chicken club was disgustingly cold.

I wouldn't eat here again.
author: Casey B.

description:
Another terrible experience... After the first time, my boyfriend and I decided to give this place another shot. Bad idea. We went during the weekday so it was pretty slow. We got seated and right away I needed to use the restroom. Once I get back, my boyfriend was explaining how our waitress was hitting on him the whole time I was gone. But, once I got back she comes over saying she was getting sent home. (Don't think so, considering she was helping a table behind us the whole time we were there)

My boyfriend had ordered some lemonade drink with a souvenir glass to help breast cancer. This is where it went downhill. The waitress, totally absent minded didn't charge us for the glass, just the drink when he specifically pointed to the picture showing the glass as a souvenir. So she added it making it from $5 to $9. Again, we had to wait around for the bill and to ask where to get our glass since she didn't tell us. Once we headed over the the shop, the employee says we weren't charged for it. Explaining what happened she grabbed the waitress. The waitress didn't realize, AGAIN, we wanted the glass but thought we were just making a donation. So we had to pay another $3. If she wasn't so absent minded and actually paid attention to us, none of this would've happened.

And to make things worse, we had vouchers to use at dinner; so the manager (assuming) who was eating two tables away, came over to see how everything went. He didn't smile, ask if there was any problems or any questions at all! Very unpleasant.

Gave this place TWO tries. Never ever coming back.
author: Lisa F.

description: Stopped in San Francisco two days during our honeymoon/birthdays road trip and had to hit the Hard Rock during our stay. Food was good, drinks were great and the atmosphere was amazing. Music was great (and LOUD). We had a great time, would recommend and will stop here again next time.
author: Bill A.

description:
In desperate need of a bathroom and a place to rest my weary feet and grab a drink, we reluctantly came here.

Crappy nachos and 2 cokes (unlimited refills) with tax and tip totaled nearly $25 bucks.  That's a lot of money for a bathroom break.

Our server was excellent but the 16 teenagers working the hostess stand, and the clueless wonder who couldn't locate us to serve our food, were additional negatives.

Nevermore, nevermore...
author: Craig W.

description: I returned here because the manager was generous enough to provide me with a gift card since i was disappointed with my experience the first time. I did not order the same items off of the menu but I was happier with what I ordered. I ended up choosing the pulled chicken sandwich and it was good. The fries were the best part because their seasoning was addictive. The sandwich was good as well even though I'd recommend asking for extra sauce. The service however, was not much better. We sat for probably 10 minutes before our waitress came over to welcome us and take our drink order. I am adding an additional star to my original two star rating because my sandwich was tasty and I appreciate the manager providing me with a chance to come back and try the restaurant again for a second time.
author: Alyssa L.

description: My family and I ate here on a Friday evening. Got a table right away. The greeters were super friendly and our waiter had a laid back (but attentive) demeanor that was perfect after the hectic vibe from walking Pier 39. Our food was prepared perfectly, and arrived just as we were finishing our appetizer. Drinks were refilled promptly. Bathroom was in slight need of repair and some fresh paint. Otherwise a perfect experience. Oh, and $10 off our parking with validation!
author: Gretchen H.

description: See Prozac Zach for all your dining needs. He took care of Team Panda (all 7 of us)! Great food, great location and the best staff!
author: john j.

description: Friendly attitudes but extremely poor service. We waited 5 minutes at the entrance as there was no host present. We waited considerable periods of time for service throughout our meal.
author: William A.

description: Great food as usual but crappy service twice in one day!  Went early in day and poor bar service.  Went later for dinner and equally crappy service.
author: Terri G.

description: OK so it's Fisherman's Wharf.  It's gonna be pretty busy.  A group of us were walking around the Wharf and needed a restaurant that we would all be OK with so we ended up at Hard Rock Cafe.  I have been to alot of them so I am used to the atmosphere- very festive and fun.  I ordered a simple mac n cheese with chicken added to it. It was absolutely wonderful.  I had actually been having bad luck with meals on this work trip, so I was very very happy to finally have a meal that I truly enjoyed and wanted to eat.  My co-workers on the other hand weren't so lucky and didn't enjoy their meals so much.  Service was standard.  A bit on the pricey side for what it is, but I was so thankful to have good food it didn't matter.
author: Zewditu D.

description:
I went to visit my boyfriend in the city while he was working on a project. We decided to head to the Fisherman's Wharf area. After walking around for awhile we decided to go get some dinner. My boyfriend suggested The Hard Rock Cafe. I had never been here before and he said he had gone to the one in Vegas and liked it. 

We stepped inside the restaurant and were sited right away, which was nice. However that was the only nice thing. The food here was terrible. I ordered the citrus chicken salad and my boyfriend ordered the pulled pork sandwich. My salad had way too much blue cheese on it and my boyfriends sandwich was dry and tasteless.

For the amount of money we paid for dinner I really would've expected the food to be much better. The Fisherman's Wharf area has so many better food options that cost less money and will provide the customer with a better quality meal.

Overall I will definitely not be coming back to this restaurant and anyone else who is thinking of going here I would suggest to just go to one of the many other restaurants around the area which is not a chain restaurant .
author: Nava N.

description:
we were told that it would take 15 minutes for our table to become available. we were seated in 9. not too shabby! 

 the women at the entrance were quite kind to us. 

chris expertly served us. he was working 4 or 5 other tables at the same time, but never neglected us, or interrupted us, or acted as though we were a burden. 
we love being treated this way...like - say it with me now: rock stars... 

our burgers and appeazetizers were good and cooked to order, but not great. our portions of fries were tiny compared to what we have received on previous visits. 
prices appear to have doubled since our last visit.  

my chocolate shake was outstanding. 
we love looking at the memorabilia. 

the men's room was clean, had soap, and no line. 
according to my excellent wife, the women's room was dirty, and was a socialization center - which prevented a line of women from fast relief. this is the first time in my life that i heard of women cutting in line in a restaurant restroom.
author: Mark G.

description:
Fun, loud and family friendly,  but a bit over priced. Food is OK, but over salted and bland.

Exactly what I expected and they have great drinks and the place is a rock fans dream.

Server was really nice and very helpful.

Store has some nice stuff too.
author: Henry S.

description: Nice place to go after work to spend some time with coworkers. Everything on the appetizer menu was half off which was great. So if you wanna relax and have fun this is a great place to go while on the Bay area. Oh and it's on Fisherman's warf so you can go around before or after.
author: Jorge Daniel M.

description:
Being in Fisherman's Wharf, its hard to give it a good "over-three" star rating, because it is a major tourist- type of place. The Girlfriend and I have gone there only a few times - when we were pretending to be tourists - and I have to say... the nachos are pretty good, but that is about it. Drink-wise... it's overpriced, and if you're looking for a martini... go elsewhere. The bartender didn't know the difference when I said "very dry." She loaded it with Olive juice and said she thought that I (ME!) didn't know what I wanted, and that I really wanted a dirty martini. If I wanted a dirty martini, I'd have ASKED for a dirty martini. 

San Francisco has so much more in regard to restaurants... unless you really are a die hard fan of Hard Rock Cafes... you can do better than this place.
author: Eric P.

description:
In my life, I have never had the desire to eat at the Hard Rock Café.  There is just something about calling it the Hard Rock Café that doesn't seem right.  Plus, based on the music that they played when I was in the dinning area, there is not much about the place that is "Hard Rock."

Entering and exiting through the gift shop also sends the wrong message to me.  It's as if the restaurant is just there to supplement the merchandising.

Anyway, onto the "Hard Rock"...  We were seated at a cramped little table in the main dining area.  I looked around at the spectacle of "Hard Rock" and found it to be a mixed bag.  On the one hand, I really enjoyed seeing guitars signed by guitar wizards such as B. B. King and Eddie Van Halen.  On the other hand, they are just guitars signed by those guys.  It's not as if they were actually used and, on top of that, I question the validity of the signatures.  Now, I have no evidence that they are not genuine, but I was once told that the items in Planet Hollywood were often just reproductions of originals, so why could the same be true in the "Hard Rock" Café.

The meal was priced as expected for a touristy eatery.  The food (a BBQ burger) was okay.  I've had better and at $15 should've been better.  Also, the drink prices were crazy!  It was $10 for a drink or $16 for one in a souvenir glass.  I just wanted a yummy alcoholic beverage.  For that price I could've bought an entire bottle of rum at CVS.

The service stuck out to me because I'm noticing this trend of waiters/waitresses NOT doing their job completely.  Our waitress introduced herself, then someone else took our drink order.  Our waitress brought the drinks and took our order, then someone else brought the food.  Finally our check was delivered by someone else, but our waitress brought back the credit card slips.  WTF?

I'm in no rush to risk a repeat experience.
author: Nick M.

description: had the cobb salad and diet coke no ice and glass of water service was great for lunch on a weekday
author: Leigh G.

description: Decided to stop here with my sister and our boyfriends to kill some time down on Fishermans Wharf. I can't get over how expensive these places have gotten. It used to be fun to go get drinks and and appetizer and enjoy the fun music history. We looked over the menu to see if there were any good apps but it seems as though the list keeps getting smaller and smaller and the prices go up. We decided to get three drinks and the bill ended up being close to $30. I give it three stars because the service was good and attentive.
author: Lindsay A.

description: We came here  starving after taking the tour to Alcatraz. There was a 15 minute wait which seemed unnecessary when we were eventually seated - there were several empty, set tables. Our waiter was great - very attentive and friendly. The food is decent and the atmosphere was good.
author: Joyce H.

description:
Came here around closing time after a champagne-filled sail on the bay in celebration of my graduation from college. It was the only place open so late at night.

The waitress was very friendly and didn't make us feel rushed at all. It was very overpriced, but their mac and cheese was delicious and very satisfying. And it was a big enough portion size that I had some for lunch the next day as well.

Not too shabby.
author: Katie S.

description: This update is based solely on the amazing customer service response.  I was contacted and offered a gift card and was given an apology by the manager directly and that is huge.  I am a fan of this attention to detail and am excited to give Hard Rock another chance!
author: Lilia L.

description:
I don't like giving bad reviews.  It happened 2-weeks ago and I'm still bothered by it.  

Eating at a restaurant isn't just about the food.  It's about the service, too.  They go together.  What good is your food when I already have a bitter taste from your hostess? I've had better service at a MacDonald's drive-thru.

I always knew Hardrock at the Pier was there, but thought it was just another cheesy tourist spot.  After a trip to NYC and eating at Hardrock Times Square (being a tourist, I decided to be cheesy),  I became a big fan.  Food was fantastic!  But, here? From the other reviews it seems as if the food isn't that great.   I wouldn't know.  I wish I could tell you, but I couldn't get pass the rude hostess.  

I tried going here for my birthday.  I knew the wait would take a bit longer than 15 minutes considering it's on the wharf .  I walk up to the hostess and she looks at me and goes "Oh, it will take 30 minutes"...with that "Oh-no-sucks-for-you-and-not-for-me-cuz-I'm-getting-paid-standing-here-giving-everybody-attitude" tone of voice.  At this point, I was like whatever...bad day, chill, I just got here, WTF?  Then when I requested a high-chair for my 2 year old instead of a booster, she again goes "OOOOH, that will take FORTY-FIVE minutes instead" and looked (more like glared) at me weird.  45 min wait on a Tuesday early evening? Do you want me to eat here? I guess...NOT because - it wasn't the waiting time that got me, it was her stank attitude.  I was concerned that the rest of the staff would be like this, so I took my business (and their stupid buzzer) elsewhere....like at the end of the pier where they serve shrimp, not attitude. Glad I made the right choice and didn't get my birthday dinner ruined by someone who obviously wasn't having a good day.  Sucks, eh? I really wanted to eat here. 

Maybe I'll try them out when I'm having a spontaneous day in the city since I want to try their food.  For special occasions, I'd rather go somewhere- friendly.

Btw- I returned the buzzer at the end of the night.
author: Jazzy B.

description: Ordered the classic burger with Swiss and bacon as an extra. The burger was lovely and so was the dipping sauce but the portion of fries was a real let down, not even a handful!! And it cost nearly $21 including a Pepsi. Didn't think it was good value at all.
author: Pam S.

description: Came out here straight from the airport on August 21st.  Hosts Evelyn and Carly were awesome!  Let me charge my phone and took care of me while I was meeting up some friends.  Food and drink was cool.  Def would head back here.
author: Santhosh S.

description:
To start, I am a fan of Hard Rock Cafe and have been to more than 40 of them.  When I travel for work we eat there because we know what we are getting. Unfortunately this location isn't really on par with the others.  
Upon arriving the hostess said they are always rated in the top locations for HRC. FALSE.  We got the easy stuff. Burgers! The food was bland. The bun had more flavor than the burger. Everyone at the table was unhappy.  Our drinks spent more time empty than full, but we got the check without asking. Never gotten the check with the food before.  No dessert I guess???  
Go here if you like, but I would say it's a strong 4 out of 10.  Training may be a good idea from the top down.
author: Mike K.

description:
Spent the day in the city. Since we had our wedding day lunch at the HRC in Tahoe we thought it'd be fun to have lunch here. 
I had the calif club sandwich. Bread was toasted & super dry. Sandwich lacked favor & chicken tasted funny like it was cooked on a fake grill. My onions rings were dark and lacking flavor. Luckily my house salad was good. My daughter had the sirloin steak which looked pretty good. Husband had the appetizer sampler which was like $20. All fried a dark brown. Potato skin & onion rings flavorless. Chicken wings & egg rolls ok but not great. I also had some good virgin fruity drink that I thought came in a souvenir glass but didn't. Waitress nice but sort of dingy -came by 3x but never took my empty plate. 
The quality of he food has gone down a lot since my last visit. Such a bummer! Too $$ to go there for bad food especially with so many other places to try.
author: Andrea W.

description: So I decided to try Hard Rock Cafe because it had been so long since I have had it. I walked in during lunch and it was pretty steadily busy. However I was able to get a table right away. The server Mathew was very hospitable and spared no expense to make sure my dining experience was beyond exceptional. He showed me some of his favorites on the menu and also answered any questions that I had regarding the menu. The food arrived hot) and quite delicious looking I might add). I was going to go for The Texan™ burger that is featured on their menu but I decided to keep it simple and go for some buffalo chicken strips and Parmesan French fries. Man were they good! As a server myself, I am a bit nit picky about things that involve the guests dining experience but Mathew did not disappoint. All in all a great experience. Would I recommend going there again or trying it out for the first time? Yes. I do hope the management staff recognizes that their server Mathew is rockin' the job!
author: Marco G.

description: I took 11 of my little girls friends here for her 10th birthday party. Not only were the staff accommodating, they went out of their way to make all of us feel welcome and enjoy our visit. The General Manager Barry Cales went out of his way to greet our table and wish my daughter a happy birthday. Barry e mailed me the week before our arrival with all the details and put together party bags for all of the kids. He made sure that our table was very well taken care of and really went out of his way to give us a great experience. The staff was so friendly and on point all night. We could not have enjoyed our experience anymore then we did that night. Really!!! ABOVE AND BEYOND! Thank you
author: Sarah M.

description: The service sucks here!!  Douchbag, hipster, Gen X wash out...  Very rude people working here!!!  I will never ever come back to this location..  Beware!!!!
author: Kimberly G.

description: Came here on Christmas Eve with the family. First time for most of us being here. I ordered the fish and chips and it was very good. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food as much as I did. The environment is pretty cool, especially if you're really into rock music. There's a lot to look at. Reason for 4 stars is that everything on the menu is pretty pricey and the appetizer we ordered was tiny. Good service, but did take awhile to get our drinks and food.
author: Amanda L.

description: I've been to this location when I was working at a booth for a vendor at Pier 39. I thought the food was good, not great, and the portions? Well, for the price I would have preferred more food.
author: Peter J.

description: Always a great experience. I love the atmosphere at the different locations. I think the prices are a bit higher than they need to be (food and suvies), but other than that, the food and experiences are great!
author: Wade J.

description:
Over priced mediocre food, but you don't go to a Hard Rock for the food alone.  We went for the live band.  Was nice to be able to enjoy the food and a concert at the same time.  

Dessert was large enough to share. 

Blackened fish sandwich was a bit disappointing.  Salmon filet decent.  Best choice was the BBQ ribs with fall off the none meat.  

Can park in the pier 39 lot or if after 6pm try one of the lots of Stockton where you can pay $10 until they close at 11pm.
author: Berles C.

description: A bit smaller than the one in NYC, but great service nonetheless, and a decent drink and food selection. No windows so no views
author: Vivek R.

description:
I was there for a special event this past Saturday, so I can't comment on the food. However, I do want to give props to the waitstaff... They were all so pleasant and friendly! All of the guys and ladies that we encountered, had smiles and got us everything we asked for quickly. 
So my experience with the staff there was great and I would go back again for a normal meal.
author: Dawn R.

description: Like all of the restaurants in this chain, the decor is amazing.  I would go just to check out the memorabilia.  Alas, the food is really sub-par.  The burgers are small and dry and tasteless. Our waiter never put our order in, so we waited forever for our food, without any offer of apology.  Then when the meal finally arrived, our sad little burgers were accompanied by what was clearly the last of the fries from the batch - small broken nubs and crumbs.  Go for a drink at the bar and check out the cool artifacts, but definitely skip dinner.  There are many better meals to be had nearby.
author: Erica M.

description: DO NOT COME HERE! I'm a Server myself, and I have a lot of patience with restaurants, but this was ridiculous! We went this past Saturday 3/7/15. It was a busy day in the city, the Chinese New Years parade was that night, and the weather felt like a summer day, it was gorgeous. So of course the restaurant was pretty busy. We were told there was up a 20 minute wait. No prob, and we were also asked if we wanted to sit outside or inside, we didn't care we just wanted whatever was available first. There was only 3 of us, My husband, my 2 year old daughter, and me. We waited, and they sat us on the patio. We were partially in the sun, but we didn't care, we just needed to eat. By this time it's about 1pm. So we look over the menu, got my daughter situated. There were not many people on the patio, maybe 7 tables, one of which was a party of six, but the rest were 2 tops. We sat and waited, and waited, and waited. There were two servers working the patio, and neither one of them ever even acknowledged us. No one said, "I'll be right with you" or anything. It was literally like we were invisible! It was bizarre. After waiting 20 MINUTES, we left. I was so pissed, and hungry, and my poor daughter was starving! We ended up getting hot dogs right in front of the restaurant. We just needed to eat, and my daughter needed something. It was unbelievable. Like I said, I'm a server and I have a lot of patience and understanding, but this was ridiculous. I will never go there again, and I will never recommend anyone to go there after that experience. Steer clear of this place.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
The Hard Rock cafe is best known for it's atmosphere, and quite frankly, that is the only thing good there. I went there a few months ago for a friend's birthday; no one was in, so we were seated immediately. Then the waitress came over and made a rude comment to one of my friends when he asked a simple question about one of the dishes. From there she continually was rude and slow for the rest of the night. I found it surprising how terrible the service was since we were, after all, the only ones in the restaurant.

Would I recommend this place to a friend? Probably not; terrible service, expensive food, and an atmosphere that you can be a part of by just simply walking in the door. If you are at fisherman's wharf, you can find much better places to eat.
author: Scott P.

description: First time coming to the Hard Rock! Although it was a bit pricy, the food was very delicious! The music is great! Excellent service! Dane is an awesome waitress !:p and great check-in deals ! Definitely coming here again when I'm in the city.
author: Rosa V.

description: This was bloody terrible. We went with a large group, and I know it's hard to deal with large groups but they were terribly rude. they were not just rude they were out right nasty. Our server, who I don't even know his or her name as there were a few people moving around the slop they call food, he refused to give refills, I had to go to the bar for refills, only good and decent server there. Don't waste your time or money here!
author: Clayton S.

description: I tried one of the local favorites called burger by the bay or something and it was amazing. It was also served with garlic fries that were good as well. Service wasn't bad and they got us seated fairly quick. If in the area again may come back and try some more items.
author: Adam D.

description: A waiter named Chris at this restaurant have me a hot water when I asked him for water and gave me a picture of a salmon instead of the Salmon I ordered off of the menu
author: Dylan K.

description: I just left its 8:21. I've been waiting since 7:02pm when they told me it was going to be 30 mins. I asked an hour in how much longer and they told me 5mins and I was the next 3 person party. I saw a total of 6, 3 party people go in. The two girls at the front desk couldn't even give me a good estimate or say I'm sorry for the wait. I hope the manager reads this and just gives that feedback to them. About the food I guess I can't even grade that.
author: Angel A.

description: This Place Rocks!  My daughter and I were there a few days ago while in San Francisco and had a great time.  The music was loud (the way rock is intended to be listened to) and the food was excellent.  Our server, Little Sam, is definitely worth mentioning.  She was attentive to all our needs and requests, re-filling our drinks bringing extra napkins etc. all with a positive, friendly attitude.  The only down side was when some other guests wanted to sit at the bar but it was already full and so they were just hovering by our table waiting for some stools to open up which made it a bit uncomfortable.    Other then that, I would highly recommend.  I will certainly go back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Mark S.

description: Following up,Barry, the manager at the Hard Rock in San Francisco, contacted me immediately and apologized. He was very understanding and sent me two gift cards to visit them again. It was nice knowing that they cared and tried to fix the problem. Thank you for responding back and caring what your customers think.
author: Mary M.

description: Aside from being on the touristy busy wharf the Hard Rock for me is always a good time. The memorabilia,music and vibe here is always good. The food is good and service good enough. I always get the wings which are great here ...matter of fact that's all I order here !
author: Carlos G.

description: Overpriced food and poor service to kick. There are much better options in the area.
author: John H.

description: The food was mediocre and the nachos and the sante Fe spring rolls and the fries were too salty. I was dissapointed.
author: Cheri R.

description: Hard rock not only has great food but the atmosphere is rocking! They pick the best music while enjoying your meal! They also have a wide variety of entrees and drinks! I would recommend this place to anyone.
author: Autumn B.

description:
I love this one for several reasons:
- it looks pretty stylish from outside
- the Rock shop is one of the better ones, good selection, good service
- the location at Pier 39, in viewing distance of Alcatraz
- the fabulous ribs! (though I turned into a vegetarian in the meantime)
Apart from this: it's dark, loud, good music (as always in HRCs) and you can watch Baseball, Football or whatever during you meal, if you desire to do so. I've always been there on my own and enjoyed it. Should be pretty hard for couples or families to start any type of conversation though.
author: Baldwick77

description: Same as every other Hard Rock. Waiters were overworked with the high traffic and as a result a bit short tempered. Our waiter was fine but we saw some of the other staff be downright rude to customers. Food was good, drinks overpriced but fine.
author: Casey T.

description:
My office moved to the wharf so we're on a tour of crappy tourist restaurants. How they managed to make a hamburger bad is beyond me.

The milk-shakes here are not nearly as good as the one's at hard rock london.

Bonus points for our waiter being cool and honest and telling us how he really felt. I added a star just for him!
author: Nikki M.

description: Hard Rock Cafe in San Francisco is amazing the customer service is excellent our waiter CeeCee and the restaurant Supervisor Luis Baltodano were great I totally recommend this restaurant. Ask for Cee Cee he is awesome!
author: Arturo F.

description:
On a night out, we landed at this place for drinks. I know, what were we thinking. We're not tourists! At the behest of a diehard Hard Rock Cafe fan, we went. 

The service was lacking. Our waiter seated us only to let us know he was going on break and would be back 30 minutes later. His replacement took our drink order. I ordered the Cherry Bomb - so gross. To me, anything with the word "bomb" indicates a shot. This drink was the gnarliest combination of cherry vodka and red bull. One sip and I was done. The rest of the crew had a hurricane, I had a sip, also not my favorite. 

The fan ordered a burger which looked semi tasty. The rest of us had a side of fries which were warm and chewy again, no bueno. 

Refills were slow to come by and the tab was waaaay expensive for a burger, fries, and 3 drinks. 

Lower your expectations when you step in here or leave it for the tourists.
author: Cassie M.

description:
I have a soft spot for Hard Rock Cafe in my heart. My dad worked as a sound engineer when I was young and installed the sound systems in many Hard Rock Cafes, including the ones in Australia!

Despite the steep prices I figured this would be a good bet for dinner on Pier 39.  The service was great as other reviewers mentioned, and the prices were expected given the location.  It was also a fun opportunity to teach my kids a bit about rock history..we had fun walking around and checking out the memorabilia of course.

Minus two stars though for my veggie burger.  The patty tasted like nothingness. I'm surprised that they wouldn't just slap a Boca or Garden Burger patty on there and call it a day. I bet in SF there's lots of people ordering the veggie burger too..
author: Adrianna G.

description: Went here for a team outing. Decent bloody marys. I'm not sure what else to say. If you want to feel like a tourist for a day, come here. Ample seating and in the heart of Pier 39. Can't miss it. Huge guitar out in front. Walk thru the door to see the restaurant.
author: Jamie C.

description: Over priced. We had burgers and chicken wings, i wouldn't say it's the best food, nothing special about it, its ok, but i would expect more for the pricing of the food.
author: David B.

description: Very cool vibe.  Wooden, brightly lit interior with Greatful Dead bears on the ceiling, music paraphernalia decorating the walls, and classic rock songs with their music videos playing in the background.  The bar is comfy with backrests on the stools, ample seating, and football in HD.  I would recommend watching any kind of sports game here, versus anywhere else on Fisherman's Wharf.
author: Elise G.

description: Pricey food, and super loud inside. Good food overall..but then again my whole plate of food was deep fried, so you can't really mess up on that. But the taquitos were horrible.
author: Raven B.

description:
Very loud, but that is what this place is so no complaints here. 
Drinks were made very well. 
Food was decent but I didn't expect a lot here. 
Waiter was very good but shift change gave us a waitress that was less than stellar. Didn't care for that at all.
author: Randall O.

description:
Went here today with the boyfriend. We did not get the time to check out the walls but I saw a Nirvana and a Journey guitar which obviously made me very happy. The music was good, but then again, it IS the hard rock cafe. The atmosphere in general was nice too. The manager is a little weird... we were doing OK and our server was doing a good job and SUDDENLY out of nowhere the manager came from behind my boyfriend, held his shoulder and gave the creepiest time asking us if we're doing OK. I appreciate the gesture but next time perhaps he should not try to sneak up like that or get touchy feely. 

The prices were outrageous... $15 for a burger?? We spent $60 on 2 drinks and a burger each. Not cool. But then again, we WERE at the Embarcadero where everything is ridiculously priced.
author: Shafinaaz K.

description: I am a vegetarian and I didn't have many options here, but Jackie made it possible for me to be pleasantly surprised! I asked her if she could replace the chicken in my salad with a side of rice instead and she did it without any hesitation. She was also very genuine and seemed very happy to have been our waitress! I am very satisfied and would most certainly come back again and/or refer my friends here!
author: Cesar C.

description:
I don't know why I expected more, but for some reason I did.  I guess it's because the last time I went here I was much younger and was happy with pretty much any menu that served burger and fries.

Well, the burger and fries were still there, but the magic has somehow faded.  The service was really bad, and the waitress was really rude.  The food seems to be more and more expensive every day, and the food seems to be getting worse.  The portions are just as large and greasy, but somehow that has lost its charm.  I guess it's good for kids, but if you're in San Francisco, there is just too much other good food to be stopping in here.
author: Denis S.

description: I was so disappointed with this HardRock. Went with the hubby and my 2 teenage sons. I ordered a steak Well done. First the whole order took almost an hour, but when I got my steak it was raw. Hello pretty sure I said well done. Reluctant I sent it back. I could not even attempt to eat it, bloody and cold. Waiting waiting waiting meanwhile my family has finished their entire meal. They even ate slow but what let their food get cold. 35 minutes later I received my steak. Really!!! I was so po"d at this point I asked for a box. The manager came and gave lip service. Worst ever. We have been to many HardRocks all over Hawaii, LA, S Dakota etc. Never have I had a bad experience.
author: Lori H.

description:
I have never in my life had any desire to eat at a Hard Rock Cafe.  My image was that It's the kind of faux-trendy, noisy, overpriced place I hate.

But the day was GORGEOUS, we were hungry, and my friends wanted  to eat here.  

Although the patio was 2/3 empty, we still had to put our names on a list and wait--god knows for what.   The staff seemed pretty disorganized despite Borg-like ear implants so the members of the hive could signal each other.   In fact, the inside was a LOT like a hive--dark, crowded, humming with the noise of harried worker bees servicing  the gaping maws of tourists.  Gave me the shivers.

As for our own gaping maws, 5-10 minutes later we were sunning ourselves and giving orders to the waitress.   The hamburgers are a ridiculous $15!!!  But then my friends produced their secret weapons: two-for-one hamburger coupons.  

And you know what?  HRC serves a pretty damn fine tasty burger--excellent beef, perfectly grilled.   A good value for $7.50.   Because a $15 hamburger is a sin against nature.  

Naturally we tipped the waitress 18% on the PRE-COUPON price (because tipping on the post-coupon price is a slimy thing to do). 

So come on a nice day, eat on the patio, bring a coupon.  And you'll have a good time!!
author: Lola K.

description:
Went to Hard Rock after the giants game opener this last Tuesday 4-8.  The food was fantastic.  I was pleased with the cowboy ribeye that actual came cooked the way I wanted and was the best steak I had sense the 555 in long beach and the brochette appetizer is so good we were going to order extra to take home.  

The people were very nice with good service, the manager spent time with us after the meal and informed me next time to get the wings as he feels we would start just driving to the city for chicken wings.  I promise next round the wings will be sampled and consumed.  Great place will be going back.  I highly reccomend.
author: Larry S.

description: I like to pop into this store every so often to look at their merchandise.  I hardly see anyone wear their t-shirts anymore.  Their pins are kind of fun to look at as I'm sort of a pinhead.  Hubby says it's all junk.  They have a large frame full of snake pins for the Year of the Snake, located behind the counter.  There are snake pins from all over the place.  Kind of cool to look at to see all these different colored snakes from different cities.  Hssssssssh....
author: Ry T.

description: The food was good, the drinks too and the waitresses were really nice. But the restaurant were far from crowded and we had to wait 20 min for a table for some reason, which just seemed strange.
author: Lynn C.

description:
I hold a huge grudge against this place. Worked there for a summer, made a shit-ton of cash in two and a half months at the expense of losing five years of my life to stress. 

I have been working in the restaurant business for most of college and never had i experienced such a work-place. The Hard Rock is a mega-chain, and they treat their employees AND customers as expendable assets rather than valued individuals.

I am a slight foodee and i have a unique opportunity distributing food to customers. If i love the food, its easier to sell, and to recommend quality items. I had a bit of a tough time here. The food is fake, bland, and over portioned. The burgers however, are quite good, if you can fork out 15 bucks for 6 ounces of fury.

Turn down the music also, few clients in that place speak english so taking their order is hard enough. No parking for employees of the Pier either. Its either a 1 1/2 hour muni ride, or 18 bones a day for parking. Thank goodness i was making over 150 dollars a day.

I hate to bash the place so much, because i did enjoy the management, and my co-workers. Although the run an air-tight ship, they are pretty friendly. I don't mean to contradict myself when i made the comment about feeling expendable, but the managers have people to answer to which i understand. I just wish the share-holders focused a bit more on customer service, and a bit less on being money hungry.

well, looks like i just wrote a review based on corporate not this hard rock itself.
author: Peter T.

description: This was by far the worst lunch I've had in a very long time. We went here for a birthday lunch with 6 people. First we ordered 3 burgers all over cooked and tasted like burnt charcoal. No birthday cake or singing happy birthday or even a happy birthday to the birthday boy.......I was going to let it go but then we asked for our bill. After 10 minutes of waiting we asked again. After about 15 more minutes and nobody paying attention to us no drink refills no clearing dirty plates. We finally tracked down someone who had to write a new bill to charge us. I went up to the hostess station asked to speak to the manager. A very rude woman said "what's the issue?" I said first of all our food was horrible and no birthday wish which in my eyes is very rude......-and it's taken almost 30 minutes to get our bill. Lady said to me very rude "that's all?" "I don't get the reason for you to complaints" Finally a manager came out and was very nice and understanding but was to late. We payed a $160 dollar bill, she did give us $50 in gift cards for the next visit. Sad to say id never go back to this place even if it was the last restaurant on the planet earth!!!
author: Robert N.

description: Great drinks, kind servers, groovy atmosphere and unabashed comfort food. What a great way to chillax after a hectic day in tourist hell.
author: Tim R.

description:
Now, I didn't eat here but my group was waiting for a few friends and had time to kill. Decided to come in here for an adult drink.  Meh...

The three of us ordered a cocktail each.  Walked around and checked out a bunch of crap on the walls from dinosaur bands I could care less about.  Meh.  

Cocktails came out after a bit of a wait.  My Beam and coke was pretty watery and lacked any sort of authority on the amount of alcohol in it.  Meh.

It seems to me that the Hard Rock Cafe has turned more corporate than the rock and roll world itself.  Sure, it is nice to walk around and see relics like Eric Clapton's pubic hair or a used condom from Haulin' Oats or whatever was on the wall, but it seemed to lack any sort of energy I would expect for "hard rock".  Meh.

Got the bill for our three drinks.  Should have bought a bottle and drank it in the parking lot.  Meh...JESUS, how much?!?!?! 

Had to use the bathroom and someone pissed all over the roll of toilet paper.  Normally I would laugh at this sort of adolescent behavior but not when I need to wipe my ass.  Time to cash out the bill and go elsewhere.
author: Jim S.

description: Like all Hard Rock's, this one was right on par with classic American bar food. A little pricier because of the location, but it will satiate the craving for a decent burger. I must say though that the food I ordered came out rather salty - maybe it was just the surrounding bay air adding its own touch, which knocks it down to three stars. Average food, average service, average rating.
author: Kazia N.

description:
This place is pretty sweet. If you're a fan of Hard Rock then u have no choice but to come here. Its the same as any Hard Rock in the world.  Same ol' menu. Believe me, Ive been to 4 in Japan,  2 in Florida, New York, Singapore, Thailand, Hong kong.
 Sweet service, makes u want to tip them $$. They have specials and other discounts so ask for them. After youre done eating go ahead n get your shirt and other souvenir. If its taking forever for your food to come just ask dont be a dick about it. Good food takes time.
author: Jon M.

description: Great ambiance !!! Great burgers !!! Good appys !!!!
author: Frank E.

description: Tonight most of the restaurants at Pier 39 were offering 50% off for locals and we took advantage. We ordered the nachos with chicken, strawberry lemonade, and Swiss burger.  The nachos had adequate toppings, enough cheese, chicken, etc.  the burger was good enough, but overall if I was paying regular price, I don't think I would enjoy that much.  But it is the Wharf.  The service was good with the server efficient, pleasant, and was also helping a trainee.  She even got us doggie bags without us even asking which we appreciated.
author: Bobby R.

description: Horrible. It was my first time at a Hard Rock Cafe. Me and a girlfriend ordered chicken. When it was served to us we noticed it was undercooked and pink! My boyfriend ordered a simple fish &chips and the center of his fish was cold (undercooked). We were a group of 5. Three out of 5 of us had to return our food for fully cooked food. There goes eating as a group! Our chicken came back dry. The fish and chips came back looking like it was double fried and to our surprise .. the fish was still cold in the center! Our server was nice and sweet and all .. but everyone seemed lost. We had other servers coming to our table giving us other customers orders. The manager was nice enough to give my group a discount and we also didn't pay for the fish and chips. Our dinner experience was horrible. Bad first experience. I'll never set foot in there!
author: Christal G.

description: Typical Hard Rock, neat memorabilia, cold brews and good tunes. However my $15 dollar hamburger sucked. It was dry, flavorless and all around uninspiring. I understand the up on the price is probably due to it being located in a huge tourist trap, and trust me, it was my mistake. I certainly wouldn't go back, nor would I recommend it. Our food was subpar at best and our service wasn't much to sing about either. We came in during a time when it was dead and saw our waitress 3 times. She took our drink order, took our food order, and gave us our check. Hopefully they share tips because the buss boy did more work than our server.  My tip is to find somewhere local and dig in. Stay away from chains in big cities, they are 9/10 not worth it.
author: Nicki J.

description: Horrible Horrible experience. I even created a yelp account to tell you so! Staff was amazing, but the food was downright horrible
author: Jenna L.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to the city yesterday.  After taking the ferry to Alcatraz, we were starving and we didn't have any energy to walk around to look for a good restaurant.  We decided to eat at Hard Rock because it was convenient, but I didn't have very high expectations.  

Well, I don't know if it was because I was super hungry, but my food was pretty good.  I ordered the pulled bbq pork sandwich, which had a very generous amount of meat, and it also came with beans and cole slaw.  I could barely finish my plate.  My boyfriend had the bbq burger (came with bacon and the works), and he enjoyed it.

Negatives: definitely a touristy place, but I think it's fun.  Prices are kinda high--about $15 for a burger.  Service was okay, but our waitress wasn't very excited to serve us.
author: Patti F.

description: Visited the Hard Rock today to celebrate two birthdays.  We knew it was a touristy place, but had been there before and although pretty pricey, the was food was good and atmosphere fun.  Today's experience was terrible.  Our waitress was a complete idiot.  She took three of our four orders and started to walk away.  I said, "and I will have the club sandwich". Some time later (and they were not busy) three of the meals arrived.  There were only 3 instead of 5 chicken strips on a plate, telling us she dropped 2 on the floor and will bring 2 more.  OK, accidents happen.  She then apologized that my meal was not ready and asked me to refresh her memory on what I ordered.  I told her the club sandwich.  At that point I knew that my sandwich was not turned in with the others; that it was not even written down.  The others were half way through their meals when my lunch arrived.  The bacon on my sandwich was RAW - not limp and greasy, not undercooked - it was RAW!  At that point and knowing how long it takes the kitchen I just sent it back, saying that I didn't want it or anything else.  The manager did come over and it was taken off the bill.  The restaurant was probably 1/4 full, but we were there for two hours because of the slow waitress and slow kitchen.  Too many restaurants in that area - Pier 39 - to ever go back or recommend it to anyone.  I am sure they do not depend on anyone returning.
author: Donna K.

description:
Me and my friend each got our own Legendary Burgers. 
Let me just say right now, that I never thought onion rings would be so perfect in any burger. The dim lighting and rock and roll decor feels very comfortable and spurs nothing but conversation. The servings are huge. The burger was insane, I felt confident I could finish it, although intimidating. I couldn't do it. You will definitely fill yourself up here. 
Given there are a lot of more places that give off the "pier/fisherman's wharf" feel, but living in SF I wanted to try something new. I'm glad I came here, the waitress was very nice and checked up on us often. It's usually full but the wait is very short. 
Being in a casual American restaurant with Jet playing in the background just felt amazing, relaxing, and fun. 
It's great to come with a large group or even just two people. 
The food is well cooked, not too greasy and extremely filling. The price is average, not too pricey given the other touristy restaurants in area.
Would definitely recommend coming here and trying it out!
author: Veronica L.

description: On a nice Thursday night, no wait during prime dining hours. Place was almost empty. Staff was nice enough, but the food was not. Caesar salad was okay, nachos were not! I think they use processed cheese! And very $$$ for what it was to boot. I think they are way past their glory days when people collected the T-shirts. Also too loud inside!
author: Green H.

description:
A friend of my wife asked us to meet her there for drinks.  Since I had a disappointing meal earlier, I ordered supposed "Texas" BBQ sandwich.  

The noise level was far too annoying, although the retro decor was mildly interesting. The wait staff consists of some older women who really should acknowledge that their short skirts are just not appropriate any longer.  Our service was attentive, however....

My "Texas" BBQ was all wrong.  Bear in mind that I was hungry and just about anything would have seemed appealing, but this sandwich was disappointing.  First, it was pork, not beef, which would have been the preferred meat in Texas.  Second, the sauce, which often makes or breaks a BBQ dish, seemed worse than Kraft barbecue sauce out of a bottle.  Third, the taste, even with jalapeno was not spicy at all.  As a Texas transplant, I guess I should have known not to order a Lone Star specialty in California.....

Overall:  Just avoid this place.  It has little to offer even casual diners.....
author: Ron C.

description:
OK... so i needed to validate parking and ths was one of the many restaurants that did it... I had never been here so me and my in laws decided to check it out... we walked in and were taken to coner table with people packed all around us... I had a toddler goinfg through hs terrible twos... not a good idea... well anyways our waitress came and took our drink order we had picked our food already so we ordered that as well. 

 Our order came out pretty fast (reason for two stars). The burger and frys were meh.... ok.... Ive had MUCH better at other places. I am the type of person whotakes a drink with every bite... I have to or ealse i feel i a choking on my food... well halfway through my burger i ran out of soda as did my sis in law... we looked around and no sign of the waitress.... 5 mins nohing... burger got cold..... well a buss boy passed by so we asked him... 2 mins later the waitress came back so we asked her for a refill which she did .... but the food was already cold therefore not enjoyed.

 3 burgers 3 sodas $55 .SLow service mediocre sp? quality ..... NOT WORTH IT. I really wanted to like this place and expected ALOT better food and service (ESP ON A WED NIGHT). Just goes to show you cant judge a book by it cover.
author: Ivette A.

description: This place really isn't any worse or better than any other Hard Rock I've been to. My biggest complaint about this place though is it seems that since we didn't order much (2 drinks and appetizer) that our server couldn't be bothered with us.
author: Liz D.

description: Prices are very high, but that's not surprising given the location. Service and food were fine.
author: Shawn P.

description: I've always come here and for quite a while. Never written a review until now. Always come to the bar and the bartenders know me by name and knows my "poison". That's the scary part. I know that the food are on the high side. When I do eat here, make sure that I use my $5 survey coupons and save me a little bit of money. Also I track my receipts with my VIP Rewards card and earn points for a $15 coupon. Will I come back here? Sure I would, to pick my poison!!
author: Larry F.

description:
Hard Rock Cafe is my wife's favorite place, so we used to eat there often. Now I've changed my diet and because of my healthy eating habits and food allergies, I can no longer eat at Hard Rock. They have very little on their menu that is in my calorie range (650 for dinner) and they don't seem too comfortable with modifying dishes.

I guess you need to be a fan of loud noise, lots of tourists and of course pricey food. It's not for everyone.
author: Kristin O.

description: Meh. Wasn't impressed at all. I got the nachos - had barely any cheese or any of the other toppings listed. Literally 1/8 of the chips had a teeny amount of cheese on them - and probably 1/4 of the chips were burned. My hubs got the pulled pork sandwich. He said it was the most bland pulled pork he'd ever had and the cole slaw that came with it tasted like it was just cabbage.  The server did a mediocre job, and really for spending $40 for the two of us to eat a meal of this quality was super disappointing. I've had better nachos at a gas station.  Bummed -- thought it would be much better for the wait time & price.
author: Krystle S.

description:
Super disappointing, especially since our company party is usually held at the Carnelian Room.  Don't get me wrong, the food is 100% nothing special at the Carnelian Room, but both the view and DECENT food beats the Hard Rock Cafe by a landslide.  

The luncheon started around noon and we were out of there by 3pm.  The appetizers consisted of potato skins, which were way too greasy, friend spring rolls which were kind of cold, and a couple of other items that I did not try.  

We had the option of choosing between salmon, risotto, or a steak.  I heard the steak was decent and the girl sitting next to me described the risotto as "glue on a plate."  I did try the risotto and it was 100% nasty.  My salmon was way overcooked as I had to use a knife to cut into it.  The mashed potatoes and broccoli that accompanied it were cold.  I didn't touch the potatoes, but ate the broccoli anyway.  

The open bar and friendly staff are the only reason HRC gets 2 stars instead of one...Although I will say thank God they had champagne as the chardonnay being served was super gross.
author: Jenny W.

description:
I found a long hair in my sandwich. Enough said.

the 2-star is for the nice server. The host was mean.

Remember to validate parking before you leave, or they'll make you chase down your server to vouch for you(without receipt).
author: Eric C.

description:
A friend and I went here recently for a late night dessert of Hot Fudge Brownie Sundaes. While the Sundae was pretty good, we both were not served equal portions. My friend's sundae (a male) had very little fudge and whipped cream on his, while my sundae was piled high and over flowing with ooey, gooey fudge and creamy-licious whipped cream. I'm not complaining per say, just feel the dishes should be served the same.

The ambience is cool. If you are into rock and rock memorabilia, great place to go and hang out. 

Our waitress was nice (after all, she loaded me up with fudge) she was a bit disheveld looking and her breath smelled, as my friend quoted, " like she ate a tuna sandwich named Jill for lunch" if ya know what I mean. 

Overall, it was cool. I'd like to go there again sometime and try out the food and have one of their alcoholic drink specials.
author: April C.

description:
I came in at about 945 when most restaurants would have said they're closed. They let us get two entrees and gave us the appetizer free when we mentioned the yelp offer. They also did not bat an eye or give us any special time of day limited time offer BS on trying to get any free appetizer or dessert we wanted. Its really free. Any one you want. I got the chicken tenders. High class chicken tenders alright. Thats for sure.

 Expecting to be rushed out, they stayed open until after  1130 and even served all the new people who came in after us.. DRINKS AND FOOD!! Not to mention, both of those were great. The food was awesome and even with a big appetite, I'm a big eater, I thought I was full halfway through the 10 oz texan.. I finished it though and enjoyed every second of it.  I also enjoyed it with my corona, that the house comp'd me for no reason.. assuming someone  ordered it by accident and I was the lucky one, or she made it happen bc of the yelp coupon I used. Idk. but anyway, use the coupon! Gives you more to spend on booze, which I did buy more of with the money I saved on the appetizer. Seems like they want you to use the coupon too. They didnt mind at all when I asked for it for free. Usually in the city, thats a huge deal. FREE. 
The manager and bartender were very patient accomodating and cool. It was a great first experience at the hard rock san Francisco. Thanks to the people.

Thank you!!
author: Michael L.

description: Whenever Im out of town I tend to go to different places but Hard Rock is that one place I go if I find it. As always the food was good and the people were great. My only problem was they were a little under staffed for lunch so everything took some time to get to me and my family.
author: Kevin C.

description: Your a little bit country, I'm a little bit Rock n Roll!!!! Great place,lots of memorabilia and good food and drink!!!!
author: Rich F.

description:
The hostess who greeted us was polite, but seemed indifferent towards us.
We waited for 20 minutes with no service.  Plenty of waiters noticed us, but did not help us.  There were only about 9 tables in the restaurant, and I saw at least 4 different waiters.
My boyfriend was already starving, so we left.  The hostess didn't seem to care that we had not received any service.
This was my first time going to this Hard Rock Cafe, and I will not try it again.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Warning you need to come in to the hard rock cafe store with shoulder pads, there was all lot of people, when I went in on this past friday 8/20, don't know if its always like that since I'm not a local.

However the staff was real cool they wouldn't sell me a bucket that they used for drumsticks that was a part of a drum set, but I wasn't really going to buy it anyway. :)

The server was real cool, fast, friendly, fabulous service. Definetly a repeat visit place.
author: Kevin S.

description: The GM Steve came to talk and shoot the shit everyone is nice love it!! He was very nice the only thing I noticed is I didnt get a buzz from my drink.... I think they forgot the Vodka
author: Melissa N.

description:
The atmosphere is just like any other Hard Rock so it wasn't a surprise, but it was nice.

The prices are probably just too high but that is what you get when you go to such a well known place in a touristy area.

I will say that the waiter was great! Really made for a good experience  He had a good personality and was very attentive. We got burgers, one of the cheaper things on the menu at 15 even for all of them. They were rather good. Maybe not the absolutely best burgers I've ever had they were juicy, big and generally yummy. 

This isn't somewhere that I'd go often but it is nice to hit up maybe once of twice a year.
author: May W.

description: Once you've been to one Hard Rock Cafe, you've seen them all. Didn't do the restaurant this time, just the store. There were only a couple of us shopping at the time so I got special attention that I could have lived with out. They have all the sizes readily available.No worries there. They even had several places with clearanced items. I walked out with 3 shirts for about 65.00!!
author: Sylvia F.

description: Gag! I was so excited to finally eat the Hard Rock Cafe...it was disgusting and overpriced! We liked our appetizer sampler platter more than our entrees! I will not be coming back, this is one of those hyped up disgusting joints like Rainforest Cafe! Nice decor, expensive prices, and disgusting food.
author: Thanh N.

description:
I've never been into a hard rock before. This was an alright experience for a first time.
