I was amazed at how small the place seemed. The circular room has memorabilia full up on every wall. Looking at all of the stuff aims the music videos on the flat screens was cool I guess

The food here is alright. But my burger was definitely not worth the 15 bucks. I've had much better for less. You're paying for the ambiance. 

Like any other hard rock establishment, there's sweet gear to be had. They still sell logo zippo lighters here. Not all places do anymore...like Stockholm, Sweden. Having that item was a plus for a zippo collector like myself.
author: Marty S.

description: Expensive and poor quality food. My son's $15.50 burger was rare - (bloody in middle) so sent it back. When they brought is back - it was cooked through but blood was on his plate and fries. He ended up throwing up over it. We got his dish paid for of course, but i ordered fajitas. Were delicious but maybe 4-6 oz of chicken tops - $21 which I thought was high for the amount of chicken.The kids meals were $7.50 each and were very generous in portion sizes, however. Loved the atmosphere and that is why we ate there - waitress was slow. Sat for 18 minutes with empty drinks and had to wait 10 minutes to tell her about the raw burger. So 2 stars for the Hard Rock Cafe.
author: mary a.

description: My French fries were slightly above room temperature. The metal cup they put my French fries in was half full (paper was used to create a false bottom). I ordered my burger with a little pink in it but it came out WELL DONE. I only patronized this place so that my parking could be validated. The collection of Rock N Roll history greatly exceeds the quality of food and service. I would not recommend this place to anyone expecting to get a good $16 burger.
author: Rashad J.

description: Too loud! Can't carry on a conversation. Would not bring small kids. But what would one expect. It's the Hard Rock Cafe. Suppose to be loud.
author: Serge S.

description: Hostesses are very friendly...server? Not so much. Her name is Haleigh and she's extremely rude. She practically rolled her eyes at us when we sat down and ordered coffee. Really? Because at 3.50 for each of the group of us, I think we're off to a decent start. I didn't sit down and order water and a $15 appetizer lady. Another near-eye roll when we asked for more cream for the coffee. And yet, another snicker when we asked for our bill (after eating). Not ONCE did she stop by to refill our coffee or ask if we needed anything. That's = the times she smiled. Boooooo to you lady. I bring you my family and you treat them like ish? I don't think so. Even the meager tip I gave her was too much. And yes, I did tip. Poor girl needs $ to buy her happy pills.
author: Cindy D.

description: Cool environment. Good food. think a more expensive red robin, but cooler.
author: Danny M.

description: I love this place for the atmosphere. The prices aren't bad and the food is pretty tasty. The location is pretty awesome too. The server we had was really friendly but some of the other employees seemed a little rude...whatever though...our guy was on point. Anyhow I would come back for sure. Rock on Hard Rock.
author: Ashley W.

description: We came here for lunch so hungry after traveling all morning. We had about a 45 min. weight which is really no big deal because we were able walk around the pier until the buzzer went off. This was a great because our hungry kids stayed entertained until it was time to be seated. My husband and I ordered bloody mary's which were made Perfectly!!! we shared the pulled chicken sandwich with onion rings, which was plenty of food for the 2 of us and very tasty. The kids ordered off the children's menu and were very happy with their selections of BBQ chicken drumsticks and chicken tenders. Fast friendly service and good food! Overall this was a great place to eat with the kids!
author: Jennifer F.

description: Fun location but not my fave out of all the Hard Rocks. The parking in San Francisco sucks big time! Really one of the worst cities to try to find a parking spot.
author: Alden C.

description: Unfortunately this was our worst dining experience ever. Horrible customer service. Took 1 hour to receive food an drinks. Debated getting up and leaving several times. Bill was wrong 3 times with no accommodations for our patience. You couldn't pay me to eat here again. Please don't waste your time like we did. There are plenty of other great options near pier 39!
author: Richard H.

description:
"Meh"
Appetizers are of the same quality as Jersey's Blue Chip, but three times the price. Drinks are overpriced (but in a trendy I-could-have-told-you-that sort of way). There is a two-drink maximum and I think that's fair since that is about the same price as four drinks at any other decent eatery.
You pay for the ambiance, service and novelty of dining at a Hard Rock Cafe. 
It was a quick decision that satisfied the whole group, but it's not an experience I'll willingly repeat.
author: Candice T.

description:
In the close to 14 years I've been living in San Francisco, this is only my third time eating at the Hard Rock Cafe. 
The first two times were good, though, as many have criticized already, there is a bit of sticker shock on the food and drink prices in the menu. 
If they try to say that the customer is also paying for the atmosphere like Planet Hollywood claimed, Hard Rock might suffer the same defeat as the Planet Hollywood and (soon) Hooters in San Francisco did/will. 
I went this time because the Hard Rock had a 40th Birthday promotion where you get a burger, fries, and a pepsi/coke for $4.00. 
This deal is available on their website and good only until the 21st if you want to take advantage of it. 
I first got a Christmas pin for my Hard Rock Christmas collection from the gift shop.  Valerie was very cool and very informative. 
I then went to the dining area to get seated.  My waitress was Collette: friendly, very cute, and perky (but not to the point of making you want to puke).  I showed her the ad/coupon I received and printed.  She knew about it and said it wasn't limited to one type of burger, but to any burger in the menu.  I chose the mushroom swiss burger.  I kept myself busy watching the Lions/Raiders game while waiting for the food.  The wait wasn't bad.. only about 15 minutes, I think. 
A young Carlos Santana-looking server brought the order to me. 
The burger was REALLY good.  Okay, honestly, I wouldn't say it was $15 good if I paid full price for it, but it was still good.  The fries were cooked just right without the over-abuse of a salt shaker.  And the Pepsi.. was a Pepsi. 
Collette approached a few times during my meal, quite politely each time, informing me of their 'Imagine' gift line and asking the usual  food okay?/need anything? walk-bys. 
The total on the promo meal was $4.34 and I left a $5.00 tip.  Hey, it's Christmas time and Collette was very cool.  That plus restaurants usually want you to tip according to the regular price, anyway. 
Like I said, the food and drinks are good only if you don't mind splurging or got a deal like I did.
author: Paul V.

description:
Way over-priced, un-enthusiastic, chain restaurant food.  

I was doing the "touristy" thing with the family. We had just finished walking through the Aquarium of the Bay and decided on burgers and fries downstairs. I figured HRC would be simliar to TGIF or Chili's. *BUZZ!!* wrong answer.

The prices were much more steep than I would have thought. A Cheese burger was$14.00. An entree was between 20-24 dollars. Are you effin' kidding me.  You can get entrees for that price at 4 star restaurants. I got nachos for $11.95 and an added side of chicken was $4.50. I had about 14 cubes of chicken, which came out to be about .30 cents per cube of chicken, and the nachos weren't even all that good. 

On top of the food and prices, we had to wait forever to get our entrees, and when they finally did arrive they were cold. My father-in-law almost went postal after receiving his club sandwich slathered with mayonnaise, after asking for NO mayo. The waiter kindly asked if he wanted the kitchen to make another sandwich, but he was so hungry, he ended up eating it.

The saving grace, if there really is one, are the drinks. Free refills of bloody mary for $13.99 + you can take the souvenir glass home. If I wasn't the D.D. for the day, oh my, I would have left HRC ten times happier.
author: Robin K.

description: I was in town with my kids visiting Pier 39 and needed a lunch spot that would accommodate my  four year old son's allergies (dairy, fish, nuts, eggs). It's extremely hard to travel and trust that kitchens will take care of my son's food as I would at home! Brent (Assistant General Manager) and his team did a fabulous job! Plus, I ordered the turkey burger for myself and it was delicous! I must admit, chain restaurants have their place (not very high on my list). However, our experience at The Hard Rock Cafe in San Francisco was probably one of the best meals/restaurants on our entire trip.
author: Estee G.

description: We came in for a drink after dinner and caught the last bit of a battle of the bands performance.  There seemed to be several local bands in the crowd and their entourages.  Service was a bit slow since the bar staff was pretty preoccupied with keeping everyone's drinks full, so I only stuck around for one beer.  The beer selection wasn't really what I was looking for, although I was still pretty full from dinner so it may have been a result of my mood.
author: Shannon H.

description:
I could write a huge rant about how bad my experience was here. But, I'll keep it short. 
This place is overpriced and the service was absolutely horrible!! From the hostess, to the bartender, to the multiple servers we had. The food and music are the only thing that won this review an extra star. Bottom line......DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!! There are way too many excellent places to eat in this city.
author: Seth D.

description: Best Hard Rock Cafe food I've ever had.
author: Mike S.

description: I am a HRC fan. Everywhere I go I look for a HRC. this location was no more special than the rest, but it still stands out from other restaurants nearby! There was a bit of a wait for groups but since there was only two of us we went straight to a table. The hostess was extremely friendly, as was the waitress. I ordered the mac chicken and cheese and my brother ordered a salmon plate. The food came out quicker than expected and was hot and fresh! We both scarfed out food down and picked up our souvenir glass on the way out the door. Every other location I've been to you keep the glass you drank out of. This location you pick up a brand new glass from the souvenir shop.
author: Kevin S.

description: Not the biggest fan of chain restaurants, but went to the Hardrock at pier 39 a few weeks ago and the apple crisp with ice cream was delicious! The chocolate mousse was surprisingly good too. +2 stars for that. We had Zack as our server - he was great! Super funny, entertaining and not bad on the eyes... +2 more stars for the great service! I would eat here again more for the experience than the food.
author: Alexandra M.

description:
ok so this is the FIRST time to this location. We decided to go on Saturday Feb 13th and just kinda do something different. It was our first nice dinner out  together in a long time and we both had cravings for hard rock. 

Well we knew it was going to be crazy th eday before valentines and were told an hour wait. No problem just they dont have a speaker system to announce names. In fact the girl was kinda not doing much of her job. When we went back after half an hour to check the list because it seemed like barely anyone was waiting she said shed take us next since no one else was waiting. REALLY??? ok... so we didnt have to wait an hour, but still... its just weird for a big name place like this to not have pagers or what not. 

We got seated and our server was taking over for someones lunch hour. I forgot his name but he did an AMAZING job. Got our drinks and food right away and perfect. We were half way done when we met our actual waitress who introduced herself. Next thing you know servers are connecting tables together RIGHT NEXT TO US! the manager said he would take half off our bill if we moved over....of course we moved over...

WELL the BIG group was seated, they got drinks, they were ordering food.... 30 to 40 minutes went by and our waitress forgot us! in fact the manager saw us kinda just sitting there AFTER the lady who was seating people heard my boyfriend ask for the check looked at him and just walked right back to the front and did NOT say anything about us to anyone....so the manager picked up our stuff and then here comes our waitress saying "IM SORRY I FORGOT ABOUT YOU GUYS" and hands us the bill and we notice the manager took off only 5%!  so the waitress noticed and finally came back with 50% taken off.

So an hour AFTER we had eaten we finally gotten out of the place! after being forgotten, dealing with miscumminications between two managers about the 50% and the weird service from the hostess!
author: Eli M.

description:
LOL...still love to see all the snobs on this board that dis the Hard Rock...especially people who say the music is too loud.

Hilarious...get a life.
author: David S.

description: All right i"ve been living in SF all my life and today was my 1st time coming here for my and sisters birthday! the hostess was nice we got seated quick since there was no one there. The waitress was awesome! she was very helpful and very attentive. The food was good i had the BBQ bacon cheeseburger, but kind of pricy. overall had a good time the atmosphere was really nice tons of great rock memorabilia to look at not to mention the plasma's playing rock videos :)
author: Luis M.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU ARE GOING FOR DINNER BEFORE AN EVENT WITH A BIG GROUP.
Last night was my school's prom in the city, so our group (of 14) decided to eat somewhere fun, so we made reservations at the Hard Rock. It was easy enough to make the reservations online; everything was fine. They had a section to write notes or comments, like needing separate checks. We made the reservations at least 3 weeks ahead. We got there when it was our reservation time (on a side note: it was funny seeing all the tourists staring at us all dressed up). The hostess lady was not friendly when I approached her about my group arriving. She asked what the name was on the reservation in an snappy fashion, which we thought was quite odd, since you'd think a hostess would be a little more chipper. So she tells me to follow this guy to the table, but then he gave the menus to another lady without informing us, so I'm glad I was watching, because my group wasn't. So this new lady was nice, and directed us to the small round tables along the edge of the bar. Yes, the small round tables. Tables that could only sit 4 people each. We are a group of 14. Wouldn't you expect to be able to have everyone sit together at a long table? Apparently not here. If our party was too big to be accommodated as one group, we should have been called and alerted about this. They had other tables that would have been perfect to combine and accommodate our group. However, they said those tables were already reserved for other groups. Later, we saw another prom group sitting at those tables.
Everyone in my group was standing around looking at each other confused, like what the heck is going on... To make it worse, it was my duty to make the reservation, so everyone was looking at me, wondering why it was set up this way. They did not inform me ahead of time this would be the dinner set up. If we knew, we definitely wouldn't have made a reservation here. Plus, we could have eaten better food that's reasonably priced somewhere else. Why would we wanna isolate ourselves from each other? Granted, you wouldn't be able to talk to everyone at a long table, but having everyone sit together has a better vibe. Our server came, and he wasn't much nicer than the hostess. He wasn't friendly, and he was rude when he was explaining the different types of burgers. I asked about the sizing, there are 6 oz and 10 oz sizes, but I didn't know that. How am I supposed to picture the sizing in my head based off ounces? Since I had no idea really what size to get (I wasn't even hungry at this point since I was in such a bad mood) I asked him what he suggested, since usually waiters are nice and recommend things, but he just said bluntly with attitude, "Well, it depends on how hungry you are." K, thanks. Whatever. Also, one of my friends ordered a Shirley Temple, but it never arrived so she had to ask for it again.

He seemed stressed out. But come on, this is the Hard Rock on Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco. There are thousands of people coming and going. Our group didn't even ask for any odd food or drink requests. The only "complicated" thing was getting separate checks, but they had a good system down for that (each person of my group was a number on the receipt and we passed it along and paid the amount due.) I did not like that the tip was already calculated, since some of us agreed the service was mediocre at best.

But seriously, why would they separate our group? At least without notifying us ahead of time? I guess next time I plan to make a reservation here, I'll have to make a specific request, even though you shouldn't have to. But there won't be a next time for me so I won't have to worry for that.
Eating here started us off on the wrong foot, but thank god we all forgot about this place after we got to the dance.
I don't like writing bad reviews, but this dinner fiasco pissed me and everyone else off.
 Definitely never going here again.
author: Nick B.

description:
My little brother is in town for the first time. Poor baby! Not really a baby, he is 21. So many things 'American' to see, to taste, to buy... Of course, first place he wanted to visit was Hard Rock Café. Oh, so typical.

I had a bloody mary to blur my vision of the huge portions of French fries and giant burgers and corny atmosphere a little. It was not enough. In fact, this was the worst bloody mary I had in a long time.

Hard Rock Café merchandise is overrated as well. Come on, $30 for a T-Shirt? I understand, it's Hard Rock Café San Francisco, not Bismark, ND or Middle of Nowhere, U.S.A. But still! Unless you have a collection of them from all over the world, having one from San Francisco won't make a God damned difference. 

I just really hope that our next stop is not Hooter's.
author: Tatyana S.

description: Ehhhhhh...that is really all I have to say. The ambiance is awesome mostly because I am a huge classic rock guy and that is why they got two stars. The food is edible but nothing special whatsoever. For what you pay here you are way better off with so many other selections in SF. It is a reliable chain but you are not getting what you pay for at all.
author: Andrew M.

description:
I was here for a friend's birthday a few weeks ago, and let me just say, the food was what you'd expect from anywhere else. Not saying it as a bad thing. Just that it's not special, you know? Well, at the birthday, we were seated after 20 minutes. On a Sunday night. Yeah. Not Friday or Saturday. And it was 2 hours to closing. So it's not really extremely busy or packed. Yet we waited out butts in the store part of the place. The servers was nice, but he had to leave and was replaced by this younger girl (20-5 ish) who was a mite too-good-for-the-like-of-you attitude. Well, forget your tip missy.

Another time I went, was for yet another birthday (what is it with this place and birthdays? I have a few other suggestions!!). This time the server was this older lady (late 20s early 30s) and she was courteous and patient with my slightly smashed friends. Hey, half of them were drunk, the rest were sober, yet they still act pretty pissed. Dorks.

As I was saying, the waitress was great all in all. And it was 8/9 on a Saturday night, so pretty busy, yet we were seated in 10 minutes. And we were a BIG group (17 people). So, that's kudos. Love the music, atmosphere, and SOME of the servers. All in all, pretty okay.
author: C. H.

description: very over-rated, and over-priced. I ordered 1 appetizer, 2 cheeseburgers, 2 coronas, and 1 mojito. the bill was $82.03. add the tip and I just left a $100 bill.  the appetizer did not arrive as an appetizer, all the food came at the same time. my wife ordered her burger medium rare, and I ordered mine medium. hers was over cooked and mine was rare. it was almost funny! bottom line is that it was not worth the money. it did seem like a good place to have a couple drinks if you like a place so noisy that you can't talk to whoever you are with. I don't think that the food is worth trying again. not for the price anyways. we did enjoy all of the rock and roll stuff on the walls. and the wait staff was very nice. the food and the prices are the downfalls here.
author: John E.

description: This by far one of my best Hard Rock experiences yet.  While this isn't the newest and biggest Hard Rock the people made it the best.  We had great service all around...can't wait to go back.  Ian "aka Papa Smurf"...thanks for making our time there fantastic!
author: James Eric M.

description: Hard Rock Cafe is one of those places that are so well-themed for me, as I love music. There are actual instruments and pictures of famed artists on the walls for everyone to see. The food here is decent, but a tad expensive, which is expected. The service is good. Great memories here.
author: Shaheen A.

description:
My family was in town so I took them to pier 39.
Food wasn't great, but our server was absolutely delightful!  

Rachel (aka Boston) was very attentive and always smiling.
I would give 2 Stars for the food, but 5 stars for the phenomenal service!
author: Heather E.

description:
No respectable bar charges an uneven amount for a beer, or any drink for that matter. Screw you Hard Rock Cafe and your $6.15 Stella; your Budweiser in a shiny aluminum can and your utterly ridiculous location. 

One star for giving me the chance to say to a taxi driver for the first time ever "take me to Pier 39" I took a little bit of enjoyment in that one time opportunity.
author: Lauren B.

description: First time having a Legendary Burger--$15...a little expensive, but tasty.
author: Colin P.

description: Food came quick and the manager was really nice when we didn't like a drink we ordered. What we wish we knew before we paid for our meal....they give a military discount. The lady in the merchandise shop was the one to let us know
author: Sara R.

description:
To Hard Rock SF:

 I am writing about my visit last weekend to your cafe.  It has been years that i visited a Hard Rock, and I was very happy with my visit!! My server's name was Ivan.  He was very nice and helpful with suggesting drinks and food! The burger and salad that he suggested was delicious! He also went out of his way to show me some places on a map to take my wife around the city to celebrate our Anniversary!! I just wanted to take the time to thank Ivan for the Great Job and for his suggestions which made for a great Anniversary weekend!! I look forward to visiting in the future. 

Thank you,
  Johan
author: Johan V.

description: Food its typical chain resturant, but your mainly paying for the atmosphere when it comes to any hard rock cafe. Don't visit it if you looking for some food to keep you coming back.
author: Juice C.

description:
A-OK place for drinks. Could be better BUT could also be worse. Actually, I take that back... its finna fine as it is.

1. Place was empty on a Saturday night (probably because KFOG Ka-Boom! was also happening that night), so 35 of us decided to head on in and get hydrated before heading out to watch the fireworks. 

We promptly took over an entire section of the bar as tourists looked on and whispered "... must be tourists". Trick pleez!

2. Our drinks ordered included shots, white wine, red wine, margaritas and bloody Mary (yup! thas me), and the drinks were OK and contained the key ingredient one looks for in a drink... alcohol. When you've spent the last two hours getting sprayed by ocean water, having your hair blown like you were in a Boeing Wind Tunnel... any drink be fine!

3. The bar service and bartender were awesome - friendly, quick, funny, engaging and down right social (also, when he realized we were locals he could not have been happier). So happy that he gave us a free round!

4. The atmosphere here is.... umm different, if you're a local. It IS a touristy hangout, lots of families, couples, single kids from all over the US and the world... its the bloody UN served rock and roll style!

But that being said, not a bad place to just have drinks with friends and then head on out... key being "head on out".

5. Funniest moment of the night was when they started playing "YMCA" and 35 of us (gay, lesbian, str8, queer... you name it, we had it!) got up in a chorus and started singing and dancing the "YMCA". Jaws dropped, eyes widened, the bar staff and wait staff were laughing in splits and the little kids came running to dance with us!

... only in San FranFRISCO!!! Love ya!
author: Amit S.

description: Make sure Rachel is your bartender. Thats all you need to know.  Your drinks will be made to perfection
author: Emma H.

description: Typical puerile tourist trap but if you know that is what it is when your going in then it is no hard feelings fun.  The food sucks but the junk on the wall is kinda cool, nothing unique.  I highly recommend this place to someone who want to visit fisherman's wharf.
author: Kevin H.

description: You can't beat a burger at the Hard Rock Cafe at Pier 39 after a long flight over. Greasy, massive portions, that hit the spot when you're in the right mood. Great location too right on the end of the pier by the taxi rank. Fantastic service and good music.
author: benharper87

description:
People have been wondering where the fuck I've been the last few months. I could come up with a great story about how I quit my job and am now living the life of a world traveler. Or maybe that I won the lottery, left my crummy job, and am now a lady of leisure. 

The sad truth is that I've been doing little since I got laid off, got gypped out of a severance package, will never see any of the vacation pay that I EARNED, and now my 401k is frozen because my former company was run by a bunch of corrupt assholes. 

And you know what? None of that's really all that bad when compared to spending 4 hours at the Hard Rock Cafe, paying outrageous prices for crap food, being ignored by asshole servers who obviously didn't care if they earned a tip, and enduring groups after groups of screeching teens celebrating their 16th, 17th, or 18th birthdays.

In other words, this place sucks.

Merry effing Christmas all!
author: .elin f.

description:
I should be shot for being a local and even attempting to enter a tourist trap sensation like this one, but my best friend is obsessed with the Hard Rock Chain and convinced me to go for a drink and some snacks on Saturday.

We scored a pub table and a really friendly waiter who promptly informed us that he was going on break. Fine enough, he brought over a lady who was going to "take care of us" while he was gone.

We ordered the usual pub fare...nachos, rings...etc. I was having a rough day and asked the waitress for a Fernet with a ginger back (i.e. training wheels) and a pint of Stella. Normally I wouldn't order two drinks at once, but it seemed to be taking up to 15 minutes to get each drink order delivered so I thought I'd kill two birds with one stone. My co-diner ordered a large Anchor Steam and a diet coke.

Ten minutes later, she returned with one beer and set it in front of my friend. "Which one is this?" I asked her..."Umm, a Stella? No Anchor Steam? Umm I think its the Stella." What???

After a taste test session to figure it out, I ask her for the other drinks. She informs me they do not carry Fernet. How does any bar survive in SF without at least a small stash of the goods?? SF is one of the largest Fernet markets in the nation!! So I got over it and ordered a shot of Jack.

15 minutes later we got all the drinks right and promptly requested the check.

My message to the tourists...just stick to buying the T-shirt and heading elsewhere for food and drink.

Our first waiter was great though, wish I remembered his name!!
author: Lynsey C.

description:
Crappy over priced American food that's located right in the center of tourist hell.

They get the extra star for the music memorabilia.
author: Patrick B.

description:
I should have known better than to resort to a tourist trap at Pier 39.  But what can I say, I had my 3 year old nephew and the Rainforest Cafe terrified him...sooo, it was safe.

Got the burger, got the kid a hot dog - his bun was crusty and felt stale.  My burger tasted like the kind of burger you get in a cafeteria, or at one of those burger shacks at an amuzement park?  You know the kind - frozen, overcooked, flavorless.  My portion of fries was about equavalent to that of my nephews kids meal - ridiculous.

His hot dog was cold - and rubbery.  Not bad for $7.50 - wtf?? $7.50 for a kids hot dog and fries?  My burger was $13.50 - now, before you jump on me with, "Thats what you get - its Pier 39 bla bla" - all I have to say is this...

Its a tourist trap, I get it.  You can get away with charging more for a GD burger and fries - but stand behind your food.  Would it kill you to put out a decent product?  

Charge more because you can get away with it - but put your quality where your prices are.  Your service is awesome - so bring your menu up to par, PLEASE.  

And its a KIDS MENU - don't charge ADULT PRICES - and just because they're kids doesn't mean they can't taste.  Even my 3 year old nephew knew your hotdog was crap.

1 star for the food/menu and pretty much everything BUT the service...which earned you one more lousy star.
author: Fräulein J.

description:
You know, I've been to alot of Hard Rock Cafe's and this one falls short. They used to be on Van Ness ave. It was a bigger restaurant with alot more memorabilia. Parking sucked at that one though. So the move over to Fisherman's Wharf was definitely better. Plus the foot traffic on FW is way better. However that's the only thing that got better.

The service at the FW location is definitely not very good. The waitress during my last visit treated me like I was interrupting her. Well excuse me biatch! 

I ordered the steak fajitas. Eh! I should have ordered the cardboard with a side of plastic. Would have definitely been tastier. The other Hard Rocks definitely seem to have better food, This one missed the boat.

Now , I know they rotate the memorabilia every so often, but this one really never has anything I'm interested in seeing. Vegas? Oh yeah. Florida? Defintiely! Boston? Yep! SF? Not so much.
author: Bill L.

description:
I believe I was impressed because it was New Years and they were literally rocking I mean they were rocking!!!!!

After the fireworks ( in my heart) were done shooting off the boyfriend and I and his bff decided to take a walk back to the car.....when we passed by the Hard Rock cafe it was a New years party which cost 25 dollars to get inside we were standing there debating if we were going to go inside or not all of a sudden my boyfriend tells the person at the door that he was in VIP and that we were his guest......we stolled right in like rock stars and it was popping like Pop Rocks They had a cover band the bar wasn't expensive the people were friendly..........

I will have to go there and maybe have some dinner!!!!!!! and give a different Yelp!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Veronica B.

description:
My family and I decided to go visit the pier for dinner one night. After much debate as to which restaurant to eat at; we decided on the Hard Rock Cafe. We were in the mood for some burgers, and some good old classic rock music, and thought we'd look for certain bands' memorabilia after the meal. 

Upon walking into the cafe we were greeted by some very lovely hostesses. They were kind and let us know we there was a 15 minute wait for a party of five. No biggie, we decided to walk around and check out some of the memorabilia. 

Our 15 minutes was up, and then we followed a hostess to a table. Our server, Jason, greeted us shortly after being seated and got our drink order. He returned shortly with our drinks, and then proceeded to take our orders. He was exceptionally courteous, and very friendly with my little brother and sister. Our food took slightly longer then we had expected, but our server kept us entertained with some light conversation. He apologized for the wait for our food once it got to the table, and got us a few remaining items we wanted with our meal.

The food was overall very tasty. Everyone but myself had burgers and enjoyed them thoroughly. I had the mac and cheese with chicken, which was very tasty as well, but I felt as though I wouldn't fit through the exit when I left.

Overall the experience was great, and when we leave on our trip we plan on checking to see if there's a Hard Rock cafe we can visit.
author: David M.

description:
Keeping this SHORT

I never like Hard Rock Cafe. It seems so touristy. The burgers here SUCK! You can get a better burger at Jack in the Crack for way cheaper and way better!
author: Juliane N.

description:
Talk about blast from the past!  I haven't been to Hard Rock since it used to be on Van Ness Avenue!   And the hotel in Vegas doesn't count.

This place at Pier 39 is surprisingly small!  Smallest of the few Hard Rock Cafes I've been to in my life.  Music is still extremely loud - so I'm yelling most of the time to my hubby who is sitting next to me.  Cool rock memorabilia on the walls.

I had the bacon cheeseburger.  Pretty good.  Juicy meat cooked just right, crisp bacon, and a hunk of melted cheese.  The fries were just OK.  I think I've been spoiled by seasoned fries.

Hubby had the Legendary 10oz burger.  The thing was huge!  And he finished it all.  Dang!  Bacon, cheese, fried onion ring...  and the usual fixings'.  Bravo.

Way too full to even think about dessert.  Nice long walk through Pier 39 after dinner to work off some of that bacon and cheese.
author: Denise M.

description: Two-and-a-half decades ago, it was hip to wear their logo, and in any city where they had set up shop, crowds lined up to chow down on burgers in an overwhelmingly loud sea of musical memorabilia. Its relocation from Van Ness to Pier 39 emphasized its appeal to the tourist trade, but I think even they have lost interest with the passing of time. The menu is as varied as that at TGI Friday's - fajitas, baby back ribs, grilled fish, chicken, salads, sandwiches, and the like - and the food is no better or worse. I never understood the need to eat in a headache-inducing environment in my younger days, and I certainly don't now.
author: Gourmet G.

description: I had a burger. I am not a big red meat guy but it was good. Not great. The chocolate desert was very very very good. The service was mediocre to bad tourist location I will take that into consideration. But the worse part NO ESPRESSO...
author: Michael M.

description:
Only came here for a quick drink...i was in DESPERATE  need of some alcomahol so I figured why not!

No newcastle, no blue moon, not even coors!!!

The reason I liked this place was for the old music and sick music videos!

I will only come here again when I don't feel like walking across the street to a local bar...I'm lazy, what can I say!
author: Alicia C.

description: The one upside was our waitress, she was friendly and helpful.  She explained things from the menu.  The prices are very high for what you get.  A hambuger is $17  a bit much for a nothing special hamburger.  Mine came with sweet potato fries which were not particularly good.  They were soggy, and didn't have much flavor.  The fries so had a wierd flavor like the oil was old.  The regular fries that came with our fish and chips, and fried shrimp also were very mediocre had a wierd flavor and were overly salted.  The fish and chips were cooked ok but had a flavor we didn't like, and she tried to get the manager to take it off our bill.  The manager came by and asked if we were alright, and if we needed any refills.  We said we were alright and that was it.  100 for 3 people and a very medicre meal.  If it weren't for our waitress it would lokely have been a 2star.  I am not likely to go back which is a shame because the one thing going for them is there is a nice atmoshpere in the restaurant.
author: David W.

description:
It's an all right Hard Rock. I've eaten here once and really wasn't impressed. I excepted it to be pricey, but the service and the food wasn't as good as a lot of the others I've been to. 
 It has your usual rock memorabilia, the beer and burgers. There's better placed to go to if you are at the Wharf.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Hard Rock Cafe is a such an amusing experience.   Perfectly located in the middle of the mecca that is San Francisco Tourism -- Pier 39, I went to check out the beautiful xmas tree that stands about 3-4 stories high just outside the restaurant.  Ahhh... so peaceful... so lovely... so completely opposite of the chaos you experience walking into Hard Rock.  

So, if you've been living under a rock, or at least did so in the 80's when "hard rock" t-shirts were all the rage, then you should know that this joint is in-your-face LOUD.  Get good at reading lips, because you won't be able to hear anything your waiter is saying.  Understand that it's not worth arguing over how expensive the bill is because hell, they won't here you anyway... and I would highly recommend sharing your meal - portions are huge and aren't worth taking home.  The food is there only to compliment the tourist, rockish experience, and is not meant to be the center of your attention.  You can have better bar-food at any other real bar in San Francisco.  

I do have to say this - if you are in another country and are starving for a typical American burger, then go to the local Hard Rock - it's like a cultural American embassy.   

Net-net - I'm so glad that Hard Rock was open late after all the other tourist restaurants close - and the tree made it all worth my while. :)  Happy Holidays!
author: Maulie D.

description: I can't deny I  had a nice time here. The server was probably one of the friendliest guys I've met; he made our whole group laugh all night. However, my dish was unforgettably unfortunate. I ordered the jambalaya (one of my favorites), and while he warned me ahead of time that it wasn't traditional jambalaya, I didn't realize how non-traditional he meant. And by non-traditional, I mean, NOT jambalaya. It was basically rice, vegetables, and chicken, all of which were bland and dried out . It wasn't flavorful, let alone spicy. And for the price of the meal, it definitely was not worth it. I should have gotten the twisted mac and cheese or hell, gone somewhere else alltogether.
author: Nikki I.

description:
Got sucked in here for lunch last weekend. Visiting gf's parents love the tourist stuff.

Hard Rock Cafe is such a terrible terrible place in the food world of restaurants.  Placed strategically among all the bad tourist things of the wharf, this place preys upon mostly American tourists looking for something familiar when they should be grabbing a chowder or oysters at the ferry building. But  they are also getting rapped for it. The Hard Rock Cafe burger is $11/12 !!!!  And it's nothing special at all. The staff mostly look silly in they're pieces of "Rock Flare." Many had facial piercing and died hair... and while I'm totally for being unique and expressive, the restaurant setting made them feel cheap and out dated., almost forced into "being alternative."

Of course mid-meal, someones birthday had to be called out by a jack ass standing on a table demanding everyone say happy birthday.....I almost lost it....especially since the guy was trying to be all spontaneous rock 'n roll about it.....its hard to be rock n roll in white sneakers and black shorts, though he was sporting a metal chain necklace and probably a nickelback tattoo.

God, maybe I should not say these terrible things, but then i think about the place, and I can't contain myself. 

Please be Advised, DO NOT GO HERE if you are visiting SF. Let you're friends who live here suggest places, or find Yelp and search a random neighborhood.
author: Jimmy L.

description: I love hard rocks because of the atmosphere and I have been to quite a few of them, but the service at this hard rock was almost non existent. How long does someone have to wait for a drink or for a refill or maybe just to put in your order?? Customers are not put first at this place which to me is the biggest reason not to go to a restaurant. Once we got out food everything was fine, but who wants to wait over an hour for classic easy to make american food?
author: Sarah G.

description:
Sure the server was helpful and did his best to pay attention to us, but the food was just filling for a long day of walking and touring. It was too expensive, too salty, and well just a disappointment. 

If you have the money to spend here for a hearty lunch with extra sodium, give it a go. If not, don't even bother.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Typically a tourist trap.  OK... I loved the place as a youngster when it was on Van Ness.

Food is not memorable... just the experience of being around all of that rock n' roll memorabilia.  Service is nothing to yelp about.

Nothing really that spec-f-ing-tacular.
author: Emily S.

description: Didn't have food at this establishment, but the atmosphere is always fun. If I was going to recommend something off their menu I'd say the haystack salad, It's delicious. My friend says their mac n cheese is good too. Drinks were ok, The long island was tasty.
author: Tami T.

description: You know how Hard Rock cafes are all over the world ;-)
author: Max72

description:
It's been several years since visiting this place, and I have no memory of what food I ordered.  Yeah, it's that good.

I do remembering ordering a drink or two, probably various margaritas, but that's about it.

Really, the only true memory of going here that night was that another member of my group left something there, and never got it back.  Not really the fault of the restaurant, but it agitated the group for the rest of the night.
author: Garett T.

description: I came with a group and they didn't even give is the amount of space we needed. They had told us since our other guests were late, they had to give away our table. They didn't even tell us our table was given away. The food was good, but i wouldn't recommend for large groups.
author: Emily K.

description: This place is so beautiful. I love the art work and displays. The music is amazing. I ate hickory cheeseburger with fries and fruitalapooza to drink. Everything was soo tasty! I will definitely come back here more often!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Although our big group had to wait, our service was OUTSTANDING!

The staff even allowed our group to sing several songs!

Thanks for setting a great tone for our entire trip on night one!!
author: Lem C.

description: yea go spend your money elsewhere asked for a well done burger got an almost bloody burger. Especially the price its real expensive for something you can buy at carls.
author: Robert C.

description: Back in the day the Hard Rock was the place to go.  Now it's the place to go if you want to look cool in front of your kids.  Paid $65 for a plate of nacho's (with meat), and 6 beers.  Lame.
author: Rob N.

description: Typical Hard Rock cafe experience. Burger comparable with any of the other locations and beverages as well. Staff (I was seated at the bar) very friendly and attend on me finishing my drinks. Surely will go back
author: C S.

description: Don't ask me why I came. It wasn't really my choice. The food blows, it's as simple as that.
author: Scott M.

description: My husband insisted that we would go to Hard Rock... Whenever we are oversees we look forward to going there as the food is amazing; long story short we went for a nice dinner.. We were greeted by a nice hostess, she told us that the wait was 20 minutes so walked around the pier and were immediately seated after 20 minutes.. Our server was very quick to come by and got our order; she was friendly and efficient. we tried chicken wings and the nachos.. And side house salad.. House salad was made from very old lettuce, it was so old that lettuce turned yellowish and brown.. Chicken wings were extremely dry and the nachos were basically chips.. There were several jalapeño peppers on top, not more than 10 beans, 1 scoop of sour cream and very old tomatoes.. It was nothing like we had before.. Good thing is we had a nice server, bad thing is we live in San Francisco and after yesterday's meal, we can never go back there..
author: Seda M.

description:
Actually 1 1/2 stars.
The wife and I were at the wharf one afternoon and we were hungry. The Crab House had an overpowering fishy smell, so we decided to check out the HRC.  I never went here when it was on Van Ness because there was always a line.

 You walk through the gift shop before you get to the eatery. Overpriced trinkets made in China--I'll pass. The place has music blasting and LCD screens are everywhere along with cool memorabilia like Little Richards suit , the Beatles gold records or  so and so's guitar, etc..., The booth we were seated at  was all  hard wood with no padding. Right there, we wanted to leave. We both have delicate backs and sitting on hard surfaces and paying big money is no fun.

The menu items are your typical TGI Fridays/Chili's fare, but those places taste like Chez Pannise compared to here. My wife's salmon was overcooked and dry with little flavor. I ordered their famous fajitas and they also lacked flavor, with chewy steak and bland chicken. We didn't even finish all our food and it cost almost $50. We kind of felt  ripped off. We had a similar experience at the Planet Hollywood in London. Yeah, they're kind of cool places but the food is an afterthought. When will I learn?
author: Jim K.

description: I visited hard rock cafe the last weekend with my friends. Most people come to hard rock cafe because have delocious food and coctails i ate hamburguer with a strawberrys juice , a lot of people love the nachos from hard rock cafe so my friend ordered that in my opinion that nachos its so spicy and i dont like that buy my friend loves that nachos. This restaurant is popular for the food and the prices.
author: Yimmer Alfonso S.

description:
got there early on a sunday lunch for our group on 8 + 2 kids... and they quickly accomodated us.

it was loud because of some soccer craze going on. 

the food seemed fine: a pulled pork sandwich, linguini and a couple others i can't remember.  i had the chicken club sandwich which was suprisingly good. i ate half there, and just ate half for my lunch today.  

the pros: they were accomodating, pretty quick to serve and resolve issues. 

the con: i asked if instead of fries, i could get a salad instead.  When the bill came, they charged me $6 for lettuce.  are you serious, AFTER i asked TWICE if the fries could be substituted. 

Here's the best part, when the waitressed if it was "OKAY" [that i still be charged].  um. No. 

i was polite and so were they. she did come back to wish me a happy birthday and said good bye - so i give her props for that. 

oh, and the other pro: the mixed berry lemonade made with gin, vodka, rum, fresh fruit for under $10 bux.   either my tolerance for alcohol has really taken a dive or it was a pretty strong drink. either way... i was a happy birthday girl indeed... BEFORE noon. :P
author: Milly S.

description: This was insanely expensive. 20$ for mac and cheese with 1/4 of a chicken breast on top. It would've been ok if the mac and cheese wasn't so terrible. It was the worst thing I have ever eaten. I will never be back. Save your money and eat at almost anywhere else on Pier 39.
author: Trevor L.

description: Super fun! Great music, fun wait staff, good food, And an awesome manager who worked with my allergies and even made a special sauce for me! The fries are done in a special fryer so they are gluten free!! Hooray (:
author: Jay Z.

description:
Don't go to the Hard Rock Cafe if you're in San Francisco because you're in F*$#ing SAN FRANCISCO! Try something that you can't get where you are from, unless of course The Hard Rock Cafe is the different thing. Too harsh, I know, but I know someone that won't eat anything different and it ticks me off.

It's ok American food. Better off cooking at home and making something that tastes better.

Cheers.
author: S D.

description:
I loved Hark Rock on Van Ness when I was a kid.... but it seems that it has lost its former glory.  On this particular visit, we did not have to wait to be seated, the waitress was nice and did a decent job, the drinks were so-so, BUT the food was YUCK. The BBQ pulled pork was way to salty and just not very good and the "homemade" onion rings left something to be desired and the fact that they charge 3.50 extra for them is outrageous. It's unfortunate because San Francisco has such AMAZING places to eat and THIS crap hole is what some people will take with them as a representation of San Francisco cuisine. 

what a shame... Hard Rock should get it together. They are doing San Francisco an injustice!
author: D G.

description:
Don't eat here, just drink! The drinks are good, albiet expensive. 
but worth it for the atmosphere. 
went on a date here and it was fun!
author: Gina B.

description:
I've enjoyed my 40 year relationship with the world wide, well known and consistently great rock and roll burger joint that came to life in London and spread like a great idea always does, to become the universal standard for the premium burger.  I remember opening day of the 1st San Francisco Hard Rock at Van Ness and Clay when  the lines that formed daily for decades and still form, because what they do, they do extremely well.  Restaurants, single or multi unit, that last more than ten years are doing a lot of things right, and Hard Rock might be one of the best multi unit restaurants that has stayed true to their mission while innovating and developing products and ideas that attract and keep their enormous audience.

So let's get down to brass tacks, the burger.  I'm going to factor in the whole experience, not to justify what some call a pricy menu, because the Hard Rock is about entertainment that appeals to every age and demographic known to man.  So looking at the simple but hunger pain inducing menu was perfect accompaniment to the music, rock and roll artwork and authentic historic relics collected from so many great performers.  So we're having a great time already and our waitress appears and in her sexy way asks if we're ready for a drink.  I was going to order an Arnold Palmer Iced Tea but overheard a guy nearby order a Bobby Boemer so I asked what made it different and she said instead of lemonade, they added about 20% Cranberry juice to the tea and WOW, what a great, perfectly sweetened drink.  They've got a full bar with good wine and beer lists to boot and plenty of stuff that appeals to kids.

Back to the burger, again!  I ordered their signature which is a 10 oz. patty of really good beef cooked to order with 2 slices of cheddar on a toasted, unseeded made to order bun.  Fries came with the burger and it was a generous portion that were hot and perfectly crisp on the outside and perfectly semi soft on the inside.  The fresh onion, tomato and lettuce with some sliced pickle chips were on the side of the open faced burger so they kindly leave the customer in charge of finishing the presentation to their own preferences.  Condiments were also on the side and all I wanted on this big, beautiful baby was some good mayo which they provided in a generous ramekin.  I put some mayo on the bun top and put it together for my 1st bite, and damn, it was so good.  Quality beef cooked perfectly in harmony with the cheese, bun, produce and condiments served with crisp, hot fries is almost the perfect meal for this burger guru, and the Hard Rock version really ROCKS...if you're searching for a really top notch burger, when was the last time you went for a Hard Rock burger?
author: Stu S.

description:
THE WORST HARD ROCK CAFE EVER INVENTED!
(I don't know this ... but DONT GO!)
Over-priced shitty food, bad service, and lame-ass loud music.

Don't eat here - unless you are looking for somthing to complain about.
author: bettie p.

description: Does everybody at the Wharf think their customers have all the time in the world? Because service is always so, very slow. HRC is no different. The service was horrible, the food was not good. There isn't much else to say about this place. The memorabilia is the only thing that was anywhere near cool.
author: Sara K.

description: I was not satisfied with this visit. We did not go out of our way to come and eat here. We were looking for a place to eat after visiting Alcatrez. I would have that this place would have been a WAY lot better, but it was such a disappointment. The service was horrible, the waiter we got was just horrible. She was rude and so slow. The food on top of it was nasty. The burger we ordered had cheese on it that was not even melted and for the price of the plate was just not worth it.....I would have rather eaten somewhere else.....Go somewhere else!!!!
author: You Would Like To Know S.

description:
3.5..

This particular location has a stage where my local favorite band has come to perform LIVE.  As for the food, it's your typical American cuisine..& it's not very memorable, although I do remember one of the pizzas as being okay.  I also like that they have memorabilia on the walls. Though they may be a little cheesy, they always serve as a  topic of conversation.

The music and people are fun, but I'd rather go to that corner stand they have down the street and get some authentic AND fresh clam chowder!  *mmmm**
author: Rinne R.

description:
For a place that prides itself on specialty drinks, maybe they should consider pouring some booze into them, rather than mix and lime concentrate. I don't need to get rip roaring drunk on one drink or end up staggering out of the place slurring about how much I love my friends, but seriously, these drinks were lame. 

We had some burgers here that were okay. The nachos were cold and unpleasant. It's Hard Rock, should I really expect more? The only other Hard Rock I've been to was in Amsterdam and it was just as bad. There, I got smacked in the head by an unsecured window when a sudden gust of wind blew through the restaurant. Their idea of good customer service in that event was to move me & hubby to another table. They promptly sat some different tourists at the window table. I think it was a conspiracy to punish tourists who only go there because nothing else is open in the middle of the day. 

Well, I guess that Hard Rock is off my list of joints to try. If I'm going to do chain places I'll stick to Chili's.
author: Denise L.

description:
I ate here maybe about 4 years ago while visiting San Francisco (as part of a 2-week California vacation), and I discovered a dish here that I remembered enough to order every following time I ate at a Hard Rock and was able to order from the regular menu (At both the Orlando and New York locations I was with school and we were given a special group discount menu with limited choices, so the regular menu was not an option either of those times).  What is that entree, you ask?  It was the twisted mac'n cheese (which is listed as the twisted mac, cheese, and chicken, but since I do not mix meat with dairy, I always order it without the chicken).  A bit spicy the first time I ordered it, but it was really not that bad as long as I had enough lemonade to wash it down.  

This Hard Rock is located in Pier 39, one of my favorite places to go in San Francisco, so if the mood strikes, grab a bite at the Hard Rock and then walk off the calories around the pier :)
author: Dana B.

description:
We have been to Pier 39 so many times, never stopping at Hard Rock cafe, but today we decided to try it. I guess one reason was that I got a coupon for 15% discount on my cellphone via bluetooth !!! kewl AND scarey.

Nehow, we all had fun there. Listening to the good rock (while watching on the TV) and food was not great, but not bad either. The waiters are nice.. so I think we'd go back again.
author: Mayank R.

description: The atmosphere is decent. The service is mediocre, and the food tastes cheap. Prices are high. Basically a glorified TGIF. Once is enough for me.
author: C K.

description: The prices were outrageous! The wait was about an hour, the food wasn't great and the waitress was way too pushy. She checked up on our table every 5 minutes and when she wasn't checking up she was looking over at our table. There was no way we could eat in peace. Won't be back anytime soon.
author: Nick O.

description: I've been to this Hard Rock before. I was there last night seeing my new fave local band,  Finding Stella, who rocked the joint. I took my youngest daughter and we were celebrating her birthday. We did not eat here since we wanted to enjoy dining at a local restaurant, rather than a chain (we went to the Steps of Rome). We did however enjoy some drinks while watching the band. I had the "RockaRitas" and my daughter enjoyed a pomegranate martini. The guy waiting on us was really friendly and good. I can't say the same about the male bartender behind the bar. He was not real friendly towards me. :(  Anyway I'm really glad to see the HRC has awesome live bands playing there!
author: DeDe K.

description:
It was okay.

I honestly felt like I coulda spent less and got the same kinda food at a bunch of other places...

But I'll give it this much, the atmosphere was great and the music was cool...

I wouldn't mind takin people whose visiting the city here..
author: Mike V.

description:
not the best of the hard rocks that i've been to. a LOT smaller than the one in Vegas and LA; can't really blame them though... SF doesn't strike me as a place that would be super excited to see a hard rock cafe (especially at pier 39. out of all places in the city to put one lol). 

it's pretty crowded in here. not that there are a bunch of people waiting to eat but you have the tourists wandering in and out of the store and restaurant. the hostess doesn't really facilitate the people to stay in one area (which she shouldn't i guess) so it gets really shuffle-ly when you're waiting to get seated or taking a look around. 

i really appreciated how they were really accomodating for my daughter. we had her in a stroller and they offered to keep our stroller off to the side in the front while we ate so we didn't have to lug it to our table. the service was fast and friendly too. as for the food.... a little pricey. i think the cheapest thing is 12.99 for a pulled pork sandwich. i dropped 15 dollars for their granny smith burger, TOTAL WIN! SOOO GOOD..... BUT my husband felt ripped off. his cajun burger wasn't phenomenal, not bad... but not 15 dollars good. he should have got what i got. freakin' apple burger..... mmmmmmmmmmmmmm.

i didn't use the restroom while i was there. looking around i actually couldn't see it from where i was sitting so i just held it in. lol. my husband went to the bathroom and was pissed... THERE WAS A LINE! when is there ever a line for the guys' bathroom?! he was upset. 

all in all... i guess i would come back. it's a pretty cool place, not the most comfortable though. my husband says he'll order the apple burger to go next time.
author: Abi U.

description: I have been a regular at Hard Rock Cafe San Francisco since 1986 when it was at its old location.  I come to the "new" cafe at least once a month, mainly for the merch.  The staff in the Rock Shop is awesome, especially Ian.  He always remembers me and keeps me up to date on the latest pins.  Thanks, Ian!
author: Cheryl B.

description: It was my first time here. My boyfriend was begging me to come here so I finally agreed. I was pleasantly surprised. I was afraid the music would be so loud that it would be distracting from our conversation but it was at a good level. They even played a song from the Rocky Horror Picture Show which won some points over with me. Our server Harleen was fantastic. Very knowledgeable about the menu and gave us some very good drink recommendations. I thought she worked there for years but later learned she's only been working for a few weeks. I got the fajitas which were okay, nothing to write home about. It was expensive for the quality of the food, but they made up for it in the atmosphere and customer service. Ask for Harleen to be your server!
author: Scarlett Y.

description:
I agree with the other reviewers here...the Hard Rock in San Francisco, located on Pier 39 is most assuredly a "meh" kind of place.  Sure the memorabilia is cool, as is the general vibe of the place, but the food?  The food needs some help.

My meal was, as they say, a hot mess.  I had the "Regional Favorite", the North Beach Chicken sandwich, with the following description from the Hard Rock menu:

"With influence from the Italian neighborhood, North Beach in San Francisco, this sandwich comes with grilled chicken, walnut pesto, Chipolte aioli, a three onion marmalade, tomato, lettuce and Jack cheese on toasted bread."

Does that not sound pretty frickin' tasty?  Too bad the pesto was bland, the chipotle had no kick, the onion marmalade was MIA...overall the sandwich was completely forgettable.

Save yourself some dough, and check out the other establishments at the wharf.
author: Brent M.

description: Visit the Hard Rock on 08/21/10 seemed packed but was greeted by friendly staff and no wait time to be seated. Fast service and friendly waitress nice decor not a bad place just kinda cramp and a limited menu.
author: Norm G.

description:
Only go to this place if you are a tourist cause no one treats you with respect there and they obviously believe they can get away with it.

Upon arriving with a group of ten, on a sunday night, it was not busy. When my friend tried to make a reservation, the hostess said no. Then, when my friend tried another time, I think it was a manager who said yes to her reservation. Whatever, the point is, the staffs are not knowledgable.

With that said, you would think the service would be great and you would get your food quickly right? Well, bull! My friend's burger came luke-warm. My nacho cheese was horrible too because the cheese was barely melted and the chips tasted kinda stale.

I guess the service was aite but the overall experience dragged it way down.

W.e., I never have a good time at Hardrock. I been to the one in Miami and it was horrible too. stay away if you can!
author: Chen N.

description:
After waiting almost an hour and a half after the hostess said our wait would be only 45-50 minutes, the new manager (formerly of the HRC St. Louis - treated our party of 10 to two appetizers.  

Our waiter - Alex from Moldova then proceeded to treat us with the most respect and class I've ever seen when dining at a HRC.  

Third only to Disneyland and Times Square HRCs, Pier 39's HRC is chock full of tourists, locals, and children at any given time.  While the food was OK, the atmosphere was lively and children were welcome. 

Great job Mr. Manager and Alex for taking care of us.
author: Under P.

description: Living close by, I go to Pier 39 and that area often but very rarely step inside the doors of the Hard Rock Cafe. Yesterday, when I was showin' a friend some touristy spots, we stopped in here to get something to drink. Cornelius was our waiter. You know those places that you go back just because of staff? Not many, eh? Well, I will definitely be going back to see Cornelius! He's funny, entertaining, quick-witted and a great server. Drinks were yummy and the nachos were good. That's as far as we got! I'm gonna play tour guide again soon and make sure we go here and sit in Cornelius' section. :)
author: Mindy T.

description: This is a great restaurant. Great customer service. Great food. Just a little too pricy. Maybe it is the name on the restaurant. IDK...? Their food is not worth as much :-(
author: Cecilia B.

description:
This place is nice if you want to spend tons of $$ for a regular burger.  The Hubs and I were spending the day at Fisherman's Wharf and HRC was convenient. We order the Potato Skin appetizers, I had the SOB burger while the hubs had a regular cheeseburger that apparently was worth $15.99. Did they charge us extra for the catsup?? Why would a burger cost so much in a not so upscale restaurant?? Our potato skins arrive about 15 minutes after we ordered it - which I guess isn't so bad in a semi busy restaurant. They were crispy, cheesy & lacking bacon - it had maybe a couple spinkles of bacon - I prefer more!! Anyway, so my SOB burger raved about a "spicy chitpole" sauce with gucamole. So can anyone tell me why my gucamole was brownish instead of the usual green? Ahh must be cuz they don't know how to throw some citrusy juice in it like typical gucamole? It's not rocket science! And another thing, why did  my spicy chitpole sauce lacking spice? Granted, I did have the roasted pepper taste, however no bite! The Hubs enjoyed his rather average bacon cheeseburger - they kind of did some over kill on the saute onions - I didn't not want to kiss him after that one!!

After all my ranting, the one good thing about this place is the memorabilia!!
author: Kellie C.

description: after a long touristic walk on the fisherman's wharf queued up at hard rock cafe. it will be a  good idea to make a reservation atleast 45 min before you get a table. but the restaurant supervisor luis baltodano made up for the wait. he took care of all the delays/goof up that the waitress did and ensured we had an excellent time.
author: Manny T.

description: Was the worst of the Hard Rocks Ive been in even though I have only been in a really cool on in Vegas rooftop patio views of the strip make payin high prices worth it and the one in seattle with its third floor deck and firepits overlookin pike place and the sound. So why is this one like something you would find in a mall and its small crowded and dark way to expensive for what you get they say you get what you pay for just not here.
author: michael c.

description: Good restaurant, nice service and free wi-fi! WOW! Not really. I had to wait 30 minutes and there were like 5 free tables. But other than that, great food. Plus it's located on Pier 39! But it's a little too noisy.
author: Bob L.

description: As far as Hard Rocks go, I'd have to say this one is about average.  The food is the same (always good in my book) and they have enough famous crap to keep you occupied while you wait for your food.  The experience of eating here is something you must try, but if you've been to other Hard Rocks, there's no need to come here unless you love the food.
author: Brooke R.

description: I came here on a Friday afternoon w/ my BF. We were seated promptly, I ordered the BBQ pulled pork sandwich. It was alright, nothing special. I also had the exotic margarita which was watered down. The server was nice but forgot my BF's order of clam chowder. Overall this place is pretty overrated.
author: Andy D.

description: Best chicken tenders in the city...yes it is a pain to get here, but it is definitely worth it!  Sometimes you just can't beat simplicity such as chicken tenders, fries and a coca-cola!
author: ELIZABETH W.

description: Over priced, over touristy, and overrated.  The food is fine, but just isn't worth the price.  I'd rather walk across the sidewalk to Wipeout for a real, big burger....Ohhhh, Hard Rock charges so much for its mediocre food because of all the old clothes/guitars hanging from its walls.  Oops, I forgot....
author: Nate V.

description: I really liked this hard rock cafe iv been to a few in the past that we're a little bit better but this place was still pretty good great music if your a rock lover and the service was very fast our waiter was super nice and kept checking on us dispite how busy it was the only thing is the music there does get pretty loud I like it but if you don't like loud music or were looking to eat somewhere where you can talk probably not the place for you
author: Marina H.

description: I met up with my friend and his girlfriend here today......we live in a city that has the best restaurants in the world and why we went here for lunch was a real mystery!  Anyway....I ordered a Chicken Club.....NO MAYO and well done fries.  Coincidentally, my friend ordered the same but his was NO AVOCADO.   Guess what......his Chicken Club came with NO AVOCADO and NO MAYO........mine came with MAYO.  Come on people get it right.   The waitress was very apologetic and she offered me a beer....nice gesture.   The sandwich was so so as I expected......still don't know why we had lunch here.
author: Alex S.

description: Came here for the second time a few days ago. Tried their hickory burger  and it was just ok. Kind of dry, not tender. I have had way better burgers that were less than 15 dollars. No problems with our waiter he was good. It just seems that they overcharge because of the tourists and location which is understandable.
author: Darius A.

description: It's a Hard Rock Cafe. They are all the same. Food is ok. Drinks are ok. I'm just glad there was an open space at the bar on Saturday afternoon. It hit the spot to have 2 huge drinks and nachos, however, the nachos weren't the best. Luckily the drinks helped me forget how bad the nachos were.
author: Kari M.

description: I really can't be a hater of this place. Last time I went it took an unusual amount of time for the server to come by. Surprisingly though, the server apologized and two managers came by our table to do the same, and offered all of us free dessert (mind you, we really only waited 20-25 minute when we really should have only waited 10. So for 15 extra minutes, free dessert isn't bad at all!) The food itself is pretty typical American chain-food style. But with that kind of service and care, I gotta bump it up a point!
author: Simon L.

description: It's okay.  I wouldn't have dropped in if it weren't for being hungry and in the vicinity of the Cafe.  If you've never been to a Hard Rock, it's a noisy environment--not a place to dine in if you can't stand loud music blasting while you're eating or conversing.  The food is decent.  The waitstaff were friendly and enthusiastic about the music.  I'd recommend it as a last resort, to both locals and tourists.
author: Marsha Z.

description: As a tourist, I had to check out a hard rock cafe for once in my life. Ok, so it is overhyped. Food was all right, but expensive. Even their souvenirs are overpriced! And this was back in 2004...has anything changed since then? I highly doubt it...
author: Isaiah N.

description: I'm giving the hard rock 4 stars... I'd give it three, but I gave an extra because they housed the cd release party of my friend's uncle's band.  and they're awesome.  They charge $6 for one stella, and beth l (who bought my drinks) paid $60 for the six drinks we had... unacceptable.  I had TONS of fun though, and I don't care.
author: Caleb D.

description: It's costly purely due to its location but other than that the food is pretty good and so the you must exercise hard to burn it all off even sans any drinks!  I went during pinktober (Breast Cancer Fundraiser) & the music was great and the waiter was a very hard worker.  All the people enjoyed themselves and my pal & I danced our asses off!
author: R C.

description: I haven't been here since the summer, but I won't be going there again any time soon. The wait can be a bit long, especially since this is located at Pier 39 and is swimming with tourists. With that said, the memorabilia on the walls are definitely cool, and their gift shop is kick ass -- prices are pretty reasonable there. But as far as prices go in the restaurant, expect to spend a pretty penny. My husband and I went and all we ordered was an appetizer, and then we each got our own dish... the bill ended up being like $70! The food was definitely not worth that much money, so needless to say we haven't been back since, because we won't have $70 to burn on food that's not worth it.
author: Danielle S.

description: Went here on 3 Jan 09 just to get out of the cold and have drink. Ended up eating there for lunch after viewing the menu. I had never been to a Hard Rock Cafe only because I did the unthinkable of listening to other people's opinion of how bad the place is! I was pleasantly surprised and vow to STOP making choices based on other people's opinions and the so-called FAKE reviews posted here on Yelp. The service was great, the food was nice and the memorabilia which adorned the walls was cool. I had seen a similar set up at Planet Hollywood, and Hard Rock pulled it off with the music version. It shouldn't be bashed for being in the tourist district, tourism and parking tickets is what keeps S.F. alive; be grateful I say.
author: Phillip D.

description: This place is definitely for tourists. The burgers are typical and the service isn't too great here. The art on the walls was cool. It's loud in this restaurant so don't expect a sweet soft conversation at your table.
author: Jen Y.

description: I really liked Hard Rock when it was in Van Ness.  This one is nice but it feels so touristy instead of homey like the other one.  The food and the service is about the same as the other one.
author: May A.

description:
2/14 was a long anticipated day in our home.  My twins were going to be 21 and they'd talked about this day and how'd we all party together (they're the babies of 6) for 3 years!  Sadly, 3 months ago, one of my twins passed away.  To make this day the celebration it should be in spite of this horrible loss... we decided to rent a limo for 20 and head up to the City.  We chose the Hard Rock for dinner for sentimental reasons.  Made reservations 10 days in advance and explained the circumstances and the significance of this event.  The "group manager" assured me that they would "rock your world"... and they did, but NOT in a good way!

We arrived at 8... the hostess didn't even know about us.  Our reservation for 25 was "not possible... we'll have to put 5 of your party at a separate table".  By the time that was resolved and we were finally seated, it was 8:50... half of our party was served well before the other... the food was cold (some veggies were actually frozen still!) and horrid.  An undercooked hamburger was sent back only to be nuked and returned as hard as a hockey puck!  The floor surrounding the table had food, color crayons and used napkins on it.  But the restrooms!  OMG!  The restrooms were about as disgusting as they could be!  I took pictures and I wish I could post them here.  Honestly, I've never seen anything like it!  While the poor servers did their best, they were at the mercy of bad management... we allowed 2 hours for dinner and then planned to spend the rest of our limo time seeing SF and going to a bar or two just so my son could flash his newly legal ID... but we ended up unable to make that happen, because of the time we spent at HR... we didn't even leave there until after 11 PM.  Limo home and the night was over.  

Food = horrid
Hostess = beyond rude
Manager = unconcerned
Cleanliness = Shell gas station would have been better

Skip this place.
author: Tami M.

description: If you feel like being a tourist for a day?  This is some where you want to stop by while you are taking pictures and buy I LOVE SF sweatshirts.  I usually sit at the bar because there usually is a long wait for a table in the dining area.  I had the Jumbo Combo, which I enjoyed (but ask for ranch cause eveyrhting goes good with ranch).  the other apps are really tasty.  Sit back and grab a beer and enjoy the appetizers.  The other dishes aren't that great but hey you're being a tourist and so you should expect to go to an over priced place with lots of people oooohhhhing and aaahhhhing!
author: Wendy K.

description: Eewww. Yup, this place is famous for the records and guitars on its walls, not the food. First off the music is too loud, YES, I know it's the HARD ROCK cafe but still...Had the pulled pork sandwich that I greatly disliked. It was a giant ball of pork on a bun with more BBQ sauce than pork itself and nothing else. Came with a tiny cole slaw cup that I didn't bother to taste and a tiny bean cup (in some sort of BBQ sauce also). The best part of my meal there? The water. The food is overpriced.
author: Juju B.

description: I've been here a couple of times and the service here has always been decent.  The food/price are both good...the only problem is that it can be TOO loud at this place because they play loud music and people have to talk really loud.  It's located at the Fisherman's Wharf... so it's always busy.
author: JenJen W.

description: It's fine for what it is, which is unapologetically touristy.  But they do sometimes have live music, so I go just to see the band.  The food is fine, and sometimes there's a good crowd, too, who appreciates the music.
author: Deb T.

description:
I know most people in SF will stay away from a place like this....but I really like the Hard Rock franchise.  Not only do you need a Cafe for Tourists, but it really is a cool place to hang out from time to time.  

However, I wish this Hard Rock stayed on Van Ness.....I liked it better there.
author: James B.

description: I ordered a glass of wine at this place....WHITE wine....no prices on the menu...figured I was pretty safe.....How much could that little lame, thin, watery glass of wine possibly cost?????  I don't even order a special type...just house white.....OMFG!  TWELVE bucks.  Yes, twelve dollars for about 3 ounces of house wine.  NEVER AGAIN.  Yes, I am a fool for the memorabilia, but I will never indulge in an adult beverage at this tourist trap.
author: Nancy S.

description: Cool looking place, little respect and consideration for Pier 39 employees. I ordered a cheeseburger. Even with a discount it was 13 bucks. It was nothing special, hardly worth $3. Save your money and go to in-n-out for cheeseburgers If that's what you're after. I reccomend wipeout grill and players grill. they are both located on pier 39
author: Vincent P. G.

description: The husband and I had a 2 for 1 coupon for their "legendary" burgers. They came out and looked fantastic! I ordered the BBQ burger and he got the granny smith one. They both came with fries and we got a side of honey mustard for dipping, then we split both the burgers. I make him do it so I can try more than one thing! The meat was cooked perfectly and the burgers were thick and put together well. However, never has something that looked so good tasted so bland! I could not believe it! These burgers had no taste at all! I gave the BBQ burger a one star only becasue the bacon was edible. His burger gets 2 stars only becasue it came with yummy maple syrup to put on it.
