The fries were great and so was the honey mustard. Service was quick and efficient (it was a Tuesday at 3pm). Had I not had the coupon, I would have been VERY upset to pay $15 for each of those disappointing burgers. The BBQ smokehouse burger from Chili's I had last week was fantastic at a fraction of this price. Same goes for the BBQ burger at Red Robin's. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT order burgers from Hardrock. I cannot comment as to the rest of their menu.... but the desserts looked spectacular,
author: Melanie R.

description: It's right by the pier. It's pricey. That's a given. If it's out of your price range, then it's not the HRC for you. . . we had a great time here. The staff was busy but somehow was able to fit in all of our orders in a timely manner. They also knew we had a (less-than) 1 year old with us so they were able to fit a shaded area outside (under the cover) for us . . . we were coming down from a lot of activity just before so, although some of us were hungry, we were happy to have a nice shaded place to sit and so by the time the meal arrived it seemed like perfect timing. The views along the walk were great and the staff was attentive (considering the HUNDREDS of customers there, or so it seemed) to all of us . . . we got the bill, paid, and I was happy to leave an appreciative tip. I'd definitely patronize this HRC again (which was quite unlike the East coast HRC's I've visited before, from DC all the way down to FL) . .. HRC, An institution !
author: Mark W.

description: Wow, I'm starting to enjoy this writing a review business!  At first I was a bit reticent, but now I'm on a roll!  I just want to say that I think the Hard Rock Cafe's drinks are too expensive, but they do have good bands there like Dazed and Confused, my friend's Led Zeppelin tribute band.
author: Sarah G.

description: So i'm giving this restaurant two stars. Two stars for our server because she was very friendly, outgoing, and made my friend's birthday dinner enjoyable. I wasn't in the mood for a burger,fries, grease, onion rings, or any of that fried stuff. The only other alternative was a salad or pasta. I ordered some sort of seafood pasta and it was around $24.00.  Of course, knowing me, I picked a dish that wasn't satisfying. The portion was tiny, and all I could remember were a lot of random vegetables and mushrooms which made up the bulk of the plate. I give them credit for giving me five pieces of shrimp, but still for $24.00, it was definitely not worth it. I can pay $25 for a rib eye steak with mashed potatoes at Tony's Steakhouse  for a DOLLAR more. I was quite dissapointed, and didn't really like the ambiance either. Obviously, this place is aimed towards tourists, so I didn't have high hopes going here. I don't understand why people go here when they could choose any other restaurant in the pier known for their fresh seafood entrees. After dinner was over, I had to eat a second meal because I was STILL hungry =(
author: leanna w.

description: Terrible service, mediocre if not just plain bad food. I was eating with 3 other people and 3 of us got our food and waited 10 minutes before getting the 4th person's food (after asking 2 different waitresses to check on the 4th dish.)   I will not be back.
author: Ashley R.

description: so, come for the t-shirt, not the food.  its too crowded, we got seated by the toilet,  he forgot to order one of my m other-in-law's items, and for the price, i'd rather go to in and out burger for cheaper and way better food.  i knew it would suck, and said so-but the minority loses out, and the winners find out for themselves.  oh well......
author: Dawn D.

description: Hard Rock Cafe is one of my favorite places to eat. Any time my husband and I go out of town we search for the nearest one and try it out. Unfortunately this location did not meet up to other locations I have visited, which is quit a few. Don't get me wrong the food was great, it was the service that left a dissatisfying taste in my mouth. Our waitress treated us though we were taking up her time as though she had  better places to be. Not once did she ask us for a refill and when we asked for one it was as though we annoyed her. I don't think 1 refill is too annoying on a  $60 bill. Let just say after she took our order and huffed after we asked for a refill we never saw her again.
author: Faith H.

description:
Hey, the memorabilia is great. I haven't been there for over a year now but when I did eat there Janis Joplin's guitar was at the entrance.  I was sold no matter how slow the service was. Everyone was friendly and the pulled pork sandwich was better than average.
Its the type of place were you go back not for the food or the service but for all the good vibes you get from being around objects touched by great and famous people.
author: Mark D.

description: return back to sf....stroll up northbeach...quick multiple gulps of $two guinness kennedy's....continue on north...search for food...passing fisherman's wharf and ending pier 39.....only requirement being beer and food to compliment....hard rock being safe choice for beer and food....not the best pick, but tired of walk aimlessly....enter through familiar guitar facade....familiar interiors to others....rock & roll theme...flip of menu, and deciding on round of guinness and bud light....order of nachos and sampler platter....companion bit disappointed by no shamrock etching guinness foam...loud outcry to server!....self just chuckle....just sip of beers....sampler arrival and glistening grease wonder....red tangy buffalo wings, cheeese bacon potato skins, deep fried breaded chicken strips and fried breaded onion rings...if remember correctly....standard and un-pleasing...expected....although nachos with beef....enormous, cheesy and quite the above average compliment to beer....fully loaded and not a skimpy platter.....nachos a safe pick finding.....
author: Hen A.

description: pretty chill place for some drinks.. their specialty drink are pretty pricey about 11 bucks for them. bartender was very nice didn't catch his name but he had long dreads. I ordered a Hurricane first and it was waaaaay too strong for me.... I'm a weenie lol but he was nice enough to switch it for something more mellow... extra tip for him!!
author: Raquel V.

description: The service was great--they were friendly and attentive. They took our order and delivered our food quick. It was hot and it was tasty!!! I highly recommend the nachos. The reason that I am giving this 3 stars is as follows: this employee who looked like a troll came to our table and tried to take our picture to sell us a photo and she got offended when we declined. she gave us a dirty look when we left. I do not like the set up of this place--its too dark, too cramped, music is way too loud. I miss the location on Van Ness all the time--for it was not cramped, well lit, and i loved the way they displayed the memorabillia. I will eat here again though
author: alexandria s.

description: ...i just came to have a cold New Castle, and I got what I wanted. There isn't a stage for performances and Im sure the food is just like all the other Hard Rock Cafes....... average, that's not a bad thing though. It was meh....... but i'll come back for another Cold Beerskeez though........shiaoooooooooo
author: Len C.

description: You really should try to avoid this place. The only somewhat OK thing about it is the rock and roll themed walls. The food is terrible, and expensive. The only reason we went was because it was the quickest option during a tour of Fisherman's Wharf late one evening when we couldn't decide where to eat. I really wish I had been more proactive in my dinner plans.
author: Sannah Z.

description: the atmostphere was very "san francisco hippy rock" with plenty of janis and dancing bears but the food was pretty mediocre. i got a hamburger and it tasted like one of those frozen patties, my girlfriend got a pulled pork sandwich and she liked it. pretty pricey for the portions though and pretty touristy
author: Thomas T.

description: i ate there for the first time on my birthday 1 and a half ago and i went with my best friend and boyfirend and what we ordered sucked so we ended up getting the same as him which was really good. i love the atmosphere in there its always busy and there is always life and good music. i will return again. but the spicy wings are not that great.
author: Honey B.

description: Is hard rock the worst? yes. But damn if they don't have delicious cocktails, even if they don't tell you how much they cost and all but shove a souvenir glass down your throat.
author: QItty B.

description: the out of towners were collectors of the t-shirts and wanted to check out the collectibles on the walls...guitars, "gold records"...kinda "rock food for the mickeyd set". just don't collect the shirts. mehhh burger and fries.
author: miriam b.

description: I had a great experience here.  I usually don't check out Hard Rocks, as I think they are cheesy, touristy, and don't have good cuisine.  However, I came here for a Grammy Party, and it was a blast.  They had a great DJ, cool band, great service, and a fun atmosphere.  Now, I know that every day is not a Grammy party day (and especially not an open bar and free food event).  However, the food I had was actually tasty.  It was the usual bar food:  chicken tenders, chicken wings, taquitos, burgers, pulled pork sandwiches, ahi salad, etc.  Well, maybe the last two items are not typical bar food.  Anyhow, it was actually pretty darn good.  One server really stood out to me, his name is Ernie.  He was so friendly, helpful, happy, and provided amazing service.  So Ernie if you ever read this, thank you.  I did take a look at the menu, and I do think food here is way overpriced.  So... 3 stars for the restaurant itself, and 4 stars for the experience I had.  (Go Amy Winehouse!)
author: Sarah F.

description: horrible place i took my gf to pier 39 and was trying to find a nice place to eat first time i ever been here and wont come back. i ordered the smokehouse duo combo ribs and chicken was ehh sauce wasnt too great and the gf ordered the steak= no good. Had mac and cheese on the side was lacking the cheesy taste tasted more like a spicy pasta dish. I felt discriminated here being a minority as i am the waitress try to jip me. save your money folks go somewhere else!
author: steven d.

description: Not so Rocking but still good value for money. Good choice for meat eaters and veg heads. Great setting opposite Alcatraz. Advise all to go for a stroll afterwards to let your meal go down.
author: kevansam

description: ok, this is a tourist trap type restaurant, but whenever i come to san francisco, i stop by here for lunch and always order the same thing, the cobb salad.  a little pricey for a salad, it is worth the price, for it's dressed up nice with bacon, cheese, eggs, and all the other stuff that comes in a cobb salad, only it is huge and filling.  the service is also pretty good here considering how busy it is.  this place is pretty much a worldwide known version of red robin.  when you leave, be sure to pick up a souvenir at the gift shop or for a free souvenir, order a hurricane cocktail and keep the glass.  parking?  there is a garage across the embarcadero and numerous lots around the area, but i usually park in the local safeway grocery store garage, buy something, and get 2 hrs validated parking.  i believe they do have other validated parking garages around the area, there is one by the in n out burger that validates if you buy a certain amount of stuff from the stores or restaurants from that complex.
author: will m.

description: The food here is decent.  I recommend it if you're not from around the area and don't know any other good places.  The marks that bring it down is the service.  They tend to take a long time to serve you.  It's such a busy place that you might as well have your order ready alongside any appetizers/drinks to save longer wait times.  Sometimes the waiters are in such a rush they don't listen to you.  The last waiter messed up my order (burger) in 2 ways - both on the same visit!  He ordered the wrong burger for me and he even didn't cook it to medium-well even though the menus are printed that all orders are cooked medium-well as default!  I ended up getting my burger well done - what a sad way to ruin decent meat.  I ended up eating the burger that I didn't even order because I didn't want the rest of the order we received to go cold while we wait for the new order.  I tip fairly but this one deserved the bad tip I gave him.
author: David D.
